loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Sharifa R. lives in the Gissar region. She is 45 years old, is widow, and has 2 children. She has secondary education. Sharifa is in the business of raising livestock. Until recently, she had been breeding neat cattle. But as the fodder became more expensive, maintaining neat livestock became very hard. Sharifa would like to take out the credit to purchase several sheep. She will send this small herd to the pasture until late fall.

Livestock farming is the main source of income for her family. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмонова Шарифа Джалоловна жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 45 лет, вдова ,имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее . Шарифа занимается животноводством. До сих пор она разводила крупно-рогатый скот.Но так как комбикорм очень подорожал содержать бычков стало труднее. Клиентка хочет взять кредит и купить барашков.Это небольшое стадо она отправит на пастбище до поздней осени.Животноводство я вляется единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Iberica

texts.es:
Doña Ibérica is a 32 year-old single mother from the annex Roma, she studied secondary, has a 10 year-old daughter who is in fourth grade, elementary school; she lives in the annex Roma, Provincia de Ascope La Libertad – Peru. For two years she has been selling groceries at a street corner and meat from the main avenue close to her home. She received her first loan of S/.300 from Manuela Ramos in 2007 and it was invested in groceries. She is a member of “Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II”. With the loan of S/.800, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in implementing her stand. Doña Ibérica dreams of having her own big business close to her home in order to attend to her daughter and improve her income and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ibérica esta madre soltera, tiene 32 años, natural del anexo Roma, cursó estudios secundarios, tiene 01 hija de 10 años la cual cursa el cuarto grado de primaria; vive en el anexo Roma Provincia de Ascope La Libertad – Perú. Ella se dedica hace dos años a la venta de abarrotes en una esquina y carnes en la avenida principal, cerca de su domicilio. Se inició con Manuela Ramos desde el año 2007 concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300.oo, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Romanas Luchadoras II”, Con el préstamo de S/. 800.oo, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses; lo invertirá en la implementación de su puesto. La señora Ibérica sueña tener un local grande y propio cerca de su casa para poder atender a su hija y mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S. N., 29, lives with her husband, Ben Thuon, and their one young child in the Prey Veng province. She has worked in the local food market for the last seven years, selling roast beef, chicken, and pork. She makes $4 (US dollars) per day.

Yem S. N.'s husband operates a taxi service with a large trailer attached to the rear of his motorbike. The trailer allows him to transport a large number of people at one time and he typically makes $5 (US dollars) per day. He has been running this service for the last eighteen years and needs to replace the old trailer.

Yem S. N. is asking for a loan of $600 (US dollars) for her husband to purchase a new trailer, which she believes will allow him to increase his daily income and improve the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: Purchase a new trailer

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
A. Munavvar is 62 years old. She is a widow and the loving mother of two adult children. After the death of her husband, Munavvar had to find ways to provide for herself and her two children. Munavvar is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She has always looked for ways to be an important leader by providing extra income to her home. 

Two years ago, she decided to open her own tailoring shop. Munavvar’s tailoring shop specializes in sewing European-style clothing for women, as well as the national style. In addition to sewing, Munavvar is also busy teaching sewing to young girls. Currently, she has four apprentices. 

Today, Munavvar is planning to expand her business and to hire two more seamstresses. She is requests $950 for a term of 9 months. She will use the loan money to purchase new sewing machine produced in Japan. Your support will really help her. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength and is determined to lead a better life!

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines for her expanding business.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio Cesar is requesting a loan in order to invest in improvements for his home, such as building bathrooms. He has worked as a loan analyst for a bank in New Guinea for four years. Julio Cesar has three children, the eldest of which is 18 years old and is in her second year at university. The other is 13 years old and is in 6th grade and the youngest is 11 years old and is in 5th grade. His wife works as an accountant and both contribute to bills. Julio is a professional man who is responsible, honest, and hard working. He lives in the #6 area of New Guinea, where the population grows larger every day. Currently, he is studying for a post-graduate degree at the University URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. His dream is to continue studying, be in good health, have a beautiful home in the future and have job stability so that he can support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Julio César está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como lo es la Construcción de los servicios Higienicos, trabaja como Análista de crédito en un banco de Nueva Guinea desde hace 4 años, Julio César tiene 3 hijos, la mayor de 18 años estudia 2do año en la Universidad, la otra de 13 años estudia 6to grado de Educación primaria y la niña menor de 11 años estudia su 5to grado, su esposa trabaja como contadora, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. Don Julio es un hombre profesional responsable, honesto, trabajador, vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, actualmente está estudiando un postgrado en la Univesidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño es seguir estudiando, contar con buenasalud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con todas las condiciones y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Build bathrooms.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El caballero Modesto P. V. originario del municipio de Somotillo se dedica desde muy joven al negocio de ganadería el cual con mucho esfuerzo lo desarrolla todos los días trasladando el ganado a diferentes lugares para alimentarlos y a la vez para extraer la leche de las vaquillas.

De igual manera el señor Modesto también se dedica a la actividad agrícola en la siembra de granos básicos. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra del ganado e invertir en los cultivos. Por medio de este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Caballero Modesto P. V. is a native of the Municipality of Somotillo. Since he was very young he worked in the business of livestock farming, which with much effort every day, he successfully moves the herd to different places to eat and drink, and he sees to the extracting of the milk of the female cows. In the same way, Señor Modesto also has worked at agricultural activities, growing basic grains. Today, the reason he has approached CEPRODEL is to obtain a loan to purchase livestock and to invest in a crop. With this loan, he will be able to help his family that he loves a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mrs. Pok S. lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband, 65 years old, together work making various kinds of baskets from bamboo and resell them to a broker who comes to collect at their base. Pok S. has two children. One of them sells baskets at a distant market near a Thai border and another works as a mechanic. To meet her customer demands and increase her profit margin, Pok S. would like a loan to purchase more bamboo and other materials.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo and other materials to produce more baskets.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 41 años, vive con sus dos hijos. Desde su juventud, le ayudó a su madre a atender los negocios familiares, en la actualidad la vemos  dedicada a su propio restaurante, donde recibe a sus clientes de manera muy amable, sus 15 años de experiencia avalan el buen desempeño de su restaurante. Hace un mes decidió abrir su negocio en un mejor local, ofreciendo comida de muy buena calidad, en el poco tiempo que está en este local ha adquirido rápidamente clientes, esto le da más aliento a Mercedes, para seguir trabajando en su propia fuente de ingresos económicos. Este es su primer préstamo accedido en MFP. Solicita este dinero que invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para su restaurante, como sacos enteros de arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 41 years old and lives with her two children. Ever since childhood, she has helped her mother handle the family businesses. She currently runs her own restaurant, where she kindly welcomes her patrons. Her 15 years of experience guarantee that her restaurant will do well. One month ago, she decided to open her restaurant in a better business space, where she makes high-quality meals. In what little time she has been there, she has quickly acquired customers, which really encouraged Mercedes to keep working on her sole source of income. This is her first loan with MFP. She is requesting this loan to invest it in purchasing provisions—such as sacks of rice, sugar, and legumes—for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase restaurant provisions

loans.name: Nsengiyumva

texts.en:
Greetings from J. C. Nsengiyumva in the Northern province of Rwanda! J. is 28 years old, married with one adopted child.

This young entrepreneur started his business in 2006, from capital he had saved after working as an assistant clay worker in building mud houses for the poor people in the area where he lives. 

Besides building, he also worked in the sugar factory and was able to save 130,000 Frws ($238) to start a small shop as his business. He sells different items needed in his neighborhood like beans, sugar, rice, cooking oil, fresh milk, salt, paraffin for lighting, peas, bread, clothes for both children and old people, soap, batteries, Vaseline, etc. Besides the business, he grows beans and sorghum that is used to make local brew, which is liked by many people in his village.

From this business, this entrepreneur has been able to build a house for his family and he bought a cow and goat which will be increasing his income in the near future. He employs one person to run his business.

He is therefore requesting a loan worth 400,000 Frws to start up a bakery for making bread to sell both to retail businesses and individuals. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Start up a bakery for making bread

loans.name: Osimjon

texts.en:
Osimjon B. lives in Khujand and he is married. He is 20 years old and he has been engaged in the business for 3 years. Osimjon is a student but he trades to support his young family and to help his parents, as he is an only son in the family. It is the family business and he trades in salads and pickles (Korean salads, pickled tomatoes and cucumbers). His young wife makes the stock and he trades in the bazaar.

Osimjon applied to KIVA to ask for the business development loan of 2300 STJ for 8 months for a trade outlet lease, as it is difficult to trade. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Trade outlet leasing

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El señor Fidencio P. tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le esta haciendo falta las protecciones de las puertas y ventanas. 
 Don Fidencio ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente. Está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar esta mejora lo más pronto posible ya que él y su esposa trabajan todo el día, y en la casa solo esta una hija y quieren que este segura mientras ellos no se encuentren en la casa
texts.en:
Fidencio Perez recently bought his house with a government loan, but now he needs to protect it by adding security gates on the doors and windows. He has taken out three loans with FVP, all of which he's repaid on time. He's applying for a loan so that he can make this improvement as soon as possible. He and his wife work all day and a daughter is there alone. He wants to make sure she's safe when they're not at home.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put secruity gates on doors and windows.

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu W. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Idowu sells bags of onions. He is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of onions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Yanina Zinthia

texts.es:
Yanina  es socia del Banco Comunal Sauces.
Yanina es soltera, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, Yanina estudia para Técnica dental, trabaja en un laboratorio dental, Yanina vende materiales dentales que vende a diferentes laboratorios. 
Yanina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales dentales.
Los sueños de Yanina son especializarse como técnica dental y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yanina is a member of the Weeping Willow Communal Bank. Yanina is single; she is 24 years old and lives with her parents. Yanina is studying dental technology. She works in a dental laboratory. Yanina sells dental equipment to different labs. Yanina needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be used to buy dental equipment. Yanina's goal is to specialize as a dental tech and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dental equipment

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta I., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers and public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~US$166).  SPBD loans are Eseta’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be use to maintain her business.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals and weed killer.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela I. is 58 years old and lives in the town of Tecpan, Guatemala, in the department of Chimaltenango. She is a widow and for the past two years has helped support her two unmarried daughters.

Manuela’s business is raising pigs, which she has done for nearly 30 years. In addition to this business, she also buys and sells hand-made “guipiles” (traditional Guatemalan blouses).

Manuela is requesting a loan in order grow her business. She says that in the coming season she needs more pigs and will use her loan to breed and care for them. Her dream is that her daughters have their own homes, and that she can continue to take advantage of her good health and keep working hard and moving forward.


*****************************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
*****************************************************

Manuela I. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Tecpan Guatemala departamento de Chimaltenango. Ella es viuda, y desde hace 2 años tiene bajo se responsabilidad dos hijas solteras mayores de edad. Su negocio de crianza y destace de marranos lo inicio hace 30 años, también compra y venta de tejido de guipiles a mano. Ella necesita de un préstamo para mantener su negocio, ya que en temporada necesita más marranos. Su sueño es que sus hijas tengan casas propias, aprovechando que ella esta bien de salud puede trabajar y salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and more pig food

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Tsévié, Mr T. Yao est un jeune homme plein de courage et de détermination pour sa survie. C’est ainsi qu’avec son commerce de vente de friperie dans un marché de sa localité, il arrive tant bien que mal à survivre. Actuellement, il sollicite un financement pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et avoir un stock permanent. Il pourra ainsi veiller à son épanouissement social.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Tsévié, Mr. T. Yao is a young man who is full of courage and determined to survive. With his business selling second-hand clothing at a marketplace in his town, he manages with great difficulty to survive. Currently, he's requesting financing to increase his turnover and to have a constant inventory. He will thus be able to look after himself and ultimately succeed in society.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell second-hand clothing

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora,Lucia P. quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La sra. Marta Ines C. se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de prendas en general de esa manera ofrecer mayor variadad a sus clientes. 

La sra. Mirtha Rosa M.  se dedica a la venta de articulos de merseria, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias al por mayor y venderlos obteniendo asi mayor ingreso, y variedad para su clientela.

La sra. Maria Alcira B. se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, invirtio el dinero en la compra de plateria de esa manera surtir su mercaderia y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Maria Fabiola G. se dedica a la venta aceites, carne, yerba y bebidas invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias logrando ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

La sra. Nydia Concepcion B. se dedica a la ventra de comestible, invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para la elaboracion de los comestibles logrando ofrecer variedad y buenos precios a sus clientes.

La sra. Saturnina R. se dedica a la venta de prendas en generla, invirtio el dinero en la compra de  esas mercederias al por mayor ofreciendo buena calidad y variedad de prendas a su
 clientela.

La sra. Nilda Raquel C. es costurera,  invirtio el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo,  logrando de esa manera poder producir con mas eficazcia.

La sra. Maxima E. tiene una despensa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercaderias en general, ofreciendo de esa manera gran variedad de mercaderias a su clientela.

La sra. Casiana T. se dedica a la venta de comestibles bebidas en general, invirtrio el dinero en la compra de bebidas y ingredientes para la elaboracion de los comestibles, pudiendo ofrecer mayor variedad de comestibles a sus clientes y  aumentar su ingreso.

La sra. Maria Ignacia  C. se dedica a la venta de frutas,  invirtio el dinero en la compra de frutas al por mayor, logrando obtener mayor variedas de frutas para sus clientes.

La sra. Esmelda Barreto se dedideca a la  venta de bebidas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de bebidas en general pudiendo ofrecer buena variedad de bebidas a su clientela.

La sra. Rita B. Quiñonez se dedica a la venta de comestible, invirtio el dinero en la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion de los comestibles logrando buena variedad de comestible para sus clientes.

La sra. Maria Dolores R. de se dedica a la venta de prendas invirtio el dinero en la compra de prendas en general ofreciendo  calidad y variedad de prendas a su clientela.

La sra. Lucia Angelica P. se dedica a la venta de medicamentos farmaceuticos, invirtio el dinero en la compra de    esos productos, ofreciendo buena variedad de medicamentos a sus clientes.

La sra. Mirta Graciela P. se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, invirtio el  dinero en la compra de prendas en general logrando buena variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

 La sra. Marisol O.  tiene una cantina, invirtio el dinero en la compra de golisinas, gaseosas y insumo para la elaboracion de comestibles logrando ofrecer buena variedad a su clientela.

La sra.Cinthia B. se dedica a la venta de bebidas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de bebidas en general, logrando ofrecer buena variedad de bebidasd a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The initial contact for this group was Lucia P.. She invited and organized her friends to form part of the program called Committee of Enterprising Women. Marta Ines C. sells various articles of clothing. She used the money to buy general articles of clothing to be able to provide her customers with more variety. Mirtha Rosa M. sells notions. She used the money to buy these notions wholesale. She then sells them and gets a greater income while giving her customers variety. Maria Alcira B. sells silver jewelry. She used the money to buy silver items to stock her merchandise and offer greater variety to her customers. Maria Fabiola G. sells oils, meat, herbs, and drinks. She used her money to buy this merchandise, which allows her to offer greater variety to her customers. Nydia Concepcion B. sells food. She used the money to buy merchandise for making the food. She is able to offer variety and good prices to her customers. Saturnina R. sells general articles of clothing. She used the money to buy this merchandise wholesale. She offers good quality and a variety of articles of clothing to her customers. Nilda Raquel C. is a seamstress. She used the money to buy materials for her work. This way she is able to improve her production. Maxima E. has a store. She used the money to buy general merchandise. She offers a great variety of merchandise to her customers. Casiana T. sells general food and drinks. She used the money to buy drinks and ingredients for making the food. She is able to offer a greater variety of food to her customers and increase her income. Maria Ignacia C. sells fruit. She used her money to buy wholesale fruit. She is able to get a greater variety of fruits for her customers. Esmelda Barreto sells drinks. She used her money to buy general drinks. She is able to offer a greater variety of drinks to her customers. Rita B. Quiñónez sells food. She used her money to buy merchandise to makerthe food. She is able to have a greater variety of food for her customers. Maria Dolores R. sells articles of clothing. She used her money to buy general items of clothing. She offers quality and a variety of clothes to her customers. Lucia Angelica P. sells pharmaceuticals. She used her money to buy these products and offer a good variety of medicines to her customers. Mirta Graciela P. sells various articles of clothing. She used her money to buy general clothing. She offers a good variety to her customers. Marisol O. has a food stand. She used her money to buy sweets, soft drinks, and ingredients to make food. She offers a good variety to her customers. Cinthia B. sells drinks. She used her money to buy general drinks. She offers a good variety of drinks to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general articles of clothing, silver jewelry, supplies to make food(eggs, bread, vegetables, etc.) General drink sales, fruit, dairy products, canned goods, herbs, oil, sugar

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha O. is thirty-eight years old, divorced, and has given birth to two children: one girl and one boy who are both in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Agatha is a trader. She trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well.

Agatha has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Leoum

texts.en: Leoum P. is 47-years-old and resides in the Province of Siem Reap. He is a staff member for a mobile phone company. Beside his current work, he has always cultivated a rice crop. He is married with three teenage children who are students and under his care. His wife works planting vegetables in the farm field. Leoum P. and his family always need to pay for a taxi when they want to go anywhere. He hopes to reduce the cost of transportation by using the Kiva loan to buy a motorbike for his family transportation needs. He will use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizer for growing crops.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his family's transportation.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère deux enfants, son mari est un instituteur, le revenu de son époux est insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les charges du foyer, pour l’aider elle a commencé le commerce de tissus et des articles de mercerie. Ses principaux clients sont des couturières et des tailleurs. Son stock de marchandise a connu une baisse, ce qui a diminué ses recettes. Pour se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des articles de mercerie et une quinzaine de tissus de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of two. Her husband is a teacher. Her husband’s income is insufficient for covering all household expenses. To help him, she started doing commerce in fabrics and sewing supplies. Her main customers are seamstresses and tailors. Her stock of merchandise has seen a drop, which has diminished her income. To stock up again, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy sewing supplies and about 15 units of good quality fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Jonifa Kavulavi

texts.en:
Jonifa is 50 years and married with five children. Her husband Cleb works as a driver. She lives in the Thiongo Road area, also where she does her business. 

Jonifa was introduced to KADET by her friends who had already joined the group. Thiongo Road is a peri-urban area where there are very few businesses. She sells clothes to neighbours and people in the wider area.

Jonifa hopes to build her own house which will reduce her home expenses as well as pay school fees for her children.

She also intends to build a shop for her business so that she can settle down and have a more permanent place.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in order to expand her business and sell from a more permanent location

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 55 years old and is married with five children, all of whom are independent. She sells cooked food from the front porch of her home in the evenings. Her husband is a teacher.

Mercedes has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for ten years and is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad.”  She plans to invest this loan of 1,200 soles in rice, sugar, and oil for her restaurant business.  

Mercedes has always been an active member of her communal bank and has always made her loan payments on time. With the help of her loans and her business venture, Mercedes has been able to contribute to paying household expenses. Mercedes’ dream is to build her own restaurant. At the moment, she has only one table to accommodate her customers.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, oil and other products for a restaurant business

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha O. is a Tanzanian married woman who is a small business entrepreneur. Mwanaisha is a food vendor in the Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both cooked and fried food, as well as soft drinks, to customers.

Mwanaisha has been running the business for five years. Income from her business has enabled her to meet her family’s daily needs. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Tanzanian shillings (TZS) to buy more raw materials in order to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Mercilyn

texts.en:
Mercilyn C. is from the village of Upper Langcangan. She is 41 years old. Mercilyn is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Mercilyn owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Mercilyn has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Mercilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Mercilyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Mercilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia; pertenece al banco comunal Ayni, ella es natural de la provincia de Espinar; actualmente ubicada en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y ella sola se encarga de la educación, alimentación y cuidados de sus hijos, lo cuál hace que la socia trabaje mucho y horas extras, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia aprendió desde muy pequeña a elaborar la artesanía, convirtiéndolos en bellas, vasijas, utensilios de cocina en barro, ella hace trabajos en arcilla, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio y de este modo tener mayor producción.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank "Ayni." She is originally from the Espinar province and currently lives in the city of Cusco. She is 43 years old and is a single mother of three children. She alone has been in charge of the education, feeding and care of her children. For this reason she works very hard and for long hours. She alternates her activities from the home with retail commerce. When she was very young, she learned to make handicrafts. She works in clay, making beautiful objects such as pots and earthenware cooking utensils. She is requesting a loan to continue reinvesting in her business so that she can have increased production. Julia appreciates and values the loan granted, and she pledges to make the payments on her debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for handicrafts

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria Soledad is a client of Asociación Arariwa, a Kiva partner. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means daybreak in Spanish. She is from and lives in Cusco. She is 35 years old and lives with her partner and two children, who are in primary school.

Maria Soledad has worked as a printer and graphic designer for the past nine years. She works for a company and freelances as well. She creates materials for NGOs and has, in fact, done some work for Arariwa. She can make from 1,000 - 1,500 soles per job. She will use this loan to buy more materials for her printing business such as paper, ink, etc., from wholesalers.

Maria Soledad appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for her printing and graphic design business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. runs a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has six small children. They are from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Cristina has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2007, Cristina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 31 años, vive con el amor de su vida (María), de 30 años; con ella tiene 5 pequeños hijos: Flor de 8, Charles de 6, Nique de 4, Yahaira de 2 y su último bebé, Dicson de 2 meses. Ellos viven juntos en su apacible casa propia ubicada en la selva central del Perú.

Él se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y yuca, pero también trabaja como obrero para otras personas porque aún no ha podido tener sus tierras propias. Cada día labora con mucho ahínco y las fuerzas no se le agotan porque quiere que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y lleguen a tener una profesión. Aunque no sea su tierra que trabaja, él debe hacer que produzca en cantidad y es por eso que su trabajo es bien pagado, además le gusta mucho la agricultura. Pero a Alejandro no sólo lo contratan otros campesinos, sino también viveros de grandes empresas para que les preste mantenimiento a sus plantaciones. 
Él es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a la tierra, es por eso que anhela tener varias chacras donde pueda cultivar los productos que brinda la buena tierra. Para lo cual viene ahorrando y sabe que pronto podrá cumplir sus metas.

Este el primer préstamo que Alejandro tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy responsable en cada pago, y realizarlo de manera puntual. A su vez, está muy satisfecho con los integrantes de su banco comunal porque son personas que conoce y sabe que también serán responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará su primera chacra donde cultivaré café, plátano y yuca.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 31 years old and lives with the love of his life, María, who is 30. The couple has five small children: Flor, 8; Charles, 6; Nique, 4; Yahaira, 2; and their last baby, Dicson, who is 2 months old. They live together in their own peaceful house, which is located in the central jungle of Peru. Alejandro's work is cultivating coffee, plantains and yucca, but he works as a laborer for other people, since he has not yet been able to acquire his own fields. Each day, he works with great dedication, and his energy does not run out, because he wants his children to have a good education and grow up to pursue a profession. Although it is not his own land that he is working on, he is determined to make it produce abundantly, and for that reason he is well-paid for his work; in addition, he truly enjoys farming. Alejandro is not only hired by other farmers in the countryside, but also by large agricultural companies, who hire him to maintain their plantations. He is a very hard-working man and one dedicated to the soil, and thus his desire is to acquire some plots of land where he can cultivate the products that come from the good earth. He has been saving up for this purpose, and he knows that soon he will be able to reach his goals. This is Alejandro's first loan with MFP, and he has made a commitment to be very responsible with each payment and to make them all on time. He is also very satisfied with the members of his communal bank, since they are people he knows, and he knows they will also be responsible with their payments. With the funds he is requesting, he will purchase his first piece of land, where he will cultivate coffee, plantains and yucca.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing land for farming

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen Q. D. V. D. 43 años D. edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero D. vida el cual posee un molino, y así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad. ResiD. en el municipio D. Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas a las afueras D. su hogar, las cuales las comercializa a diario, y sus hijos le ayudan a repartirlas D. casa en casa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, esto lo hace con el fin D. poder mejorar sus ganancias, ya que lo que su esposo gana no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos, es por esto que María desea poder aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera contar con el dinero necesario para poder inscribir a sus hijos a la escuela y así mismo comprarles todos los útiles escolares. Esto D. manera que pueda ayudarle a su esposo con algunos gastos los cuales son muy necesarios para el bienestar D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
María del Carmen Q. D. V. is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, who owns a mill, and her three young children. She lives in the municipality of Colon, in the department of La Libertad. She owns a business selling tortillas on a daily basis outsiD. her home and her children help her distribute them from door to door.

She is requesting a loan with which to purchase a larger quantity of corn to prepare the tortillas, with the goal of improving her profits because her husband’s earnings are not sufficient to cover all of their expenses. For this reason Maria wishes to increase her sales and obtain the money necessary to enroll her children in school and buy them all of their school supplies. In this way she can help her husband with some expenses that are necessary for her children's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Corn

loans.name: Lucerito De Jose Galvez Group

texts.es:
Lucerito D. José Galvez

Siguen trabajando muy duro los diez integrantes D. esta alcancía comunal Lucerito D. José Galvez, en esta oportunidad conoceremos un poco más a este grupo. Yulissa y Bárbara nos cuentan sus experiencias como microempresarias.
Yulissa es una mujer D. 30 años, el trabajar día a día como vendedora D. panes, kekes donas, galletas ha sido difícil ya que las ganancias que dejaba estas ventas eran pocas, pues la mayoría D. sus productos lo fiaba y las personas se demoraban en pagarle, lo que la impulsó a optar en preparar platos ceviche y chicha morada en una esquina cerca a su casa algo que lo hace muy bien trayendo consigo ganancias que no pensaba alcanzar, esto se debe además D. su sazón la no competencia cerca a su zona. Actualmente trabaja en una carreta que compró con los préstamos que recibió además renovó sus utensilios, baldes, ollas, y compró una vitrina, Piensa mejorar aún más su negocio pues tiene en mente terminar D. comprar un kiosco móvil D. segunda para mejor comodidad D. ella y a sus clientes, para ello requiere el préstamo quiere refaccionarlo, pintarlo darle algunos arreglos. Sus ganancias que obtiene son para apoyar a su pareja en la crianza a sus hijos menores D. edad, pues el sueño D. ella es brindarle lo mejor D. acuerdo a sus posibilidades.

Bárbara a sus 57 años trabaja muy contenta vendiendo anticuchos y picarones en un parque, con este negocio le fue posible darle educación escolar y mantener a sus dos hijos. El vender D. esta manera lo hizo porque quedó viuda y hasta ese entonces no tenía la necesidad D. trabajar. Antes del negocio D. anticuchos estuvo vendiendo útiles escolares pero no resultó. Decidió ayudar a su mamá en el negocio D. la venta D. anticuchos, que es un plato típico peruano, el crédito será para la compra D. insumos insumos como: corazón D. res, especierías, rachi, choncholí, pancita, palitos. Su último hijo estudia técnico en farmacia, es su hermano D. Bárbara quien lo ayuda en sus estudios porque las ganancias que obtiene ella es para la alimentación y gastos D. la casa.
texts.en:
Jose Galvez Shining Star The 10 members of the Jose Galvez Shining Star village bank continue to work very hard. Now, let's get to know this group a little better. Yulissa and Barbara will share their stories as small businessmen. Yulissa is 30 years old; working everyday seling bread, cakes, and cookies was difficult since she didn't earn much money. She sold many of her goods on credit and her customers took a while to pay her. These difficulties motivated her to change professions and to sell ceviche and chica morada (a local drink) on the corner by her home; this has gone much better for her and she has earned more than she initially thought she would thanks to her good cooking and the fact that there is little competition where she sells. Currently, she works from a cart that she purchased with loans; she was also able to purchase new utensils, buckets, pots and a display case. She would like to continue to improve her business by purchasing a mobile kiosk to more easily serve her customers. She needs a loan to buy it, fix it up, and paint it. Her earnings help to pay the costs of raising her children as she would like to proviD. for them the best she can. Barabara is 57 years old and sells anticuchos (cow heart kebabs) and picarones (fried pork) in a local park. She has been able to pay for the education of her two children through her business. She was forced to work when her husband passed away; before that, she had no need to work. Before she started selling anitcuchos, she sold school supplies but she didn't make much money. She decided to help her mother selling anticuchos (a Peruvian delicacy). She will use the loan to buy ingredients like: cow hearts, spices, cow stomach, skewers, etc. Her youngest son is studying to be a pharmacist; Barbara's brother supports him in his studies because her earnings are only enough to cover his food and their home expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is currently in the business of selling beans, posho (maize flour) and rice in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and posho to sell. Sabina is 25 years old and married to a doctor. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a rice store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice and posho to sell

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora C. López se desempeña en el trabajo de distribuidora de ropa y zapatos por mayor alos minoristas de mercado municipal de somotillo.
Ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales están bajo su tutela nos expone que el crédito con CEPRODEL la a beneficiado a amentar su inventario de mercadería y de esta manera aumento sus ingresos monetarios para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. López sells clothing and shoes at wholesale to retailers in Somotillo's municipal market. She is the mother of 4 children, who are still under her care. CEPRODEL's funding has made it possible for her to increase her stock inventory so that her monetary earnings for her family are higher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, like shoes, among others.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
Mil flores es un grupo unido y que trabaja en equipo  esto es debido según expresaron a que se conocen desde hace tiempo y saben la importancia de trabajar en equipo para sus negocios. La coordinadora de este grupo es señora Ángela María López A. es dueña de una pequeña venta que instalo en su hogar y la cual su hija de 14 años atiende por las tardes luego de clases mientras López y su esposo trabajan. 
	
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Teresa
texts.en: Mil Flores (Thousand Flowers) is a united group that works as a team. The members have known each other for a long time and know the importance of working together for their businesses. The group's coordinator is Ángela María López A., who runs a small convenience store out of her home, which her 14-year-old daughter tends to in the afternoon while Ángela and her husband work. The other members are María Teresa

loans.use: Purchase products such as basic grains, meat, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Rafael

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de telica, trabaja como docente en el instituto señor de esquípulas, en el area de  química y matemática, es casado su esposa es maestra en el area de ingles en el colegio Santiago apóstol de telica.
texts.en:
This client is a native of Telica. He is a chemistry and mathematics teacher in the Señor de Esquípulas institute. He is married; his wife is an English teacher at the Santiago Apóstol school in Telica.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a wall

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
O. is 40 years old, married and has three children under her care. She is hard working and has been in LAPO microfinance for the past two years. She styles clothes for both men and women, sells tailoring accessories and drinks. She has been in these businesses since 1995. She makes sure her customers demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.

O. is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase a deep freezer and use the balance of the money to purchase tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and LAPO microfinance for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and tailoring materials

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a relations officer at one of the best primary schools in Hoima, Uganda. As a salary earner, his income is fixed, irrespective of what he achieves at work, thus his need to have a side income, he says. He says for now, his biggest priority is education for the children, after which he hopes to own a personal car and enjoy life. His wife is a businesswoman and together they are now constructing rentals so as to earn extra income to sustain them. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to buy iron sheets for his house which is under construction.

loans.use: buying iron sheets for his house

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom C. lives In Preaek Hang village in Kandal province. She was born in 1986. She is a farming laborer and her husband, Mr. Khchoeng Met, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they do not make much money. So to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Mom C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine, and to rent a piece of land to grow vegetables. She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or to go to school. Her husband and children are in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine and to rent land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling of yams

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is an old man of 70. Together with his wife, he rears and sells cattle in Machakos and has been running this business for ten years.

Simion joined Wikwatyo Museo Group so as to access loans from Faulu Kenya. He previously took out a loan of Kes 120,000 to boost his business and he successfully repaid. He has now requested for a loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more bulls.

Simion hopes to purchase a pick-up in the future so that he can transport his bulls easily. He also plans to use the pick-up for a transport business to earn more income. He describes himself as an ambitious man.

loans.use: To buy more bulls

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya M. is a math teacher with 30 years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives in a small city called Agarak in one of the remote South regions of Armenia, Meghri. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four: 26-year-old son, husband and mother-in-law. In the city there is a high unemployment rate, but a farm business helps the family have some stable income. Both husband and son are involved in their small farm, and for a start they already have some livestock. With the requested loan the family plans to increase the livestock and purchase cattle food.

loans.use: Increasing the livestock and purchasing cattle food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase basic need items, dairy products, candy, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Yannet

texts.es: Vila tiene 41 años D. edas, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y tienen casa propia, La hija mas granD. se graduo el añpo pasado y ya tiene trabajo lo que significa una gran alegria para doña Vilma, Doña Vilma tiene tres negocios el principal es la costura donD. lleva 18 años y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y ahora D. su hija mayor, también tiene una pequeña tienda y librería que le ha incrementado ganancias por la buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes. El negocio esta situado en su domicilio. Su principal sueño es ampliar mas su negocio y es por eso que solicita crédito.
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, she is married and has 3 children and has her own home. Her eldest daughter graduated last year and has a job which brings great joy to Mrs. Vilma. She has three businesses, the main one is sewing where she has worked for 18 years and it has gone very well since she has the support of her husband and now of her eldest daughter. Mrs. Vilma also has a small store and a bookstore that have increased her profits due to the good service that she provides to her customers. The business is located in her home. Her dream is to expand her business and that is why she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her businesses.

loans.name: Gari Heribeto

texts.es:
Gari de 33 años,  vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). El tiene un taller de cerrajería (lugar donde se reparan metales, y se suelda).

Desde pequeño el papa le enseño a  ser cerrajero, reparaban puertas juntos y metales, pero por la falta de ingreso no pudo tener su local sino trabajar en su domicilio para poder mantener a su familia, poco a poco con esfuerzo logro readecuar su casa y ubicar el taller de cerrajería que tanto había querido. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

El quiere con el préstamo comprar una maquina cortadora para su taller, en el futuro quiere seguir en su trabajo y tener mas cliente para que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Gari, 33, lives in Las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area with a diminishing ecosystem. He runs a locksmith shop (a place that repairs metals and does welding). Since Gari was little, his father taught him how to be a locksmith. He repaired doors and metals but due to lack of funds he couldn’t have his own shop; rather, he had to work at home in order to support his family. Gradually, with effort, he managed to convert his home into the locksmith shop that he wanted. Now he works from 8AM until 6PM every day. Gari would like a loan to buy a power saw for his shop. In the future he wants to continue his line of work and have more customers so that his family has a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Circular Power Saw

loans.name: Blanca Dalia

texts.es: la Sra. Blanca, se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida  , viene trabajando hace 8 años en el rubro de venta de comida su domicilio   queda ubicado por  el Barrio Entel en la calle Genesis,nacio en Santa Cruz, su trabajo de la venta de comida lo realiza por las noches en su mismo domicilio, el trabajo que desempeña lo aprendio desde muy joven, sus primeros pasos lo realizo  en la provincia de Robore  en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Con el credito que se le esta otorgando   lo establecera en la compra de una heladera e incremento del capital de trabajo. En un futuro quiere que su trabajo  crezca mucho mas ,  ya que tiene pensado ampliar su negocio y hacer mantenimientos a su hogar, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Blanca sells food. She has been working in the field of selling food for eight years. Her house is in the Entel neighborhood on Genesis Street. She was born in Santa Cruz. She works selling food every night at her house. She learned the work when she was very young. She took her first steps in the Robore province in the city of Santa Cruz. She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and to increase her working capital. In the future she wants her business to grow a lot. She plans on expanding her business and doing some maintenance on her home. She is very grateful to the Institución for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator and increase working capital

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en: P. Rustamjon is dedicated to the production of dairy cattle. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he carries out this work every day to improve the living conditions of his family, bring the daily bread to his table and save for the improvement of his dwelling. His house needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state which, little by little, he has come to improve. His family admires him since his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and keep his three children in school. This gentleman faces a need to invest in his business through the purchase of cows. He hopes that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, will offer him this loan so he and his family can do well. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia C. B., tiene la edad de 42 años, está soltera, y  tiene un hijo de  3 años de edad, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Nidia también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en: Nidia Calderon Bolivar is 42 years old, she is single, and she has a 3-year old son; he is her greatest priority. The loan that she requests will be invested in her plantations, especially to cultivate coffee. The idea is to purchase fertilizers. She wants to give the coffee plantation the proper care to achieve the greatest quality product and to obtain the best profit possible after the harvest. This is the fist time she accesses a loan through Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy with the support she has received. Nidia has worked as an agriculturist for many years. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life in the future and to achieve a greater financial stability. She wishes to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

loans.use: To maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ángela Rosa

texts.es:
Ángela Rosa  L. E. tiene 52 anos. Es casada  vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Angela pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica  a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Angela trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y viajar a Valencia España.
Le gusta lavar cocinar y bailar
texts.en:
Ángela Rosa L. E., 52, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

Ángela is a member of the Dole communal bank located in Dole which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It’s a group involved in short-cycle farming.  Most grow bananas.  The bank has 16 members.

Ángela is a banana grower on leased lands.  She buys her supplies in Guayaquil and sells her products at home and in the Ventanas market.

She is asking for funds to expand her business.  The loan’s support will help her economically to meet her needs.  Her dream is to improve her home and to travel to Valencia, Spain.

She enjoys doing laundry, cooking and dancing.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Eva

texts.es:
Rosa de 61 años, es costurera y confeccionista, en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Por la necesidad de trabajar y la falta de oportunidades Rosa comenzó a trabajar como costurera y confeccionista porque era la actividad que mas le gustaba realizar. No tiene horario fijo ya que su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en una parte de su casa. Trabaja haciendo ropa por pedidos. Una de las dificultades al trabajar es que su casa esta mal construida y tiene problemas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y comprar cemento para arreglar un poco su casa. En el futuro quiere seguir con salud y seguir trabajando para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old. She is a tailor and seamstress on the outskirts of Guayaquil, in an area surrounded by the salt estuary.

Because of the need to work and the lack of opportunities, Rosa began to work as a seamstress and tailor because it was what she liked to do best. She does not have a fixed schedule, since her workshop is located in part of her house. She makes clothing on order. One of the difficulties of her work is that her house is badly constructed and has problems.

With the loan she wants to buy fabric and cement to repair her house a little. In the future she wants to continue being healthy and continue working to be secure in her old age.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and cement

loans.name: Najah

texts.ar:
نجاح في عمر 49 سنة نجاح تعمل في بيع الالبسة هي متزوجة ولها ولد لها في عملها اكثر من 7 سنوات
تحب عملها وهي تريد التجديد والتطوير في عملها حيث انها هي المعيل الوحيد للعائلة فزوجها لا يعمل تحب المثابرة على التطور تريد
عيش افضل لها ولعائلتها لم تجد صعوبة في التعامل مع المجموعة حيث كانت تلقى الدعم تريد اخذ قرض من المجموعة بهدف شراء
بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع العمل
texts.en: Najah is a 49-year-old wife and mother of one who works in clothing retail. Since her spouse doesn’t work, she is the only breadwinner in the family, and accordingly she is very eager to provide them with a better life. After seven years in the field, Najah is dedicated to her work which she wants to further develop. Given that she has found Al Majmoua very supportive and easy to work with, she wanted to seek another loan to purchase new merchandise and further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise to expand business.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 29 años, es viuda vive con  sus madre, su abuela y sus hijos en casa de sus padres. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la fabricación de ladrillos, desde entonces aprendió sobre la preparación de este material, hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos y del que es propietaria de una fabrica, el cual lo administra, ahí contrata la mano de obra de peones que la ayudan a seguir adelante en la producción que se ha propuesto. Trabaja diariamente, ya que espera producir mensualmente más de 30 millares de ladrillos para venderlos, de las ganancias que obtendrá le servirán para sostener económicamente a su familia. Por esta razón es que se esfuerza en el trabajo, vigilando el proceso de preparación de éstos ladrillos. Mas adelante tiene planeado tener otro negocio que le genere más ingresos. Es el crédito número 13 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará más insumos y materiales que le servirán para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Lizbeth, 29, is a widow.  She lives with her mother, grandmother and children in her parents’ house.  Since she was a child she has manufactured bricks.  Ever since then she learned how to prepare this type of material.  Today, it’s her source of income in that she owns a factory that she runs.  She hires hands to help her continue to move forward with the production she has proposed.

She works every day and expects to produce 30,000 bricks monthly to sell.  Profits she will earn will be for the economic support of her family.  For this reason she makes quite an effort working and watching over the brick making process.  Later on she’d like to have another business that earns more income.

This is her 13th loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she can count on having financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all her fellow members are responsible and mutually supportive people.

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  

She will use the loan she gets to buy more supplies and materials that will be useful in brick making.

loans.use: To buy brick making raw materials.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo, el cual tiene que alimentar a sus tres hijos.
Hoy en día trabaja en servicios domésticos, desde hace varios años, ha sido su medio de ingresos. En donde ha logrado hacer su casa, con sus ahorros y préstamos en Afodenic. Lo que para ella ha sido de grandes beneficios estos créditos.
El objetivo de este préstamo será para hacer el repello de las paredes para lograr mejor firmeza de paredes como mejor presentación en su pequeña casa.
Los materiales a compra: arena, cemento, esponja, arena de mar para dar un mejor acabado. Lo que está contenta una vez más por un techo mas digno.
texts.en:
Ana works very hard so that she can feed her three children. She has worked as a maid for several years, and this has been her source of income. She used her savings as well as a loan from Kiva partner Afodenic to obtain her house. The loans have been a great help to her.

Ana plans to use this loan to put plaster on the walls of her small house, giving them more strength and a better appearance. She needs to buy sand, cement, a sponge, and beach sand to give a better finish. Ana will be happy to have a nicer home once again.

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Emilce Ester

texts.es: La señora Emilce Ester Martínez vive con su esposo y tres hijos en el barrio las Nieves, uno de los más populares de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella es comerciante de mercancías en general. Hace 15 años comenzó vendiendo productos por catálogos entre sus amigas para colaborarle a su esposo con algunos ingresos para el hogar. El negocio fue creciendo y por sugerencia de sus clientes empezó  a comprar mercancía en  Maicao, ciudad comercial ubicada en el norteño departamento de la Guajira. Actualmente no viaja porque se ha especializado en la venta de calzado y ropa femenina que le proveen directamente algunos talleres en Barranquilla, motivo por el cual sus precios de venta son muy competitivos. La microempresaria atribuye el éxito de su negocio al hecho de que no sólo vende, sino que asesora a todas sus clientas en el estilo de ropa y calzado que deben comprar para verse más elegantes. Algunas, incluso, le consultan su opinión cuando compran en almacenes. Este es el segundo crédito que la señora Emilce tramita con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva que planea invertir en la compra de jeans, camisas, pantalones, faldas, calzado y accesorios femeninos. El volumen de venta mensual es de $ 3.000.000 COP, la rentabilidad promedio es del 37% y el plazo de la rotación de las cuentas por cobrar es de 50 días. La microempresaria sueña con abrir su propio almacén en el cual pueda ofrecer su mercancía y hacer con mayor comodidad lo que más le gusta: ser consultora de imagen femenina.
texts.en: Mrs Emilce Ester Martínez lives with her husband and three children in the Las Nieves neighbourhood, one of the most traditional neighbourhoods of the Barranquilla city. She is a merchant of general merchandise. She started selling products to her friends through catalogues 15 years ago to help her husband with some income for their home. The business grew, and on the suggestion of her customers she started buying merchandise in Maicao, a commercial city in the northern department of La Guajira. She currently does not travel because she has specialized in the sales of shoes and women's clothing which are provided directly from various workshops in Barranquilla-this is why her sales prices are very competitive. This businesswoman attributes the success of her business to the fact that she does not just sell, but also advises all of her customers as to which style of clothing and shoes they should buy to be more elegant. Some of them even request her opinion when they buy in department stores. This is the second loan that Mrs Emilce has applied for from la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, and her first loan on Kiva. She plans to invest it in the purchase of jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes and women's accessories. Her monthly sales volume is $ 3.000.000 COP. The expected profitability is 37% and the time to turn over her accounts to cover charges is 50 days. This businesswoman dreams of opening her own store in which she could offer her merchandise and do, with greater comfort, what she most likes: being a woman's image consultant.

loans.use: the purchase of jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes and women's accessories

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
Elva O. A. es L. presidenta del grupo comunal "L. Solucion".  Tiene 20 años y un hijo D. 2 años.  Esta casada.

L. familia D. Elva tiene como negocio L. criaza D. cuyes.  ElL. ha aprendido D. sus padres sobre este negocio, y lleva 01 año realizandolo.  Elva no cria cuyes, sino los compran en Matahuasi y los venD. en otros lugares por un precio màs alto.  Con este prèstamo, le gustarìa invertir el L. compra D. muchos cuyes y vender en otros sitios.  Se pueD. conseguir un precio mejor con una compra màs granD., y èste prèstamo le permitirà hacer esto.
(En L. foto, Elva lleva un pantalon azul claro y un polo color morado; esta sentada, y es L. segunda D. L. derecha)
texts.en:
Elva O. A. is the president of the "L. Solucion" communal bank. She is 20 years old, and is married with a 2 year old son. 

Elva's family has a business raising guinea pigs. She has learned about the business from her parents, and has been working in the business for one year. Elva does not raise guinea pigs herself, but buys them in Matahuasi and sells them in other places at a profit. With this loan, she would like to invest in the purchase of many guinea pigs and sell them at various locations. She can get a better price for a large-scale purchase, and this loan will enable her to do so. (In the photo, Elva is the one wearing light blue trousers and a dark poloneck sweater: she is seated second from the right).

loans.use: To purchase small animals

loans.name: Anahi

texts.es: Anahi G. D. L. Rosa y su esposo son una pareja muy joven que ya cuentan con una hija pequeña por quien salen adelante para ofrecerle una mejor calidad D. vida y mejor patrimonio. Anahi adquirió su vivienda D. interés social pero en L. parte D. enfrente necesita realizar L. construcción D. una barda para brindar mayor protección a su familia.
texts.en: Anahi G. D. L. Rosa and her husband are a very young couple who have a young daughter.  They get ahead in life so that they can offer her a better quality of life and a better patrimony.  Anahi acquired her home through social housing.  However, she needs to build a wall in front of the house to better protect her family.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her home

loans.name: Victoria Lili

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las afueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5:00pm. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. También brinda pensión al medio día, a sus clientes fijos (Estudiantes) de lunes a domingos. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y  pensionistas.

Viki, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día , y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank “Esmeralda”, in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner. She is 37 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are dependents and are studying.

Victoria has always been characterized by her fighting spirit and her desire to move forward. This is what led her to start her own business of selling kebabs outside her house. Little by little she has become well known among her customers and today she tells us that she is doing very well in this business. She makes her sales daily from 5:00 pm on. She has been working in this business many years and she is very happy with what she has made. She also offers accommodations at mid-day for her regular clients (students) Mondays through Sundays.
 
With this loan of S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy ingredients such as sacks of rice, eggs, native chickens for her juanes (rice with chicken), and gutted chickens for her kebabs, also cooking utensils to offer quality service to her customers and lodgers. 

Viki, as she is commonly known, feels very proud of the work that she does every day and gives thanks to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her food.

loans.name: Pet

texts.en: From Kompong Tom province, Pet T., age 38, is a married woman who makes a living by selling different kind of desserts in the local school. She has been in this business since 2005. Pet T. was married, but she divorced from her husband when her two children were young. Recently, Pet T. is not comfortable, because her toilet is too old and it often makes some bed smelling. She really wants to build a new toilet for her family but she lacks enough money to build it. To solve this situation, Pet T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to build a new toilet for her family using.

loans.use: To build a new toilet for her family using.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es: Jesús Maria tiene 46 años, es un hombre soltero. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio  como conductor de un amigo Jesús conducía el vehículo, pero al no ganar los suficiente para sufragar los gastos suficientes decide pediré ayuda por medio de los financiamientos, que le ayudo a conseguir el dinero suficiente para trabajar como taxista. Este financiamiento es para brindarle mantenimiento a su carro y comprar ciertos repuestos. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para brindar lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Jesús Maria is 46-years-old and a single man.  His work is in offering taxi services.  He has worked in this business for more than 20 years.  He began this business as a driver for his friend Jesús but because he did not earn enough to cover the expenses he decided to request assistance through loans that helped him to obtain the money he needed to work as a taxi driver.  This loan is for maintenance on his car and to purchase spare parts.  His wish is to improve his income so that he can give his family what they need.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Merlyna

texts.en:
Merlyna P. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Merlyna is separated from her spouse and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Merlyna owns and operates a retail store, selling clothing, underwear, sandals, lotions and beauty products. Merlyna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlyna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merlyna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Merlyna is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional clothing, underwear and cosmetics. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Merlyna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing, underwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie P. lives in the village of Mauswagaon. She is 48 years old, married and has five children. Three of them are adults and the rest are school-aged. Tessie is a very hardworking woman who invests in growing pigs to sell. She has been in this business for eight years with a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP.

In 2003, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Tessie has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 12,000. She is requesting a new loan of PHP 40,000, which will be used to repair her house. This will be her 13th loan from PMPC.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 54 years old and lives with her husband and youngest daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Sansar area, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her older children all live and work on their own.
