Narangerel manages a Mongolian traditional clothes-making business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2002 with the help of her younger daughter, who is 29 years old. She makes a variety of stylish and colorful Mongolian traditional coats called Deel. Her business becomes quite profitable during national holidays, including Tsagaan sar and Naadam. 

Narangerel is planning to operate a knitted clothing business in addition to her traditional clothing business. She is a polite woman who possesses a good personality. She says, "I want my younger daughter to be happy and be married to nice man." Narangerel is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine and some yarn in order to start her knitted clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita works hard to support five children. She is married and has a sugarcane farm in the Philippines. Nenita has requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. Nenita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health-hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Beinvinida

texts.en:
Beinvinida is married with six, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beinvinida is 44 years old.

Beinvinida has a fish-selling business in the Philippines. Beinvinida requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Beinvinida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Beinvinida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking married man with six children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children. 

For ten years he has been farming and he has specialised in maize growing since the crop is very profitable. He faces the challenge of price fluctuation, and his dream is to grow maize extensively. Peter intends to use the loan facility to prepare land for maize growing.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize growing.

loans.name: Miryan Judith

texts.es: Miryan D. 26 años D. edad vive en el barrio El Limon D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. donD. tiene un negocio que inició desD. hace 5 años como una alternativa D. generar nuevos ingresos a su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades D. 6 años y 6 meses.  Su actividad consiste en comercializar mercancías a crédito,  mediante guías especializadas D. productos, como  cosméticos, accesorios, ropa femenina interiores, lociones, perfumes, a una importante clienteL. D. esta comunidad y D. sus alrededores, así como a empleados D. empresas, trabajadores independientes y amas D. casa en  B. del municipio D. Soledad a 15 minutos D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL.. El Credikiva  es su primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará productos que salieron con descuentos especiales y sus clientes le han solicitado:  cosméticos, perfumes y accesorios, inversión que le augura además D. un incremento en su capital D. trabajo, L. ampliación D. su cobertura D. clientes referidos. Su meta mas adelante es comprar vitrinas para ordenar y exhibir su mercancía y ubicar un punto comercial con un gran despliegue publicitario, que le permita adicionar nuevos ingresos y lograr alcanzar su sueño D. tener una vivienda en el macroproyecto Villas D. San Pablo, liderado por L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su enfoque misional D. construir comunidades sostenibles. Mientras Miryam trabaja para alcanzar su sueño continua manejando en su negocio una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 34 % que planea incrementar gradualmente poniendo todo su empeño.
texts.en:
Miryan, 26, lives in BarranquilL.’s El Limón neighborhood where she’s had a business that she started five years ago as an alternative to generate new income for her home that’s composed of her spouse and two children who are 6 years and 6 months of age, respectively.

Her activity is selling merchandise on credit via product catalogues like cosmetics, accessories, women’s underwear, lotions and perfume to an important clientele in this community and its surrounding areas as well as to employees in firms, independent workers and housewives in the neighborhoods in Soledad which is 15 minutes from the city of BarranquilL..

The Kiva loan is the first loan she’s been granted by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will buy products that have special discounts attached and that her customers have requested: cosmetics, perfume and accessories.  This investment augurs for her in addition to an increase in working capital an expansion of her coverage of referred customers.

Her goal for later on is to purchase display cases to arrange and exhibit her merchandise and to situate herself in a spot with much public exposure that will allow her to add new sources of income and make her dream come true of getting a house in the Villas D. San Pablo macro project spearheaded by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of its mission focus of building sustainable communities.

While Miryan works to reach her dream, she continues running her business with a profit margin of 34% that she plans to gradually increase by putting her maximum effort into it.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg, 35, is a doctor. She lives with her husband ,36, and child, 16, in the old communal apartments of Darkhan, second largest city in Mongolia. Mrs. Ganchimeg is the type of person who strongly wants to improve her family life conditions and to set definite goals for her life and her job. She has been working as a doctor in secondary school #9 of Darkhan city since 2010 and had the same type of work experience between 1999-2002 in another secondary school. She left her previous job because of illness. Her husband has been a teacher of physical training in the same school since 2004. This family has never been able to make repairs to their old apartment since they bought it. 

Mrs. Ganchimeg and her husband are planning to do a repair to their old apartment. They need to buy some construction materials and to hire the repairmen. Therefore the loan she is requesting will be dedicated to do these repairs to their old apartment. She said "Thank you very much, Kiva, for helping my family!"

loans.use: to make a repair to her home apartment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion,ella vende cemento,ladrillos,fierros,clavos entre otros materiales de construccion,por medio de este negoció la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar le negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción al por mayor como fierros, clavos, pinturas y ladrillos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank which is located in Urubamba District that belongs to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is 56 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling building materials and supplies.  She sells cement, bricks, metal and nails, among other construction supplies.   Through this business she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand the business of selling construction materials and is asking for a loan to buy building supplies, like metal, nails, paint and bricks, at wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sman

texts.en: Mr. Sman works hard to support his family. This father of five children, all of whom are married and living separately, is a junk collector around the village and commune, earning about $3 per day. Sman is now requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to help purchase a new motorbike to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to support his business.

loans.name: Flory Mae

texts.en:
Flory Mae is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 1 child.  Flory Mae has a food cart that sells snacks, like tempura, fishballs & kekiam. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy frozen snacks to sell.  Flory Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flory Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen snacks to sell

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es:
La señora Aura es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Hacia Adelante del Distrito Manantay en el Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 55 años, està casada y tiene cinco hijos que son todos mayores D. edad.
Lleva dos años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta D. refrescos en las afueras del coliseo cerrado D. la ciudad, ya es tiempos que está realizando este negocio y lo hace junto a una D. sus hijas.
Su nuevo préstamo D. PEN 1,000.00 lo invertirá en la compra D. una maquina raspadillera para poder vender también sus raspadillas, por el calor eso es un negocio redondo.
Su esposo es el que mantiene el hogar y està feliz que ella tenga su propio negocio, los ingresos Aura invierte en lo que estime conveniente.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos que le dio la oportunidad D. poder abrir su propio negocio pueD. apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura is a member of the Mujeres Hacia Adelante Communal Bank in the Ucayali department. She is 55, married, and has five grown children.
She has taken out loans from Manuela Ramos for two years. She sells drinks outsiD. of the city's Coliseo Cerrado. She does this work with one of her two daughters.
She will invest her new loan of PEN 1,000 in the purchase of a snow cone machine in order to be able to sell snow cones as well. Because of the heat, this is a great business.
Her husband is the one who maintains the household and she is happy to have her own business. Aura invests her income in what she deems appropriate.
Thanks to Manuela Ramos, which gave her the opportunity to open her own business, she can support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a snow cone machine.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past four years, she has run a business where she buys and sells household goods and ready-to-wear clothing. Her business is in the Philippines.

Alona is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, soft-drinks, juice, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes had been managing her sari-sari (variety) store for almost five years. In this business, her daily income of about P200 serves as revolving capital and stock commodities to continuously operate the store.  She spends most of her time in monitoring sales from her store.

She is now 57 years old and was separated from her spouse five years ago. She has one child who is now presently working in a factory and sometimes helps her in times of need.

She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee and instant noodles to sell in her sari-sari store. These additional commodities would help increase her sales. 

Lourdes would like to keep making better sales to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee and instant noodles to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a responsible father who raised his family in a village, while planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. He is now 36 years old and has four school-age children. He aims to uplift their standard of living and give his family a better life. He aims to plant more vegetables and root crops to earn a higher income and satisfy their needs. He and his wife plan to continue sending their children to school, for they want them to become professionals in the future. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to support the education of their children.

Due to financial difficulty, he wants to ask an additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and seedlings, and to pay labor costs required in planting root crops. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will make the business grow and achieve his goals in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings, and to pay labor costs required in planting root crops.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Marta quién invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras y de esa forma poder superar los obstáculos que diariamente surgen.
La señora Marta, está separada hace 2 años, tiene cinco hijos, 4 menores de edad y uno mayor.  La señora Marta se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata. Comenta que este es su medio de producir ingresos y la forma en que ayuda a su familia. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que lucha por el bienestar de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas en plata, para que de esa forma pueda tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues la ayuda será muy importante para su micronegocio.
texts.en:
The contact for the start of the current communal bank was Señora Marta who invited and organized her friends to form a part of the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación. They came together with the intention of helping each other and in this way overcoming the obstacles that arise daily.

Señora Marta, separated for 2 years, has 5 chidren, 4 minors and 1 adult. Señora Marta sells silver jewelry. She tells us that this is her way of making an income and helping her family. She describes herself as a very hardworking and selfsacrificing woman who fights for the well-being of her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy silver jewelry so that she can offer her customers more variety. She is thankful to the Fundacion for the opportunity they give her as the help will be very important for her small business.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is 32 years old and has worked as a cattle breeder for the last 5 years.  She is married and has three children.   Her husband works as driver but his salary is not permanent and very low.  

Cattle breeding is the main source of income for Firuza's family.  Her monthly income from selling cattle is 80 AZN.  

She would like to expand her business and purchase two additional cattle and fodder.  She requests a 1000 AZN loan. 

This will be her third loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase two additional cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Nilo Estuardo

texts.es:
Nilo Estuardo tiene 20 años de edad es soltero vive en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
Nilo se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y fréjol, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Chillanes cada semana.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas mejorar la calidad del producto. Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a aumentar la calidad del producto.
El sueño es poder estudiar y culminarlos y tener una profesión.
Los desafíos en todo negocio es los intermediarios. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar boley y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita, se considera un hombre honrado, trabajador, responsable y colaborador.
texts.en:
Nilo Estuardo is 20 years old. He is single and lives in Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.

The La Florida communal bank is made up of 12 members and is located in Chillanes canton 5 minutes from the office.

Nilo is a farmer, and grows corn and beans. He buys and sells in Chillanes every week.

He is asking for the loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies to improve the quality of his produce. The loan will help him to increase the quality of his produce. 

His dream is to be able to study, finish studying, and have a profession.

The middlemen are a challenge in every business. In his free time he likes to play volleyball and enjoy the Santa Rita festivities. He is considered to be an honorable, hard-working, responsible, and contributing man.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to improve the quality of his produce

loans.name: Martha Antonieta

texts.es:
Martha de 47 años, empezó con su negocio de venta de botellones de agua y productos químicos, pero con la ayuda de Dios su negocio ha ido evolucionando y ahora también tiene el negocio de vender frutas.

Realiza su trabajo sola, sin horarios fijos. No ha tenido ninguna dificultad hasta ahora. No está casada y si tiene hijos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su ventas en navidad por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo frutas y productos quimicos. 

Su meta es poder agrandar más su negocio de venta de productos químicos y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Martha, 47, began with her business selling bottles of water and chemical products, but with God's help her business has evolved and now she also sells fruit in the business.

She works alone, without a fixed schedule.  She has had no problems thus far.  She is not married and she does have children.

She has many aspirations with her Christmas sales and so she wants to buy fruit and chemical products with the loan.  Her goal is to be able to enlarge her business selling chemical products and selling fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruit and chemical products.

loans.name: Ladiri (La Dignité) Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes, constitués de 6 mariées et 3 veuves de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et  sont mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le bois de chauffe et les habillements. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Saran est un membre du groupe Ladiri  qui vend du bois de chauffe.  
Elle est la première debout à gauche sur la photo et est habille en tissus blanc raillé de bleu
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, plusieurs chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe pour stocker. Elle se procure  du bois dans les coins de brousse Bellesso Sanga et Kokouna.  Elle vend le bois en détail et au comptant à la maison à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Saran compte réaliser 140 000FCFA. De bénéfice.
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles ambitionne dans un futur proche diversifier ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women, made up six married women and three widows from the town of Koutiala; they know each other well and live in large traditonal families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 46 years of age and have at least five children each.

This group of women sell a variety of products such as firewood and clothing. In order to increase their business volume, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. They are on their third group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid in full.

Saran is a member of the Ladiri group and sells firewood. She is standing on the far left of the photo and is dressed in a white fabric with blue stripes.She is planning to use her loan to buy several barrow loads of firewood to stock up. She gets her wood in the bush country areas of Bellesso Sanga and Kojouna. She sells the wood on a retail basis, from home for cash, to a varied customer base. While the other members of the Ladiri group are expecting to make an average profit of 120,000FCFA throughout the course of the cycle, Saran is expecting to make a 140,000FCFA profit.

They will use their revenue to repay their loans and also to cover household running expenses. They are all aiming to diversify the goods they sell in the near future.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like sacks of maize, grain and many others.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку семян, пленки, удобрений, а также материалов для орошения и отопления. Предыдущий кредит она использовала для аналогичных целей - закупка расходных материалов для выращивания ранних овощей. 

За последний год Надежда посторили еще одну (седьмую) теплицу и намерена развивать бизнес дальше.
Дочь Натальи поступила в университет в г.Минск (Беларуссия), и Наталья помогает ей оплачивать учебу.
texts.en: Nadezhda is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, plastic, fertilizers, and also materials for irrigation and heating.  She used her previous loan for similar goals - purchase of materials for growing early vegetables.  Over the last year, Nadezhda built one more (seventh) greenhouse and now intends to develop her business further.  Nadezhda's daughter was accepted to a university in the city of Minsk (Belarus), and Nadezhda helps her to pay for education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic, fertilizers and supporting materials

loans.name: Malinka

texts.en:
Malinka Zdrvavkova is 50 years old. 4 years ago because of the unemployment in her home village, she and her family moved to Blagoevgrad, which is one of the developed cities in Bulgaria that stands 100 km. south of the capital Sofia.

Since the time of movement the family leads a struggle for existence. It was hard for them to find a job so they decided to start own business with fruit and vegetables trading. It is a family business for Malinka, her husband and their 2 sons.

Right now before the winter Bulgarian people traditionally keep vegetables in store to use them during winter months. This reason makes Malinka Z. apply for this $1 200 loan to supply fresh vegetables – cucumbers, peppers, tomatoes and others.

loans.use: To supply fresh vegetables – cucumbers, peppers, tomatoes and others

loans.name: Julia Rolanda

texts.en:
I make and sell sweets to my neighbors, schools and grocery stores in my town. This activity has been my help for a long time and has enabled me to meet many people and now I have various clients who sell my products in their businesses, and I also sell my sweets in the schools where the children buy them. This business has generated good earnings that have allowed my to support my children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Me dedico a la elaboracion de dulces que vendo a mis vecinos, escuelas y pulperias de mi ciudad. Esta actividad ha sido mi ayuda durante mucho tiempo y me ha servido para conocer a otras personas, ahora tengo varios clientes que venden en sus negocios, reparto a escuelas donde los niños compran. Este negocio me ha generado buenas ganancias con las que he podido apoyar a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, colorants, artificial flavorings, bags and other items.

loans.name: Mir Shah

texts.en:
Mir Shah lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has 30 years of experience in his job. He works as a shopkeeper and he has a general store. He is uneducated.

Now he wants to enlarge his business and he needs money so he wants to take a loan from AFSG. He wants to be a good business dealer and to find more clients and find close relations with other businessmen until he can realize his best wishes. He hopes that he can do it.

loans.use: Buy Tea, Sugar, Soft Drinks, Flour, Ghee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements in his bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
"For the safety of my family, I need to place protection on the windows of my house, because my work is on the night shift and during that time there are lots of evildoers. I am requesting $800 to install protection on my home."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Por la seguridad de mi familia necesito poner las protecciones en las ventanas de mi casa ya que mi trabajo es en el turno de noche y en ese fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes”.Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para la instalación de protecciones en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To place protection on the windows of my house

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr:
Mr. Ayao G. was born in Agoè, a suburb north of Lomé. Today he is 23 and is a single father of two (02) children. He left high school to learn motorcycle engine mechanics, but he was never able to work as a mechanic due to a lack of funds. He thus became a motorcycle taxi driver, but he does not even own the engine he uses for his job. To become self-sufficient, he has decided to buy his own motorcycle and is requesting a loan of $800 to do so. He already has significant experience as a motorcycle taxi driver and will thus be easily able to earn a decent living once he has his own equipment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Agoè dans la banlieu nord de Lomé, Monsieur Ayao G. est âgé aujourd’hui de 23 ans, célibataire avec de deux (02) enfants à charge. Il n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études secondaires qu’il a laissés pour se consacrer à l’apprentissage de la mécanique des engins à deux roues. Il n’eût même pas la chance, faute de moyens financiers d’exercer ce métier. Il se transforme alors en conducteurs de taxi moto, lequel engin ne lui appartient pas. Pour se prendre en charge lui-même, il décide de s’acheter sa propre moto et sollicite pour cela un financement de $800. C’est un métier qui a déjà beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine et peut facilement s’en sortir.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Salamatu Abdulai sells cosmetics, lace materials, thread, needles, handkerchiefs, baby diapers, pampers and provisions such as milk, soap, minerals etc. Salamatu is married and has three children ages 15, 6 and 3 years. Her husband is an electrician but his income is low. Salamatu works very hard. To help with the family finances, she also sells shoes and mineral water. Her store is located at moree junction, about 5km from cape coast. 
She is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group” located on the Yamoransa – Accra highway.
Salamatu is asking for a loan of US $ 800 dollars to fill her store with cosmetics, shoes, baby dresses, minerals, laces materials, thread and provisions such as milk, milo, soap, bags of rice etc. she intends to pay the loan back within seven months.

loans.use: Salamatu is asking for a loan of US $ 800 dollars to fill her store with cosmetics, shoes, baby dresses, minerals, laces materials, thread and provisions such as milk, milo, soap, bags of rice etc.

loans.name: Soleha

texts.en: Soleha is a 41 year old woman who began a food stall after becoming a member of MBK. She sells meat balls and snacks at her stall, earning US$5.50 per day which is just enough for her daily needs. Her husband, S., has no fixed income. Soleha would like a IDR 700,000 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Ignacia Yolanda

texts.es:
Ignacia R. sells groceries such as oil, soap, pastas, detergents, brooms, shampoo, etc. She started her business 10 years ago in the market at the León bus station, with a small investment that she borrowed from a moneylender. Once she bought the first products, she worked hard to sell them and looked for a way to get out of debt and finish paying it off.

One of her needs is to invest in the purchase of groceries, and for this reason she has approached Ceprodel for loans (she has had 5 loans), which she invests directly in her business, and in this way she supports her home, which needs it so much.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ignacia R. se dedica a vender productos de abarrotaría como aceite, jabón, pastas, detergentes, escobas, shampoo, etc.) Su negocio da inicio desde hace 10 años en el mercado la Terminal de León, con una pequeña inversión que los obtuvo por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Una vez que compró los primeros productos, muy esforzadamente los comercializó y busco la manera de cómo salir de esta deuda hasta acabarla.

Una necesidad que posee esta dama es que necesita invertir en la compra de los abarrotes y por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos (Actualmente 5 créditos a su favor) que los invierte directamente en su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Lweza A (2007) C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Farida N.. She sells fruit and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. Farida is 32 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, Farida hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Fardia is joined in her small group by Alice N., Margret N., Maimuna T., and Hajara N.. Alice N. has a piggery and wants to purchase more piglets. Margret N. perates a poultry business and wants a loan to buy chicken mash. Maimuna T. operates a bricklaying business to add to her business. Hajara N. sells milk and is requesting a loan to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To improve fruit business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two more phone kiosks

loans.name: Tanyara Ii Group

texts.en:
Musa and Musukunda need additional capital to buy supplies for their farms. The two members of Heremakono group grow okra, cassava, and rice.

They have large farmlands, but were unable to use all of the land due to lack of capital for labour and fertilizer. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD) Le.500, 000 ($175 USD) each. Musa Mansary is the group leader and is 45 years old. The support from Kiva will help them have a bountiful harvest this season.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Liliana is married and is 42 years old. She is native of Chiclayo and has three children who still depend on her and her husband. Mrs Liliana has a high school education and lives in the District of Manuel Arévalo - Trujillo – Peru. She has a small grocery store in one of the rooms at her house. She sells cookies, sweets and other pantry items. Mrs Liliana began this business a year ago. The business got started with Manuela Ramos half a year ago granting Mrs. Liliana a first loan of S/.300., which was invested on purchasing carbonated soft drinks and snacks. Mrs Liliana belongs to the Communal Bank "Santa Elena II." With the loan of S/. 500. oo that she will reimburse in 4 months, she will buy a merchandise display and more supplies for the store. Liliana dreams of having a larger store, with more assortment and variety and thus to improving the life style of her family and continue to raise her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Liliana, esta casada, tiene 42 años, es natural de Chiclayo tiene 03 hijos dependientes aún de ella y de su esposo, tiene estudios secundarios vive en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Trujillo – Perú. Tiene una pequeña bodega en la sala de su casa, en la cual vende galletas, caramelos, abarrotes, etc. Este bodega la implemento hace un año. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace medio año concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300. lo invertio en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Santa Elena II” Con el préstamo de S/. 500.oo que cancelará en 4 meses comprará una vitrina y algunas golosinas y abarrotes para surtir la tienda. Liliana sueña con tener una bodega más grande, mas surtida y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder sacar adelante a sus menores hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abuzer

texts.en:
Abuzer S. is a 42-year-old man who owns a car repair studio. He is the engineer and has repaired cars since 1985. He lives in Imishli and his service studio is located nearaa local bazaar and its always full with clients.

He spends all day in his service garage repairing cars and has decided to apply for a loan to repair his garage and improve his working conditions.

loans.use: To repair a garage and improve working conditions

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Mrs. Puth C. is a 34-year-old married mother with five children, one of whom is a farmer while the others are attending school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.  Her husband, Mr. Ra Thoem, is a firewood seller who can generate a small income to support her family.   Mrs. Puth C. is a basket maker in Sre Ouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is going well, she would like to expand it.  She asks for a loan to buy more bamboo to make more baskets to sell and for medecine for one of her children who has hepatitis.

loans.use: To buy more bamboo for making baskets and for medicine for one of her children, who has hepatitis.

loans.name: Zarafo

texts.en:
Zarafo Z. is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of three beautiful girls, aged seventeen, fourteen, and ten. Six months ago, she started a little business with the purpose of tending to her girls' needs. Her daughter’s father currently doesn’t live with them. Because of difficult living conditions, he moved to Russia two years ago to increase his earning potential.

Zarafo is now selling clothing for schoolgirls and schoolboys. She began the business with a very small amount of merchandise. Now, however, she wants to increase her inventory as her orders and sales have increased with the school season. To keep up with demand, Zarafo needs a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD). She promises to repay the loan within six months. The requested loan will positively help this woman achieve her goals and help fund her children’s educations.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to increase her merchandise inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a range of products to restock her mini-market.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In S. is 48 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province  with her husband and 5 children. She sells roast beef and roast frog, traveling door-to-door, earning on average US$ 7 per day. Her husband, Ros Yun is 49 years old and is a fisherman earning about US$ 6 per day. 

Her youngest child goes to school while the other 4 work. They all work in different industries. One works with his father, another as a construction worker; one sells cloth, and the fourth works as a gardener at a golf course.  Their household expenses are about US$ 85 per month.

In S. was not available for the picture. Her husband is pictured with his boat. In future In S. would like to have a stand at the market. This loan will be used to expand her husband's business.

In S. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate.  Agricultural loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI, please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at 

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: to purchase a boat and fishing nets for her husband’s fishery business

loans.name: Yesenia Lisbel

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia tiene 24 años edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en el pasaje Santa Lucia 223, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero ya no continuó estudiando debido a que falleció su mamá y los recursos económicos ya no eran los de siempre. Se casó y tiene un hijo de un año seis meses que depende de ella.
Vende golosinas y comida por las tardes en su casa, por ejemplo vende pescado frito con yuca, sangrecita, arroz chaufa, etc. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró golosinas e insumos para sus comidas.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará golosinas y arroz, aceite, etc.
texts.en:
Ms. Yesenia T. is 24 years old and lives on 223 Santa Lucia Street, in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad. She is a member of the Alberto Sánchez II microfinance institute.

She finished high school, but was unable to continue her studies because her mother passed away, which meant that she no longer had the financial resources that she used to. She got married and has a son who is a year-and-a-half.

She sells sweets and meals—such as fried fish with yucca, sangrecita (black pudding), arroz chaufa (a rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham), etc.—in her home in the evening.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, she purchased sweets and the ingredients needed for meal preparation.

With this 300.00 PEN loan, which will also be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase sweets, rice, cooking oil, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guisela tiene 26 años, vive con su hijo de 6 años y su madre. Se dedica a la venta de animales, ganado vacuno y ovino, en las principales ferias ganaderas de su zona, ella está muy contenta porque ya son 4 años que se viene dedicando a esta actividad que le permite dar el sostén necesario a su pequeño hijo que es la razón de su esfuerzo, por ello que no se cansa de buscar a los mejores animales que garantizaran sus mejores ganancias, cuando no hay venta mantiene a sus animales en su establo por unos días y trata de que engorden, porque de ello depende la cotización. Es la segunda vez que Guisela está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus pagos, como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora. Esta cantidad de dinero le permitirá  tener mayor capital de trabajo, ya que podrá comprar más animales y revender con ocasión de estas fiestas navideñas, en las cuales la demanda es más fuerte.
texts.en:
Guisela is 26 years old and lives with her 6 year old son and her mother. She sells animals, cattle and sheep, in the main livestock fairs of the area. She is very happy because for the past 4 years she has dedicated herself to this activity, which allows her to support her young son who is the reason for all her efforts. With him in mind, she never tires of searching for the best animals which will guarantee her greater profits. When there are no sales, she cares for her animals in the barn for a few days and tries to fatten them up, because she depends on them for her livelihood. This is the second time Guisela is asking for a loan from MFP, and she commits to continue repaying punctually as she has always done thus far. This loan will allow her to have more working capital, and she will be able to buy more animal and resell them for special occasions such as these Christmas holidays, when demand is at its peak.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of animals she can buy

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy A. is a group leader of six people, all of whom live in Nor Neam Toteung village in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Tun Chantha, is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Thy A. is a 51-year-old mother of six children. One is a teacher in the local school, while another is employed in a garment factory. The other four children are enrolled in the local school.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the soil and make the rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa F. is 40 years old. She is married with three children. Currently her eldest child who is a girl is an apprentice hairdresser, and the two others are in school. She lives with her husband at Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abofour happens to be a farming community and the two of them are in crops and cocoa farming.

Adwoa owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market. Adwoa means Monday-born; she has been in this business for the past 25 years. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand her business. She said no family member is able to assist her with financial support because they are also in hardship like her. She wants a loan to expand her business. Adwoa hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide the children with quality education.

Adwoa belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Asem’ which means the WORD OF GOD. She also hopes to receive GHS 800 to make business progress by restocking her shop. This would enable her to save more to help her husband take care of the children's educational needs. Fortunately she has also registered with the Ghana national health insurance which takes care of her medical bills free of charge, depending on the condition. We encourage our clients to do so, so that when you lend to her she would not spend her working capital (loan assistance) on medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan, a 22-year-old single woman living in Aley in Mount Lebanon, opened a perfume and accessories shop four years ago. Sawsan's business is growing constantly, so she is requesting a loan of $1,200 ito increase her inventory and  renew her shop's decor.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and  renew her shop's deco.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Marleny es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Marleny es Obstetriz, tiene un Consultorio Obstétrico en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con una enferma , además Marleny vende materiales ortopédicos y cosméticos por catálogos.
Marleny necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos, materiales e instrumentos.
El sueño de Marleny es mejorar su negocio y tener una clínica propia.
texts.en:
Marleny is single, she is 26 years and has a son. Marleny is an obstretician and has an obstetrics clinic in a rented space. She employs a nurse and also sells orthopedic materials and cosmetics through catalogs. Marleny needs a loan in the amount of 2000 soles. The money will be invested in the purchase of medicines, materials and tools. Marleny's dream is to improve her business and have her own clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines, materials and tools.

loans.name: Ave

texts.en:
Ave L., age 23, is married and has one child. She has 4 years of experience selling biscuits, Chinese cake, and donuts. She sells to the village people, especially the public, seven days per week.

This is her second loan of 1250 Tala from SPBD. SPBD has disbursed 750 Tala thus far. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 110 Tala ($44 USD). SPBD loans are Ave’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, milk, and other ingredients needed for her baking.

loans.name: Sonia Karina

texts.es:
SONIA KARINA T. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo Nº 286 del Distrito de Calleria; tiene 39 años, actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposo y tiene  01 hijo que aun depende de ella. 

Se dedica a la venta de ropa.  La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (hace 05 años), con este préstamo compró algunas prendas mas y afianzo su negocio.  Gracias a su carisma, entusiasmo y persistencia su negocio ha incrementado. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa  comprar mas prendas de vestir así como calzado para damas y caballeros debido al pedido de sus clientes.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Sonia Karina T. B. belongs to the Talented Women Community Bank and lives in the district of Callería. She is 39 years old and currently separated from her husband. She has one son who is still dependent on her. She makes a living selling clothes. With her first loan, she took out 300 soles five years ago and used it to purchase some clothing items and finance her business. Thanks to her charisma, enthusiasm and persistence, her business has grown. She is currently requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to use to purchase more clothing items as well as footwear for men and women as a result of her customers' orders. "(Kiva partner) Manuela Ramos is an organization that supports a large number of families with its small loans that allow women in the area to start or improve their businesses, and I'm content with its help," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresses and footwear

loans.name: Julia Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas D. Oro” en  Distrito D. Puno, la  provincia D. Puno, departamento D. Puno, tiene 70 años D. edad, es casada madre D. 05 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Cesar Vallejo, ella no estudio. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, es socia fundadora  la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. chuño, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, los cuales pagara en 4 cuotas; este préstamo le servirá para comprar mas chuño para luego venderlo en el mercado, su deseo seguir trabajando.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha las reuniones, y los préstamos que da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is a member of the Palomas D. Oro (Doves of Gold) Communal Bank in the District, Province and Department of Puno. She is 70 years of age, married and the mother of five children. She lives in the Cesar Vallejo neighborhood and has never gone to school. Julia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years now and was a founding member of her Bank. The activity that she devotes herself to is buying and selling "chuño" (naturally freeze-dried potatoes). Her first loan was for 300 New Sols. Presently she would like an additional loan of 500 New Sols which she will repay in four installments. This loan will allow her to buy more chuño for later sale in the market. She wants to continue working. She also related that she really likes the meetings and the loans that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chuño.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị is fifty-five years old and lives in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has three grown children.  To make a living, V. owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale.  She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately $230 a month from these activities.

In 2002, V. joined TYM Fund, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to expand the shelters for her livestock.  V. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional profits generated by this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina Q. is a widow and has three children. She did not receive any formal education. Christina sells fabrics in Ekuase, including lining, African-made batiks and tie-dye. She has been in this business since 1992. Christina is in financial difficulties because she is solely responsible for her finances, both for her own expenses and for the children. Christina will use the loan to purchase more fabrics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Thanks to lots of hard work, Khosiyat can offer her family enough to eat and help her husband. She dedicates herself to growing potatoes, onions, wheat and other crops. Although she has to work every day, she approaches her job with a sense of care and optimism, knowing that thanks to her work she can continue growing, not only economically, but also as a person. Khosiyat wants very much to increase the size of her farm and grow a more diverse base of delicious products, and thereby increase her sales and profits. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elevit

texts.es: Elevit tiene 50 años, es viuda desde hace un año y vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y cerveza) en su casa, negocio en el que le está yendo bien, debido a que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada y cercana a un parque donde acuden varios deportistas y requieren siempre de sus bebidas heladas. A Elvit le gusta mucho su trabajo porque por medio del mismo conoce a muchas personas con quienes mantiene conversaciones interesantes y entretenidas. Además, con las ganancias que obtiene diariamente consigue solventar los gastos de su hogar, y también está ahorrando para tener una tienda de comestibles en un futuro cercano. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y lo que le agrada de trabajar con su grupo es hay mucha confianza y unión entre todos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará algunas sillas y mesas para colocar fuera de su casa y sean usadas por sus clientes. También incrementará la cantidad de bebidas que vende.
texts.en:
Elevit is 50 years old. She's been widowed for a year and lives with her two children and her mother. She's been selling beverages (soft drinks and beer) from her home for two years, and the business is going well because she's in a bustling area near a park used by a variety of athletes who always need a cold drink. Elevit likes her work a lot because she meets a lot of people and has interesting, engaging conversations. In addition, she uses her earnings to cover her family's expenses, and she's also saving up so she can have a grocery store in the near future. This is her third loan with MFP, and what she likes about working with her group is the level of trust and community among all the members. She will use the money requested to buy some chairs and tables to place outside her house for customers to use. She will also increase the number of drinks she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock and buy furniture for her business

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d'ignames, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2006.  elle dispose d'une grande clientèle dont des proprietaires de restaurant et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de sokodé. son stock de marchandises a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 tas d'ignames et assurer le transport de la marchandises.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille dans le quartier Adidogomé.
texts.en:
This lady earns a living selling yams. She began this business in 2006. She has a sizeable clientele, among others restaurant owners, and buys her merchandise in the back country in the town of Sokodé. Her inventory is down, and so she would like to replenish it and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 25 heaps of yams and pay for transporting them.

She is married and the mother of 2 children; she lives with her family in the Adidogomé neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing yams for resale

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda R. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Esmeralda is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Esmeralda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Esmeralda has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esmeralda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children and for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi S. is 52 year old and has sold food products in the small village of Lenkoran since 1999. He is married and has four children who are the meaning of his life. He is dedicated to his shop where he sells candies and canned food.

Nabi applied for a 2,000 USD loan in order to increase and diversify the range of products he sells.

loans.use: To increase and diversify the range of products he sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business place

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr: Doudou S.  est un couturier complet, âgé de 30 ans qui gère un atelier avec prés de 5 élèves apprentis. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit pour l’acquisition d’une machine à coudre .Cette fois ci il sollicite ce prêt pour agrandissement et le renforcement de son activité et prendre en charge l’éducation de ses élèves couturiers. Ainsi, il trouvera des revenus pour nourrir sa famille

loans.use: achat de garnitures

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Mrs. Sima K. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in the district of Lalitpur where most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. Sima lives with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Madan K., works in a private office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son works in a pharmacy, and her daughter is studying in grade 10.

Mrs. Sima is engaged in agricultural farming. She grows green vegetables and seasonal vegetables on her land. She sells her vegetables in a local market in the morning and evening. Now she is applying for a loan of 15000 NPR to buy fertilizers and seeds for her agricultural work.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
Kpana C. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Good Friends. She is 52 years old and a widow with seven children between the ages of 12-25 years old and their educational levels 5th grade -nursing student at the Mother Patten Medical School, in Monrovia, Liberia. Kpana also cares for 12 siblings. She is an illiterate due to her father refusing to send her to school.

Kpana and her family live and work in the Steven Tolbert estate, north of the capital Monrovia, in Liberia. Her business is the sales of prepared food. She buys rice and other cooking ingredients, which she cooks and sells per plate in a little shop to residents of Steven Tolbert  Estate, northern Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for 9 years, and hoping to upgrade to a larger shop.

Kpana cooks good food and talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business. She started by selling seasonings like onions, garlic, tomatoes,salt and so on with LD3000.00 

She needs this loan to purchase more rice, oil, dry meat and other ingredients, so that she can cook enough food to serve customers. Kpana dreams of giving her children a better education and saving for her old age.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for her genge business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos, quienes cursan estudios primarios. Ellos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la siembra de piña y yuca, él cuenta con dos hectáreas de terreno, donde también cultiva plátanos y frutos cítricos, los cuales le sirven para consumo personal. 
Pero como el terreno de su chacra es amplio que no dudo en empezar a sembrar una hectárea de palma aceitera, donde él mismo es quien cuida todas sus plantas. Lo que le gusta a Luis de su labor es mantenerse ocupado y olvidarse de los problemas, también le es muy rentable porque las ganancias de la venta de sus piñas y yucas le brindan lo necesario para vivir tranquilo.
Para más adelante, Luis quiere empezar a sembrar maíz y arroz.

Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos se apoyan, no hay problemas y se entienden bien. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará abono para sus plantaciones de piña y yuca.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and lives with the mother of his two children,both of whom are in primary school. The have their own house. For 14 years he has worked growing pineapple and yucca. He has two hectacres of land. He also grows plantains and citrus fruits, but only for personal consumption. Because his farm was large enough he also planted a hectacre of palm oil trees, which he cares for himself. What Luis likes most about his work is that it keeps him busy and he can forget his problems. Also, it is quite profitable. With the money he earns from selling his pineapples and yucca he can live comfortably. In the future Luis wants to start growing corn and rice. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he likes the community bank because all the members support each other and their aren't any problems. With the money from the loan he will purchase fertilzer for his pinneapple and yucca farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty K. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages at home and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use. Betty is 29 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more materials to use for brewing local alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina B. is from the village of Kinangay Sur Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old. Marcelina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut shells in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 24th loan taken out by Marcelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a married woman, 27 years old, and has one baby. Four years ago, after having her first child, she started working as a home-based hairdresser. She receives her clientele at her home where she has prepared a speciA. room for this purpose.

Today, Zeina is requesting $1,000 to buy more hairdressing tools and beauty products to offer new beauty services to her clients so that she is always their preference.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Naghma Sarayan Qalacha Group

texts.en:
This is'Naghma Sarayan Qalacha' group. Khalida is the group leader and a good tailor. She lives in Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with 5 children.They are all studens of shool and University. She is an experienced tailor and can sew all kinds of clothes. She has lots of clients and she is happy that she can support her childern through the income of her tailoring. With the loan she wants to purchase a new sewing machine. She hopes to have a shop for her tailoring and hire one empolyee there as well.
She is thankful to Kiva lenders becasue they support people thought their effecitv process.

loans.use: purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Chan is from Chheu Teal Phluos village in Takeo province. She is 48 years old and the president of a village bank group loan offered by Kiva partner, AMK. The 18 members of this group loan will use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Y. Chan is married and has two children, one of whom is a Khmer noodle seller while the other still attends the local school. Her husband, Ngim N., is a construction worker who earn a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Y. Chan is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. On this farm, she has a small problem because her field is infertile. Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elvin Jose

texts.es: Elvin Jose de 29 años de edad es soltero, habita en casa de su mamá junto a su hija Dayra Elena  de 13 años que estudia 6to grado de primaria. Elvin trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operario de Limpieza desde hace 9 años, esta solicitando su segundo credito con el objetivo de seguir mejorarando su vivienda, ya que con el credito anterior solo logro reparar una pared de su cuarto que está construida de plycem, ahora desea terminar la obra construyendo las 2 paredes que le hacen falta para tener mayor privacidad. El mayor deseo de Elvin es poder brindarle a su hija las condiciones basicas del hogar y que ella estudie hasta que llegue a ser una profesional que le sirva a su pais, ya que es el patrimonio que puede ofrecerle.
texts.en:
Elvin Jose is 29 years old and single. He lives with his mother and daughter Dayra Elena, who is 13 and attending the 6th grade at primary school. For the past 9 years, Elvin has worked for the Juigalpa Municipality as a Cleaning Operator. He is requesting his 2nd loan in order to continue improving his house, as the 1st loan provided just enough funding to repair an interior Plycem wall. Elvin would now like to finish the job and construct 2 more walls to provide more privacy. Elvin's dream is to provide better living conditions for his daughter so she can complete her studies and become a professional who serves her country.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more candles, soap, pomade and batteries to sell.

loans.name: Sperito

texts.en:
48-year-old, hospitable, S. Sperito has educated all his three children to university level, courtesy of his three-year-old maize-milling business in Senyi, Lugazi. He also does some poultry rearing and banana plantation farming.

Sperito became involved in this business after much persuasion from a friend who had achieved success in a similar venture. Since he began his business, he has been earning 150,000 shillings on a monthly basis.

It’s with this loan that he is seeking empowerment to financially boost his business. He wants, specifically, to buy more maize as it’s been his major selling item over these years.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to supplement his existing stock

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey P., 40, and her husband, Mr. Pun Phoeun, a 42-year-old fisherman, have been married since 1990. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia with their daughter, who attends school. Srey grows vegetables on her farmland in the village and is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying grinders and aluminum containers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 24-year-old hardworking business lady who sells used clothing. She has done this business for three years and hopes to open another boutique in the future. Esther is the mother of two children and she works hard to meet her family’s needs. Her husband is employed and also supports her financially by paying the school fees for their child in school.

Esther belongs to a group under Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each others loans. She joined this group to access a loan from Faulu Kenya. Through the group, she has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for men, women and children.

loans.use: To buy men's, women's and children's clothes

loans.name: O. Marie-Madeleine

texts.fr: D. O. Marie-Madeleine est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie-Madeleine est mariée à ALAGBE Antoine et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie-Madeleine vit depuis sept ans environs, au quartier Hindé à Cotonou, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux  différents besoins de la famille. Marie-Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis huit ans, Marie-Madeleine vend des vêtements tous cousus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Marie-Madeleine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa et à Lomé au Togo. Marie-Madeleine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés, malgré sa récente maladie. Aujourd’hui, Marie-Madeleine désire renforcer son activité et augmenter ses ventes. C’est donc pour augmenter son stock de produits que Marie-Madeleine sollicite un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Marie-Madeleine D. was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is maried to Antoine ALAGBE and is the mother of two children, all of whom attend school. Marie-Madeleine has lived for the past seven years in the Hindé neighborhood of Cotonou with her husband and children. The couple address the family's needs together. Marie-Madeleine did not attend school. For the past eight years, she has been selling handmade clothes at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, which allows her to contribute to the family expenses. She stocks up at Dantokpa et in Lomé, in Togo. Marie-Madeleine previously received four loands from ALIDé, which she all repaid on time, despite her recent illness. Today, Marie-Madeleine would like to increase her sales. She is asking for a fifth loan in order to increase the stock of products she can offer her customers.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different types of cheese.

loans.name: Blancia Julia

texts.es: Blanca Julia tiene 40 años, tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica de es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, ya que para ella es muy importante mantenerlo activo. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con muy poco capital. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, a pesar de ser muy humilde tiene suficiente clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, comal entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Blanca Julia is 40 years old. She has two children and both attend school. She makes and sells tortillas and has been working with Fundación for a long time and feels that it’s important to continue. She’s been in this business, which she started with very little working capital, for more than 21 years. Her business is located within her home. Although it’s small, she has plenty of customers. She will use the money from this loan as working capital with which to buy dried corn, firewood, salt, and a griddle, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Dionicia de 55 años y con el menor de sus 7 hijos, pues el resto son mayores y viven independientes. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, recuerda como los miembros de su comunidad se ayudaban mutualmente en sus chacras, y por eso sabe que trabajando en equipo las cosas salen mejor. En la actualidad siembra papa y arvejas en sus chacras que son propias, junto a sus hijos mayores que le ayudan, luego de días de sacrificada labor reciben la recompensa que es una buena  producción de calidad. Como son varios los miembros de su familia no necesitan la ayuda de operarios, además dice que gracias al trabajo agrícola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, y por eso lo considera un trabajo rentable, aunque no siempre obtiene una buena producción, por las plagas o el clima, dice que siempre se gana algo de dinero de la comercialización a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que vende cuando se le presenta alguna dificultad económica. Siendo un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado comprar algunas reses, pues quiere ampliar este negocio. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible dicho préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, además esta muy satisfecho con la labor que desempeña su grupo comunal, que siempre buscan que ayudarse mutuamente. Manuel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de semilla de arveja y abono que necesita para mejorar su producción, pues se acerca  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 55, lives in his own house with his wife, 55 year old Dionicia, and with the youngest of their seven children. The rest of the children are adults and live independently. He has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He remembers how the members of his community mutually helped each other on their farms. That is why he knows that when working as a team things turn out better. He currently plants potatoes and peas on his own fields, and his older children help him. After days of working and sacrificing they receive their recompense with a good, quality production. As they have a lot of members in their family, they do not need help from laborers. Also, he says that thanks to the agricultural work he has managed to get his children ahead. Therefore, he considers it to be a profitable for him. Even though he does not always have good production because of the pests or the climate, he says that he always earns something from selling to the wholesalers in the city. He also raises cattle, and he sells them when he has financial difficulties. Being an enterprising man, he plans to buy some cows in the future; he wants to expand this business. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very grateful to all of the people who made this loan possible. The loan will allow him to keep working and pursuing progress. Also, he is very happy with the work that his communal bank does. They are always helping each other. Manuel plans to use the requested loan to buy several sacks of pea seeds and fertilizer that he needs to improve his production. The next planting season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elsa Mariana

texts.es:
Elsa de 50 años, es vendedora de artículos para el hogar y electrodomésticos,tambien vende comida por pedido, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral. 

Ella vende artículos para el hogar desde hace años por la necesidad y la falta de oportunidades. Pero como necesitaba otros ingresos puso un pequeño local para vender comida poco a poco a incrementando su capital aunque ahora no tiene horario fijo para vender la comida porque la hacen por pedido, también los artículos de hogar para asegurar su vejez. 

Ella quiere dirigir el préstamo solo a los artículos para el hogar como planchas, relojes, tostadoras y así tener mas ingresos para eadecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere tener salud para seguir trabanjando y agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Elsa is 50 years old. She sells household goods and appliances, and also sells food to order. She lives in a suburban area called Perimetral. She has been selling household goods for years through necessity and lack of other opportunities. As she needed another source of income she set up a small shop to sell food and gradually was able to increase her capital. However she has no fixed schedule to sell the food because she prepares it to order, which also applies to the household goods she sells to safeguard her old age. She wants to dedicate the loan to purchasing household items like irons, clocks, toasters, and in this way generate more sources of income so she can make home improvements. In the future she wants to stay healthy to continue to work and enlarge her home.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: irons, toasters, clocks

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda B. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Erlinda is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Erlinda runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
