Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene 76 años y se dedica al negocio de elaborar forros para computadores, impresoras, cajas registradoras y de cuanta maquina existe. Su negocio inició después de haber recibido la pensión de jubilación y los ingresos no eran suficientes para  el sustento de su hogar, conformado por su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Este es su quinto financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y requiere para comprar  sus productos. Con los financiamientos de esta organización ha logrado grandes descuentos por la compra en volumen y le representa el fabricar con mejores precios que su competencia y rotar rápidamente su capital.  Rigoberto realiza el solo su actividad  productiva en una antigua maquina de coser familiar y mas adelante tiene planeado comprar una  industrial, que mejoraría notoriamente sus proceso y sus tiempos de producción. 
Don Rigoberto es un hombre valiente que cada día lo vive con mucha alegría y deseos de ayudar a quien lo necesite y que aunque tiene el desafío de la competencia sabe servir a su mercado en lo que cada cual necesita.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 76 years old and makes covers for computers, printers, cash registers and other machines.  He started the business after receiving his pension.  It was not enough to support his household, made up of his wife and three kids.

This is his fifth loan from Fudacíon Mario Santo Domingo, needed for the purchase of materials.  With the funds from the organization, he receives big discounts for bulk purchases, sells his products at better prices than his competition, and has quick capital turnover.

Rigoberto works on an old family sewing machine.  In the future, he plans to buy an industrial sewing machine, which would greatly improve his process and production speed.

Rigoberto is a valiant man that lives each day with a lot of enthusiasm and with wishes of helping those that need him.  Even though he is challenged by competitors, he knows how to provide his market with whatever they need.

loans.use: For the bulk purchase of synthetic materials to make machine covers

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita C. is a widow who lives in Tangkinto, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling dried fish. Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more dried fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Lolita C. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Communal Bank "Heart of Jesus", located in the district of Juliaca, in the province of San Román, and the department of Puno. She is 42 years old and married with two children. She studied until the third year of primary school. 

Modesta has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business selling handicrafts. 

She is now asking for a loan for 200 PEN, money that will be used to buy more materials: wool of all kinds for her business selling handicrafts. Her dream is to improve her handicrafts workshop.  Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the money she earns on her savings.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as a variety of wools, for her business selling handicrafts

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto V. M. tiene 31 años, Es soltero, vive  con los abuelos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Jorge  trabaja en la bananera como destallador y selector de banano, trabaja desde hace tres año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.

Le gusta comer frutas.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto V. M. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his grandparents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has one child.

The members of the VRC Dole 2 Communal Bank are farm laborers who work at the Dole banana plantation in the capital of the canton. All of the members live in the canton of Ventanas. Most of the members have worked on the plantation for more than a year and their activities are related to cultivating bananas. There are approximately 13 members.

Jorge works on the plantation as a pruner and fruit picker. He has been employed there for three years. Jorge buys what he needs at the #1 commissary in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to establish a business in his home. Jorge plans to equip his store and buy products for his business. With the help of this loan, he will be able to meet his needs financially. His dream is to improve his home and complete his goal of having a business.

Jorge enjoys eating fruit.

loans.use: Operating capital to start a business in his home

loans.name: Yoel

texts.es: Yoel, de 23 años, está convive con Tatiana, de 18 años. Ambos tienen 1 hijo, Luis de nueve meses de nacido. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Yoel, es la agricultura, ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a ello. Su producción consta de la siembra de café, plátanos y maíz híbrido. Lo que más le gusta a él, es poder dedicarse al trabajo que sus padres le enseñaron desde que era niño; según afirma, “sabe todas las técnicas de cultivo”, y para mantener la cosecha de buenos frutos, grandes y muy  dulces, él aplica abono constantemente, de esa manera asegura una buena producción. Está técnica le es muy provechosa, ya que los vendedores mayoristas que constantemente visitan su localidad, compran sus productos a muy buen precio. En adelante quiere seguir innovando en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y está seguro que con el apoyo de su banco comunal, donde le recibieron con mucha alegría, podrá lograr sus objetivos. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 30 sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivo café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Yoel, 23, cohabits with Tatiana, 18.  They have a son, Luis, who is 9 months old.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Sanchirio del Palomar (Peruvian central jungle).  Yoel has been a farmer for three years.  He plants coffee, bananas and hybrid corn.  What he enjoys most is being able to do the work his parents taught him since he was a little boy.  He states that he “knows all the planting techniques” to care for his crops to have big, good, very sweet fruit.  He constantly applies manure so assure a good production.  This technique is very profitable because the wholesalers that constantly visit his locality buy from him at very good prices.  In the future he’d like to continue innovating crop care.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is sure that with help from his communal bank, where he was received very cheerfully, he will reach his objectives.  

If he were to get the loan he has requested, he plans to use it to buy 30 sacks of organic manure for his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: To buy 30 sacks of manure.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 75 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio por una vecina quien le ayuda a sacar adelante a su familia. Es una persona que no es la primera vez que ha trabajado en Fundación. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa variada para esta época del año.  El sueña con sobrevivir con su negocio que es su única forma de vida.
texts.en: Imelda is 75 years old and her business is selling used clothes.  She has been doing this for more than 4 years.  She started because a neighbor wanted to help her improve life for her family.  This is not the first time that she has worked with the Foundation.  The purpose of this loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and other various clothing items for this season.  She dreams of surviving with this business, which is her only form of income.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Digna Isabel

texts.es:
Digna Isabel Y. N. tiene 25 años. Es soltera, vive con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y crianza de pollos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta escuchar música y celebrar las fiestas del patrono San José.
texts.en:
Digna Isabel Y. N. is 25 years old. She is single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She does not have any children.

The members of the V.R.C. "La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde" ("The Hope Is Never Lost Communal Bank") belong to the community or recinto El Placer, about 120 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The majority of the members of this communal bank are in the agricultural business.

Digna is in the agriculture business, sowing corn and raising chickens. On Sundays she makes her purchases and sells her stock in the Chillanes canton market.

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and food for the animals. The support of the loan will help her to meet her needs economically. She faces challenges such as plagues and illnesses and the variations of the weather. Her dream is to have her own house. She likes to listen to music and celebrate the holidays of the patron saint San José.

loans.use: seeds, fertilizer, and food for the animals

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiena 50 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Fernando de 51 años, quien se dedica al servivio electrico de automoviles y camiones, ella tien 2 hijos que son: Alexis de 14 años y Alfredo de 11, sus dos niños estudian la secundaria y uno de ellos le ayuda a su padre en el pequeño taller que tiene. 
Guadalupe dedica parte de su tiempo en la venta de articulos para camas de dormir,y los vende de manera ambulante o por catalogo. Esta es una actividad un poca cansada para ella ya que para poder vender sus productos ella tiene que recorrer caminado varias viviendas ofreciendo sus productos o incluso tiene que caminar largas distancias a otras colonias, lleva poco mas de 4 años en esta actividad y le gusta su trabajo,porque con su pequeño negocio ella puede aportar un poco de recurso para los gastos de la casa.
Guadalupe solicito un credito para hacer la compra de algunos productos que le hacen falta ya que ella tiene varios pedidos acumulados por parte de algunos clientes asi como algunos pedidos pendientes por entregar. Ella compro: sabanas, fundas para almohadas, colchas, edredones, cobertores, sabanas de cajon, almohadas y algunos accesorios mas para el mantenimiento de las camas de dormir. 
Una de las metas que tiene fijada Guadalupe es tener un establecimiento fijo donde de manera permanente pueda vander sus productos, asi tambien tener una mas grande cantidad y variedad de mercancia, aunque en algunas ocaciones las ventas bajen ella no se desanima, ya que tiene la opcion de almacenar mas mercancia para poder ofrecer despues.Con esta actividad ella ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en algunos gasto escolares asi tambien suplir algunas necesidades propias, ella nos dice que la ventaja que tiene es que su actividad le permite organizar su tiempo a su conveniencia, si tener que descuidar sus deberes de familia y sin dejar de atender a su esposo y sus hijos.
Su esperanza ews que algun dia sus hijos terminen una carrera comoes la esperaza de todas las madres del mundo, que no tenga que padecer alguna enfermedad y que sus hijos sean personas de bien, ella desea que su negocio cresca mas cada dia y que sus ganancias le permitan el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 50 years old; she is married with Fernando, 51, a mechanic who specializes in the servicing of electrical systems in cars and trucks. She has 2 children: Alexis is 14 years old and Alfredo is 11. Her two children are in high school and one of them helps her husband in the small shop they have. 

Guadalupe spends a part of her time selling bedding and linen, selling them itinerantly or through a catalogue. This business is physically tiring for her because in order to sell her products she needs to walk to the various houses to offer her products, or she might have to walk long distances to other colonies. She has a little more than 4 years in the business but she enjoys her work. It is with her small business that she is able to earn some income for the household expenses. 

Guadalupe requests a loan to purchase some products that she has sold out and she has various orders that have been placed by clients and there are some orders that need to be filled.  She purchased: sheets, pillow cases, blankets, bedspreads, duvets, fitted sheets, pillows, and some additional accessories for beds. 

Guadalupe's goal it to have a store from where to sell her products. She would be able to have a larger quantity and variety of merchandise. Although sometimes her sales are low she doesn't get discouraged because she can just store her merchandise for future resale.  This business has enabled her to support her children and paid for some of their school fees. It has also allowed her to cover some personal expenses. She said that the advantage is that her business allows her to manage her time as convenient to her, without having to ignore her family responsibilities. She is able to take are of her husband and children. 

Her hope is that one day her children will have a career, as is the hope of all the mothers in the world. She hopes that she will not suffer from any illness and that her children will grow up to be upstanding citizens. She wishes to see her business grow more every day and to have her profits help in the development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase bedding articles.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Mb Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la Sra. María Isabel G. una integrante D. grupo Emprendedoras D. MB, que está ubicado en la comunidad D. Monte Blanco en el estado D. Veracruz en México. Se ve a la señora Maria Isabel G. junto a las demás integrantes D. grupo D. la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta D. elotes y esquites que inició hace 15 años. Solicita su préstamo para mejorar su negocio. Sus clientes la consideran una persona con valores, perserverante y con ganas D. salir adelante y en la cual se pueD. confiar. Al momento D. solicitar su prestamo se siente motivada y con entusiasmo para seguir trabajando. Tiene 45 años, estudió la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos: una mujer y unvarón. Quiere este crédito para mejorar su negocio y con ello ayudar a su familia. También espera que con el crecimiento D. su negocio obtendrá ganancias para terminar D. construir su casa.Catalina D. P. M, es la presidenta D. grupo tiene 35 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene en total 1 hijo. ella se dedica a la venta D. lenceria por catálogo que inicio hace 4 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en ropa  y leceria para vender. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. Observación: La primer señora D. la derecha que sale D. perfil, se llama Catalina D. P. M..
texts.en: This photo was taken at the house of Mrs. Maria Isabel G., a member of the group named Emprendedoras D. MB. It is locate din the community of Monte Blanco in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Mrs. Maria Isabel G. can be seen together with the rest of the group in the photo.  She has been selling corn on the cob and prepared corn for 15 years. She requests a loan to improve her business. Her clients know her as a person with strong values, perseverant, someone with a great drive to succeed, and someone who is trustworthy. When she applied for her loan she felt motivated and enthusiastic to keep working. She is 45 years old and she has a graD. 6 education. She is married and she has 2 children: a girl and a boy. This loan will be used to improve her business and to support her family. With the growth of her business she also expects to earn enough money to finish building her house. Catalina D. P. M. is the leader of the group. She is 35 years old, she graduated from high school and she has one son. She has been selling lingerie from a catalogue for four years. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing and lingerie for resale. The group is maD. up of 11 members. Note: The first woman on the right pictured in profile is Catalina D. P. M..

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Reina de la Paz está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada una de las más bellas por su arquitectura, su cultura y tradiciones, su gente es amable y muy cordial como nuestra socias quienes trabajan día a día en sus labores para  sacar  adelante a sus familias y apoyar en la economía de sus hogares.

La Señorita. Mónica Marisol L. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Paz, vive en  la parroquia  Santa Ana, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte del mismo. Tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive  con sus hermanos con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.  Nuestra socia  labora como empleada domestica hace 2 meses, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde y el tiempo que tiene libre le ayuda a su papá en la cría de pollos. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar su negocio propio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.

La Señora. Inés Celina T. vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa prestada por un familiar. 
Doña Inés Celina hace 3 meses comenzó a vender almuerzos, trabaja de lunes a viernes, prepara los alimentos en la mañana y vende todo hasta el medio día.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte del banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus almuerzos. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The 'Reina de la Paz' community bank is made up of 10 women who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is considered very beautiful because of its architecture, its culture and traditions, and its kind and friendly people like these ladies who work every day to get their families ahead in life and to support their households financially.

Mónica Marisol L. is a member of the 'Reina de la Paz' community bank.  She lives in Santa Ana parish and this is the first loan she has requested as a member of the bank.  She was invited to join by her sister who was already a member.  Mónica is 18 years old, single, and lives with her siblings, with whom she shares the household expenses.  Mónica has worked as a cleaner for 2 months.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 2.00pm and in her spare time she helps her dad raise chickens.  She will invest her loan money in buying chickens so that she can start her own business.  Her goal is to own her own home.

Inés Celina T. lives in Cuenca city center.  She is 24 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 9, 7 and 4.  Her two eldest children attend elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a construction worker.  They don't own their own home but live in a house which they are borrowing from a family member.

Three months ago, Inés Celina started selling lunches.  She works from Monday to Friday.  She prepares the food in the mornings and sells her meals up until midday.  This is the first loan that she has had from our organization.  She was invited to become a member of the community bank by a friend.  She will invest her loan money in buying food products to prepare her lunches.  Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy chickens and food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bundles of plastic slippers for her business

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is currently in the business of selling paste (groundnuts and simsim--sesame seed) and charcoal. She is 33 years old, married, with three children. Two of them go to school. Hayat borrowed a loan to stock more paste (groundnuts and simsim) to sell. With extra profits from her business, Hayat hopes to buy land in the future.

loans.use: stock more paste (groundnuts and simsim) and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Warakoze Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne N.  est une  vieille commerçante âgée de 55ans qui habite  au centre ville de la Province de Kayanza au Nord du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de bière de  banane depuis 12 ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de pratiquer ce métier. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de la 6e annee primaires. Elle est mariée a Jérôme Masabo, un cultivateur, et ont ensemble 7 enfants dont 5 déjà maries et 2 autres qui étudient. Elle arrive au 7e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant une grande quantité de bananes pour en extraire une grande quantité de jus pour faire la bière  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Ce commerce lui aide à couvrir les charges familiales les plus élémentaires.

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Warakoze».
texts.en:
Jeanne N. is a 55-year-old merchant who lives in downtown Kayanza, a province located in northern Burundi. She has been selling banana beer for 12 years. Prior to this activity, she was a farmer. She completed six years in primary school. She is married to Jerome Masabo, a farmer, and together they have seven children, five of whom are already married and the other two still in school. 

She has reached her 7th cycle of community credit with Turame. She is seeking a loan with Kiva to increase her capital. She will buy a large quantity of bananas to extract the juice that will be turned into beer. She will then sell the beer for substantial profits. This activity helps her to cover some basic household expenses.

She is a member of the Warakoze community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of bananas whose juice will be turned into banana beer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is engaged in the business of offering second-hand shoes for sale. She has been in this business for five years. She also operates a salon, where she earns approximately Kes. 30, 000 per month.  With the additional income from the salon business, she is able to raise her three children.  

Mary is a hard-working lady who hopes to have a fully established business in the future. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50, 000 kes in order to buy shoes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy shoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Miech

texts.en:
Miech S., 54 years old, is a humble villager living in the middle of Cambodia in its capital, Phnom Penh. She is married and blessed with six children.  One of her children is single and still living with her under her care while the other five are already married and living in their own houses.

To earn a living, Miech S. and her husband have been cultivating rice crops on land that  has belonged to them for many years.  Miech S. and her husband are seeking a loan to buy two cows that they will rent out to farmers for additional income. The cows can also be used for breeding so the couple can also raise their offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows that can be rented out to farmers for additional income.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is 39 years old and married. She has a general store where she sells grocery items, frozen foods and soft drinks. Jocelyn has had this business for almost eight years. 

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional groceries, soft drinks and frozen foods. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her general store into a big grocery store. She believes that someday she can achieve her business goals through hard work and strong determination.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, soft drinks and frozen foods to sell

location.town: Balzain, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married. Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Jane has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, cigarettes, biscuits etc. 

In the future, Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Wilma has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages. In the picture are Wilma and her eldest son.

Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Elena, tiene 22 años y esta casada. Doña Elena se dedica a la venta de articulos en general como frazadas, camperas, buzos, etc.
Doña Elena se dedica a este rubro hace más de 7 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2004; comenzó con el capital que su madrele habia dado para empezar a adquirir sus prendas para luego poderlas vender y asi poder obtener algún ingreso para ella y tambien para la familia.
En la actualidad tiene una pequeña cantidad de mercaderías y clientes formados, y con miras a complacerlos y ofrecerles aun mas variedad, solicita este crédito, es decir, con el mismo podra comprar adquirir mas championes, frazadas, camperas, busos, etc.
texts.en: Elena is 22 years old and married.  For 7 years, from approximately 2004, Elena has worked selling casual clothing such as jackets, sweatshirts, caps, etc.  She began with money that her stepmother gave her,  purchasing her initial inventory and later selling it, and generating an income for herself and her family.   Right now Elena has a small amount of merchandise and an established customer base.  She would like to offer them more variety, and the loan will enable her to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her small clothing business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 43 years old and married to Mercy.   They are blessed with three children.  Elias runs a carpentry shop in Githurai, where he supplies his product to the people of that area. He has been doing this business for the last eighteen years.  He earns an income of KES.15,000 per month.

Elias has a good credit history with KADET, LTD.   He is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. to purchase more stock.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children.  He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more material, like lumber

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco  hijos de 18, 17,  15, 11 y 9 años de edad, tres de sus hijos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela el mayor no estudia recién termino el colegio. Su esposo es chofer y realiza fletes en su carro.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y también ciertos productos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, los productos los recibe en su local en su gran mayoría y algunos los compra en Manta y Montecristi. Tiene más de cinco años con su negocio y nos cuenta que fue con uno de los créditos que empezó con su tienda y que la ha ido mejorando.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años, es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of typical products, such as for example Panama hats known both within and without the country, the members of the communal bank Madres Unidas [United Mothers] gathers every two weeks. 

In this place we met Mrs. Ana. She is 37 years old, married, and from this relationship has five children who are 18, 17, 15, 11 and 9 years old. Three of her children study in high school and the youngest in elementary school. The eldest no longer studies as he recently finished high school. Her husband is a driver and uses his car to carry out trips for hire. 

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of staples such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents and also certain types of hardware. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. and at times later. Her children and husband help her in her work when they are not busy. The great majority of her products are delivered to her store and some she purchases in Manta and Montecristi. She has had her business for more than five years and she tells us that it was with one of the loans that she began her store and that it has been improving. 

She will use this loan to further stock her store, buying rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other staples. She has been in the communal bank for ten years. She is the treasurer and likes it because she has made more friends in the group. 

Her goals are to keep progressing in her business and that her store would grow day by day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cold cuts and other staples.

loans.name: Vestline Group

texts.en:
Furaha, who is in her mid-30s, is married with three children who all go to school. Since 1990, she has been a food vendor and has also sold powdered soap for the past four years. Furaha works from five in the morning through four in the evening every day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

Furaha is requesting her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy food items and wholesale powdered soap. She used some of her previous loans to start selling powdered soap: she buys the soap wholesale and then packs it into small packets that she sells door-to-door in the evenings. Furaha has also used her loans to expand her food business and pay school fees and household expenses. She has successfully repaid all of her previous loans. 

Furaha will share this loan with her loan group "Vestline" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a Bajaji (motorcycle) to help with transport for her business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and wholesale powdered soap

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou, age 29, runs a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has operated this business for four years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale.

Analou and her husband have two children.

Analou has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Analou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina de 44 años vive en el municipio de soledad con sus 5 hijos en las edades de 3 a 23 años. Allí tiene su negocio llamado “Tienda donde Diove”, el cual nació de la recomendación que su tía hiciere, para que con una liquidación Marcelina la invirtiera en una actividad independiente que le produjera ingresos para el buen desempeño de su hogar. Así fue como se lanzó a su nueva aventura, con la cual ha salido adelante como madre cabeza de familia. Marcelina se identifica como una mujer batalladora, y que nunca se da por vencida ante las adversidades de la vida, y esta es la frase motor que la impulsa a continuar y a que cada día sea aún más valiente.  Su mayor sueño y desafío es tener un autoservicio, donde las amas de casa y su clientela en general, encuentren todo muy cerca al lugar donde viven, sin tener que transportarse. Con su creciente clientela, su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente para lograr sus metas de crecimiento y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres al por mayor para continuar obteniendo descuentos por las compras en volumen y sobre todo de contado. Mientras Marcelina se esfuerza trabajando, genera un margen de utilidad, no menor del 38%, lo que le permite potencialmente seguir creciendo al inyectarle capital de trabajo a su negocio, producto de créditos.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 44 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her five children who range in age from 23 to 3 years old.  She has a store there named "Tienda donde Diove", which she started at the recommendation of her aunt.  Marcelina invested her settlement in an independent activity that would produce income that would support her household.  This was how she launched her new adventure, which has allowed her to get ahead as a female head of household.  Marcelina identifies herself as a female fighter and she never gives up when faced with life's adversities.  This is her motivation to continue, so that every day she is even braver.  

Her biggest dream and challenge is to have a supermarket where housewives and her customers in general will find everything very close to where they live, without having to travel.  With her growing customer base, her working capital is not sufficient to meet her goals of growth, so that is why she is asking for this Kiva loan.  It is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, she will purchase supplies at wholesale to continue receiving discounts for buying in bulk and paying in cash.  While Marcelina works hard, she generates a profit margin not less than 38%, which potentially allows her to continue growing and investing capital in her business, a product of loans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Gracelda

texts.en:
Gracelda is 47 years old and lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and has four children.

Gracelda engaged in food vending business to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for school tuition and miscellaneous school fees.

Gracelda has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, she hopes, her children will finished their courses and land good jobs for greener pastures.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition and miscellaneous school fees

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cosme; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el tiene un auto el cual brinda el servicio de taxi y apoya a su conyugue en el negocio de venta de leche; el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche y negocio de transporte.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro y para comprar leche al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The lender belongs to the communal bank "SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the Cusco province and the department of Cusco. 

The lender is Cosme. He is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and he has two children. The lender alternates his daily activities with his transportation business. He has a taxi with which he provides taxi services, and he also has a business selling milk. The lender is raising his children through this business. The lender wishes to grow his taxi business and his business selling milk. The lender is asking for a loan in order to maintain his car and to buy milk in bulk.  

The lender is happy about the loan and he promises to comply with the terms of the agreement.

loans.use: to maintain his car and to buy milk in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty needs another loan to buy onions for planting. She is a thirty eight year old married woman with four children living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal,Uganda. She is a farmer and, with the income generated, she has been able to provide basics to her family members.

loans.use: to buy onions for planting.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is an elderly lady aged 66.  She has seven children above the age of 23 and she is widowed.  She owns semi-permanent rental houses which earn her a living.  She has been renting out these houses for five years.  Besides this, she farms to supplement her income.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans which she has used to boost her business.
Jacinta hopes to build permanent rental houses in five years.  She has requested for 65,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the rental houses.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Avelina has a retail shop that sells fish, such as sardines and salmon. She has had this business for 10 years. Avelina has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell in her store.

Avelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a married woman with four children, three girls and one boy, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a vegetable stall business where she earns her other source of income. Siti faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability of products in her business. She dreams of becoming a vegetable supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, beans, maize flour, and potatoes.

loans.name: Dilana

texts.es:
Dilana 
Comercio
150000
	Dilana es una joven de 23 años de edad quién acaba de empezar a vivir en pareja, actualmente no tienen hijos, viven en un barrio de Puntarenas llamado Fray Casiano, su mayor deseo es trabajar y formar su capital para tener una mejor calidad de vida dada las condiciones sociales del lugar donde viven. 
	Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior que comercializa directamente con un importador que vive en San Ramón, ciudad a unos 50 Km de donde vive, él le da un mes de crédito para que ella coloque el producto y recupere el dinero. El objetivo de este préstamo es aprovechar el gran aumento que se da en el comercio por la época de fin de año y adquirir un poco más de mercadería para obtener una mayor ganancia. Dilana sale a vender y cobrar en bicicleta todas las tardes ya que por las mañanas está llevando cursos de computación que imparte la Universidad de Costa Rica.
	Su meta más importante es salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida, ser una mejor empresaria y triunfar en el negocio. Ella dice que los obstáculos son para los conformistas y miedosos una microempresaria tiene que ver para adelante sacar provecho de los problemas ya que estos siempre van a estar presentes.
texts.en:
Dilana is a young woman of 23 who has just started living with her partner.  They do not currently have children.  They live in a neighborhood of Puntarenas called Fray Casiano.  Dilana's biggest wish is to work and create capital so that she can enjoy a better quality of life given the social conditions of the place where she lives.

Dilana's business is selling underwear.  She works directly with an importer who lives in San Ramón: a city 50km from where she lives.  He gives her a month's credit so that she can sell her products and recover her money.  The aim of this loan is to make the most of a large increase in her sales which she experiences during the end-of-year season.  She will acquire a little more merchandise so that she can make more profits.  Dilana goes out on her bicycle to sell her products and collect payment every afternoon because in the mornings she attends courses in computing at the University of Costa Rica.

Dilana's most important goal is to get ahead and improve her quality of life.  She would like to become a better businesswoman and be successful in her business.  She says that obstacles are for conformists and cowards.  A micro businesswoman has to know how to derive benefit from problems as they will always be there.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, mainly underwear, which she distributes in her town

loans.name: Clencia

texts.es:
Clencia nació en la ciudad de Olantaytambo pero vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, ella tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. 

Clencia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanía de tipo tejido, ella vende sus productos en uno de los mercados de artesanía más populares de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Clencia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y también para comprar lana.
 
Clencia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Clencia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Choquekillca” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Clencia was born in the city of Ollantaytambo, but she lives in the city of Urubamba. Clencia, 45, is in a common-law relationship and has two children. She carries out her daily and economic activities in the city of Ollantaytambo. 

She produces and sells knitted handicrafts. Clencia sells her products in one of the most popular artisan markets in Ollantaytambo. She has been in this business for many years and is doing well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work.

Clencia needs the loan to buy merchandise and also to buy wool. She is thankful for the opportunity brought to her through this means and promises to make her payments according to the time line. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Choquekillca” in the Asociación Arariwa located in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and wool.

loans.name: Sope Serign Babacar Sy Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent la même localité. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité

Amy (debout à gauche de la photo de tout blanc vêtue)est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Amy fait de l embauche ovine avec son prêt de 50000 francs CFA elle va acheter 40 poussins et 3 sacs d aliments afin de développer son activité de petit élevage de volaille.

Elle compte revendre ses poussins plus tard pour faire des bénéfices qu'elle va utiliser pour régler les frais médicaux et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 23 rd November 2011.It is made up of 9 women who live in the same neighbourhood. They are organised by proximity and by affinity.

Amy (standing up on the left of the photo dressed in white ) is the leader of the group. She is 38 years old. She is married with 5 children.

Amy fattens sheep and with her loan of 50000 CFA francs she wants to purchase 40 chickens and 3 bags of foodstuffs in order to develop her small poultry farming business.

She intends to resell her chickens later to make a profit which she will use to pay medical expenses and school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase chickens that she will fatten and resell.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is a farmer from the village Pirveli Obcha, West Georgia. He is 43-years-old, married and lives with his family: wife Lia, 3-year-old daughter, 2-year-old son and parents. The children go to kindergarten. Koba is leading the agricultural business of the family which is the main source of income for them. 

They have a vineyard with 1000 vine trees. Koba makes wine and vodka and sells them in the village. Also the family sells nuts, harvested from family owned 100 nut trees. Along with the above mentioned, Koba and his father run small bee-keeping farm. They have 5 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Gathered honey is sold locally. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Koba’s parents. 

Koba requested credit for purchasing additional 10 bee-hives and bee-colonies. He will triple the amount of gathered honey and sell it in the village. The income of the family will increase. They will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee-colonies.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral, son 16 las que integran dicho grupo.
La Sra. Estefania es una de las miembros del grupo, ella nos comenta que se dedica a la costura, trabajo gracias al cual pudo salir adelante y ayudar a mantener la casa y a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y creativa, y comenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace tiene una buena clientela.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, cierres, botones y demás insumos necesarios para su taller, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y desea poder cumplir con ellos. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que les da a ella y a su grupo.
texts.en:
The committee known as Hard-working Women was started by means of the management and support of a group of women who work in the area.  The members of the committee set as their main objective the personal growth of each one of them in their labors.  There are 16 members that comprise said group. 
Señora Estefania is one of the members of the group.  She tells us that she is dedicated to dressmaking.  It is thanks to this work that she is able to do well and to help maintain the house and her family.  She is a creative, enterprising, and very hard-working woman, and she tells us that thanks to her good work she has a good clientele.  She requests the loan for the purchase of fabrics, closings, buttons and other necessary supplies for her workshop, since she has many orders and wants to be able to fill them.  She thanks the foundation for the opportunity that it gives her and her group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, closings, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Regina has a junk shop that sells recycled materials like plastics, bottles & metals. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

Regina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
My name is Teresa, I  am 49 years old, I left school after finishing lower school and started working with my parents.

I work in a family business that manufactures underwear and sells to small distributors in a flee market in Texmelucan. We have been in the same business for more than 20 years. All my brothers and sisters and their families work in the business.

I have a sewing work shop inside my house, so I usually work in the production. 

My biggest accomplishment is that I have a house and some financial stability, in the future I will like to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy fabric for underwear production.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is gentle, optimistic and hard working woman, with 31 years old, she lives in Altamira, Tamaulipas and married with a chemical engineer, she started her own business to help to her husband in the family expenses. She is thinking about the future of her babies, because she wants a better life for them, she started to sell shoes around her neighborhood since 4 years ago, then, she changed the way of shoes sales for school articles sales. She is doing in a small place that is in front of her house. Actually she is studying to be technic beauty and thinks to have a beauty salon. She has a stationery store that is perfectly working.

** She is requesting for a loan of $650 DLLS to purchase raw materials like pencils, pens, notebooks and more, hopes to grow up her business and satisfy the next high demand. She will be thanksful and her family too.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

** Sonia tiene 31 años, es gentil, optimista y muy trabajadora. Vive en Altamira Tamaulipas y se caso con un Ingeniero Químico, inició su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, Sonia piensa mucho en el futuro de sus bebes y desea proporcionarles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida, comenzó a vender zapatos a los alrededores de donde vive hace ya 4 años, después cambió el giro de venta por la venta de artículos escolares haciéndolo en un pequeño lugar enfrente de su casa. Actualmente esta estudiando para ser estilista y en un futuro quiere poner su propio salón de belleza.

** Sonia requiere de $650 DLLS para comprar materia prima como lápices, plumas libretas y más. Necesita de algunos artículos y materiales para su papelería con el fin de poder hacerla crecer. Ella como su familia te agradecerán la ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Material

loans.name: Doris Margoth

texts.en:
My business is the sales of clothing for women and children, it is a good business which has enabled me to support my children and to take care of the household expenses. As the summer season approaches, I need to stock my business with various products and to better my earnings in order to invest them in my children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi negocio es la venta de ropa dama y niño, este es un buen negocio ya que me ayuda a mantener a mis hijos y apoyar en los gastos de mi casa. En esta epoca de verano necesito surtir mi negocio con productos variados y mejorar mis ingresos para invertirlos en los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase shorts, glasses, sunscreen and other accessories and summer clothing.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Mr. M. opened his business 3 years ago and his wife and son help him watch it. He supplies bread for many stores in his area. Mr. M. says "I'd like to keep all my customers happy, but my mixer broke down so I can no longer make the same amount of bread. I need your help for a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. M. ha formado su negocio en tres años y lo atienden su hijo y su esposa, él provee a varios negocios del sector. "Quiero seguir manteniendo a todos mis clientes contentos, solo que la batidora que tengo se quemo y ya no puedo producir la misma cantidad de piezas de pan, solicito su ayuda, con $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Comprar una batidora industrial.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Mrs. Khen T., 53, is a mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, together, put all their effort toward working very hard on a farm growing rice and a variety of fresh vegetables. Early every morning, the couple’s children collect the produce and sell it at a market which enables them to make on average about $3.65 each day. Currently, this couple is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm. You are the one who will determine their success and play an important role in their business’s growth.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, 38 years old, is from Manunu. She is an expert in making fine mats, pictured above with one that is half-made. Christina says that she cannot wait to finish it, so she can make more. Since she left school, she has been part of a team of women who all specialise in fine mat production - Christina learnt the skill from watching the older women. Since she was given the assistance from SPBD, Christina has been able to put her fine mat production skills into good use, and to earn money for her family. She is very happy with the contribution she now makes towards supporting her family, in particular, to the church and village obligations that they have as a family and members of the Manunu village. 
Christina is asking for a loan of US$500 to help further develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Felícitas Fortunata

texts.en:
Felícitas Fortunata A. M. is part of a village bank called “Amaquella,” which is Quechua (native language) for “Don’t be lazy.”

Felícitas has a soft spot in her heart for children which is immediately obvious as upon entering her “bodega,” or small grocery store. Amidst the daily necessities every grocery store provides--staple foods, soda, cleaners, utensils--Felícitas has dedicated an entire wall to children’s toys. There are stuffed animals, dolls, games, costumes, and anything else a small child’s heart desires. Felícitas says the neighborhood children always stop by for candy or for a birthday present on their way to a “cumpleaños,” or birthday.

For four years, Felícitas has owned and maintained her grocery store in a pleasant neighborhood just outside of the city center of Ayacucho, Peru. Years before, and for the majority of her professional life, Felícitas rented a store in downtown Ayacucho, where she sold children’s clothing. Though she greatly enjoyed her work selling clothing, it was very expensive to rent space in the city, and Felícitas preferred to buy her own place to run her own, more independent business. Today, this is exactly what she does. After switching from selling clothing to groceries, a more practical market in her current neighborhood, Felícitas now spends every single day behind the store counter. She arrives at 5:00 a.m. each morning to begin selling fresh bread for breakfast and doesn’t leave until 9 p.m. that evening. It is tiring, she admits, but also very rewarding, and she does get the occasional break when one of her six grown children stop by to take over the counter from time to time.

Within her village bank, Felícitas is extremely happy. She loves that is a place where she can spend time with her friends, laughing and chatting, while at the same time getting down to business, paying loans, and accomplishing goals. Through the loans she receives from her village bank, Felícitas is always looking for ways to increase business and attract new customers. With the $600 loan she is hoping to receive, Felícitas will be able to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.use: With the $600 loan she is hoping to receive, Felícitas will be able to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Subgroup E Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
Athumani, age 29, lives with his wife and 7-year-old daughter. His business involves selling small packets of powdered soap from door to door, which he began doing in 2005. Before this soap business, he sold peanuts and cassava. He now sells soap from 7am to 10am, after which he sells it outside their house until evening. He buys a 50 kg bag of soap at about $11 and decants it into smaller packets to sell. One 50 kg bag gives him a profit of around $6. Athumani also does part-time work making small house repairs and construction.

Athumani is the leader of Subgroup E for group Sungura (Swahili for “Rabbit”), which totals 31 members. He will be sharing this loan with his subgroup members: Emmanuel M. (bicycle repair shop), Shababani Y. (general store), Godfrey F. (market seller), Gloria G. (market seller), and Kefline L. (market seller). Athumani knows each of his subgroup members and their businesses personally since they all live and work in the same neighborhood. Within the last few months, they were able to pay back their 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania successfully.

With this new loan, Athumani wishes to buy more sacks of powdered soap. He also hopes to eventually expand his business to begin selling candy and biscuits.

In the picture, Athumani is wearing the red cap.

loans.use: To buy powdered soap

loans.name: Ari Mpya B Group

texts.en:
Vicky, age 30, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 7, and 3). She is a food vendor, and has had this business for 5 years now. She makes a profit of about $250 a month from selling various types of food.

Vicky is a member of the group Ari Mpya B and she hopes to share a loan with her subgroup members to enhance her business.

loans.use: To increase food stock

loans.name: Gladias Melania

texts.es:
Mrs. Gladias L. is in the business of clothing sales, which she sells from her own stall in the market at the terminal in the beautiful city of León, Nicaragua. Mrs. L. has 22 years of experience in the business, which she has worked very hard to maintain.

She started the business out in the open air from a small basket, and then got her own section where she could place her products.

Ceprodel has been providing her with financial assistance for six years, with a total of 10 credits that have allowed her to increase the amount of merchandise and achieve subsistence for her children she is raising, thanks to the business that generates the income to allow her to live a dignified life. She currently needs to acquire more merchandise (clothing) to sell, and for this reason she is requesting help from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Gladias L. se refiere a la venta de ropa en un local propio dentro del mercado la terminal en la bella ciudad de León Nicaragua. La señora L. tiene 22 años de dedicarse a este negocio que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego obtiene su tramo propio donde colocar sus productos.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero por un periodo de seis años con un total de 10 créditos que le han impactado de manera que ha incrementado su mercadería y logrado la subsistencia para sus hijos que los está formando gracias al negocio que le genera utilidad para poder vivir dignamente. Su necesidad actual es la urgencia de adquirir mas mercadería (ropa) para comercializarla, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel buscando este apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Kairun

texts.en:
Kairun is 33 years old. She is married with three children, ages fourteen, ten, and four. Kairun owns a small shop, which she started in 2007.

Everyday, she works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm at her business. She would like a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Monsiváis empezó su negocio hace mas de 12 años de manera fortuita, cuando su hija mayor no quiso seguir estudiando entonces buscando una actividad en la que se pudiera desarrollar para que no perdiera el tiempo y se ocupara de algo, fue que decidió vender frituras y refrescos en su casa, poco a poco han invertido al negocio y lo han hecho crecer hasta tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual se convirtió en un negocio familiar ya que su esposo le ayuda a atenderla.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mercancía para la tienda, y poder seguir creciendo así como salir adelante. Ayudemos a Martha y su familia a seguir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Monsiváis started his business more than 12 years ago accidentally when his eldest daughter did not want to continue studying; he began looking for an activity that would allow her to develop so as not to lose time, so they decided to sell fried foods and refreshments at home. They have gradually invested in the business and it has now grown to become a small grocery store, which is also a family business since her husband helps take care of it.

Now they are asking for a loan of $ 675 to be paid off in 4 months to buy supplies for the store, which will ensure their continued success and growth. Let us help Martha and her family to move forward.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a clothing vendor from the city of Ordshonikidze in south central Ukraine. She sells a nice selection of clothing from a kiosk at the busy Ordshonikidze central market. Tatyana has been in business for about six years. A large assortment of available clothing and a discount system have helped Tatyana build a successful business with many repeat customers. Tatyana is married and has one child. Her business is a good source of income for her family.

Tatyana has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven ($525 USD) to add to her business capital and to help her purchase new clothing inventory for the summer season. Many customers want to update their wardrobes after the cold winter. This loan will help Tatyana be prepared for the new season with a new supply of inventory to sell.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory for the summer season

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica is 58 years old and originally from Otusco. She lives in Alto Trujillo District, Trujillo Province in the La Libertad region. She only completed elementary school and has one daughter.

Angélica works selling briquettes, both hot and cold. Her business, located in her house, was started around two years ago and, together with her son, she delivers the briquettes to the home of some neighbors.

With the first loan of 300 Peruvian Nuevo Soles provided by the Manuela Ramos organization, she purchased the briquettes and started earning income which helped to improve her quality of life. Angélica joined the “Las Conquistadoras II ” community bank via invitation from her neighbor Adelina, who was interested in starting a community bank.

With this loan of 1,200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more briquettes.

She want to continue moving ahead, and hopes to be able to travel to the mountains to bring vegetables and stews to sell so that she can change businesses because the selling of briquettes isn't generating the income that it did when she first started.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica tiene 58 años de edad, natural de Otusco; vive en el Distrito de Alto Trujillo, Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad; estudió sólo la primaria , tiene 01 hija. La señora Angélica se dedica a la venta de briqueta, encendida y apagada, este negocio lo tiene en su casa, aproximadamente hace 02 años y conjuntamente con su hijo reparten las briquetas a domicilio de algunos vecinos. . Con los S/.300.otorgado por Manuela Ramos como primer préstamo, compró las briquetas, y empezó a tener ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. La señora Angélica ingresa al Banco Comunal “Las Conquistadoras II ” por invitación de su vecina Adelina la cual estaba interesada en formar un banco comunal Con el préstamo de S/.1,200.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra briquetas. Ella desea salir adelante, viajando a la sierra y poder traer las verduras y menestras y así cambiar el negocio, porque la venta de briqueta ha bajado notablemente y no le genera los mismos ingresos que tubo al iniciarlo.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir Q. is a 34-year-old salesperson who sells washing machines, refrigerators and kitchen appliances. He has been in this field since 1992. This store is owned by his brother and Zakir works as the sales manager.

Zakir has decided to open his own store in another village named Imishli. The first step he needs to take is to make repairs in the new building and then he will be able to open the store and sell the same products. For this purpose he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To make repairs in a building to house a kitchen appliance store

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta N. is a fishmonger. She is married. Her husband is a nurse, but his income is not sufficient to support Alberta and her 2 children.

Alberta has many customers, and she wants to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for a loan to provide additional capital to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her fish selling business.

loans.name: Abdul Bashir

texts.en:
A. Bashir is married. He lives in a household of 8 members, and he has a shoe shop, a business that he started in Pakistan 8 years ago. After the collapse of the Taliban, he came back to Afghanistan and now he is continuing his business in Kabul. He wants to enlarge his shoe shop.

So he wants to take out an individual loan to buy new designs of shoes and complete his stock to make his business in Afghanistan strong so as to help his family here better.

Bashir is very happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan. People can use this kind of opportunity to make their lives better and expand their businesses. A. Bashir wants to open more shops in the future. He would like to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy new styles of shoes

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.en:
Rasuljon U. is 49 years old and is married with two children. In addition to his wife and children, he also supports his parents.

Rasuljon is a very diligent and hard-working man. He uses his car to provide taxi services within the city of Isfara in northern Tajikistan. For the last three years, this business has supplied the main income for the family, allowing Rasuljon to improve the living conditions of his large family.

As with any business that generates the income for a family, Rasuljon's business requires some investments from time to time. Now, his car needs the thorough fixing. So Rasuljon is requesting $900 USD for 9 months. 

Having proved himself as a reliable client, Rasuljon promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all who are supporting him.

loans.use: Thorough fixing of the vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en: Chuong T., 26, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works together with her husband as construction builders, building houses. They make a combined amount around US$7 each day. Mrs. Chuong would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi whenever he is free from construction work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas ubicado en la Av. Túpac Amaru Mz. 1 Lt. 1, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 67 años D. edad, es viuda y es madre D. 5 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. carbón. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con 3 carros como herramienta D. trabajo, estos carros trabajan transportando madera. Tiene el apoyo se sus hijos.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, etc.

Elvira demuestra felicidad porque cuenta con el apoyo del banco comunal y con la ayuda D. sus queridos hijos. Agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Ms. Elvira P. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Túpac Amaru Avenue, block 1 lot 1, in the Yarinacocha district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 67 years old, widowed, and has 5 grown-up children. She decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in charcoal sales. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 8 years.

She currently owns 3 trucks—her work tools. These trucks are used to transport lumber. She has her children’s support.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 4 tires, repair the engine, etc.

Elvira displays happiness because she has the support of both the microfinance institute and her beloved children. She thanks God for giving her life and health.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 4 tires, fix engine, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 53 años y vive con su esposo. Hace 4 años tomó una decisión importante para la economía de su familia, compró un camión, decisión que ahora le permite tener una estabilidad económica, con la movilidad que posee recoge toda la arena necesaria de la rivera del río y la vende por camionada, para eso contrata a peones que le ayuden a cargar la arena. Hasta el momento, considera que le está yendo bien, por lo cual en sus planes futuros está el de tener su propio almacén, para que siempre tenga disponible estos materiales para la venta, María está muy motivada por la ganancia que genera esta actividad. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas de devolución. Esta cantidad le servirá para invertir en el cambio de motor de su camión, de gasolina a petróleo.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her husband. Four years ago, she made an important decision for her family's finances and bought a truck, which now allows her to have economic stability. She uses the mobility of her truck to gather sand from the riverbanks and sell it, and hires laborers to help her load the sand. So far, this has been going well, but her future plans include owning her own warehouse so these materials are always available for sale. María is very motivated by the wages this work generates. This is the second time she has sought a loan from MFP, and she has demonstrated punctuality in her repayments. This loan will be invested to switch her truck's engine from gas to diesel.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the engine of the truck used for business

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.en:
Jamoliddin is a 51-year-old man who is married with two children. He dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on the microbus for his public transport business, which he drives personally. His usual itinerary is the Kanibadam-Isfara route. Jamoliddin has about 10 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high but there is also a great demand. Jamoliddin is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1025 USD) for the term of 12 months. With the loan he’ll purchase spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Jamoliddin will continue to progress. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his microbus

loans.name: Olman Quesada

texts.es:
Don Olman Quesada V. es un señor de 35 años de edad. Vive en una casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos. Es un productor de leche desde hace tres años. Anteriormente se dedicaba con su familia al ganado de engorde (carne) pero poco a poco ha ido cambiando al ganado de leche lo cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
Don Olman vive en El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de unos dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. 
El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano, sin embargo varias veces al año, el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que caen en la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en el Atlántico de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona.
Don Olman comenzó sembrando un pequeño sector de su finca con pastos para picar y así darle un mejor alimento a sus vacas de leche. Su idea es ir mejorando la calidad del alimento que da a sus vacas para producir más leche. Además quiere mantener los costos bajos utilizando alimentos que puede producir en la misma finca en lugar de tener que comprar concentrados u otros alimentos más caros. Actualmente el pasto lo corta y pica a mano utilizando un machete.
Don Olman desea sacar un préstamo de ¢500.000 ($900) para comprar más semilla de pasto y una máquina para picar pasto. Él dice que si logra tener más alimento para el ganado dentro de la misma finca podrá mejorar el rendimiento actual y así tener más ganancias. El préstamo lo va a sacar pensando en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos hijos y su esposa. Sí hay más ingresos se beneficia toda la familia.
