Don Olman es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la microfinanciera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya cuatro  préstamos y todos los ha cancelado satisfactoriamente. El cuenta que al principio no tenía terreno ni vacas pero que a través de su vinculación con la organización ha ido sacando préstamos que ha ido pagando y así a cambiado su vida y que ahora él se considera un microempresario.
texts.en:
Don Olman Quesada V. is 35 years old; he lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been producing milk for three years. Previously, he and his family were raised cattle, but little by little he has shifted to dairy, which has helped him to move his family forward. Don Olman lives in El Sauce de Santa Teresita in Turrialba. It's a small rural community of 2,000 residents. The settlers all work mainly in milk production and coffee planting. It has a rugged terrain and much of the ground is damp tropical forest. The community has very picturesque scenery: tropical forest combined with two pretty lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms. El Sauce is located about 1.5 hours by bus from Turrialba, the closest commercial center, however several times a year, the road becomes impassable from the rains that fall in the region. This is without doubt one of the main challenges for the community. When there were not a lot of activities, many people opted to leave and search for work in Turrialba or on banana farms located on the Atlantic in Costa Rica. Presently, the price of coffee and milk has improved, hence the neighbors are looking to invest in projects in their own region. Don Olman started planting a small area of his farm with pasture which has given him better food for his dairy cows. Moreover, he wants to keep his costs low by using food that he can produce on his own farm instead of needing to buy extract and other food that is more expensive. Presently, his grass is cut and picked by hand using a machete. Don Olman wants to take out of loan of ¢500.000 ($900) to buy more grass seed and a machine to pick the grass. He says he will achieve more food for the cows within his own farm and he will be able to improve his output and make more money. The loan he is going to take will improve the quality of life of his two children and his wife. If there are more earnings, it benefits the whole family. Don Olman is a client of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, a local organization that partners with the microfinance institution EDESA. Thanks to his connection with this organization, he has already received four loans, and all have been repaid satisfactorily. When Don Olman started he had no land or cows, but through his connection to the organization he has taken loans and repaid them, and this has changed his life, so that now he is considered a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grass seed and a machine to pick the grass

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is divorced with one child. She sells clothing and shoes at Drogobych market. She has been in this business for 4 years. Irina would like to open a second business location in a small neighboring city to increase her sales. This would help her deal with the current situation in the Ukrainian economy. Irina would like to get a loan of 1,500 UAH to increase her inventory. Irina is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person and believes she can overcome all business and personal life difficulties!

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo. She sells women’s clothing and lingerie in the central market. Her small vending place is located right in the center of the marketplace. It’s always stocked with good quality inventory and comes in a variety of colors and trends. Ludmila has been in this trade for 4 years.

She credits much of her success to the additional financial assistance she has received. Presently, Ludmila has about 13,000 Hryvni in gross income. Funds invested in inventory – 30,000 Hryvni. Her monthly income is about 4,000 Hryvni.

Ludmila has requested a loan of $875 (7,000 Ukrainian Hryvni) to open one more vending location and add to her working business capital. She hopes to increase her sales and resulting profits.

loans.use: To expand her vending business

loans.name: Safia M.din Group

texts.en:
Safia baji is the wife of M. Din who lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its Punjabi foods and historical places. Her husband runs a Punjabi food-selling business. He specifically sells daal chawal and Dahi bhalas at his shop. He has a good number of customers for his food business. Safia baji is the mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters who are getting an education. She is an uneducated lady but she has an ambition to give her children a better future by providing them a good education; to fulfill that ambition she sews clothes for her neighbors and relatives. She uses her income to pay off the education expenses such as school fees, uniforms, and books. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil, spices and rice) for her husband’s food-selling business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy paintbrushes to complete the job of painting houses. Neelam baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Qubra baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her butcher shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for food-selling business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria L. lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband works in the Philippine military.

She is a new member of Paglaum Coop who joined in March. She borrowed PHP 7,000 for her first loan cycle as additional capitalization for her existing business, which is the buying and selling of Ready-To-Wear (RTW) clothing items. She wishes to save for a better future.

loans.use: To buy stock of Ready to Wear clothes

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr: Mme PASSAÏ Hodalo est une femme très dévouée à la cause sociale. C’est pourquoi elle s’est très tôt lancée dans la vente de pagne pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement pour élargir son étalage, commander de nouveaux pagnes pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices seront mis à la disposition des familles démunies et des enfants déshérités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hodalo PASSAÏ is a woman very much devoted to the social cause. This is why she started selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) early on, in order to provide for her family. She's seeking a loan to expand her stall and to order new pagnes, in order to better meet customer demand. Profits will be given to destitute families and underprivileged children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through Junior High. Leticia has been selling food products such as cassava, plantains, yams and cereals in Abura for the past 14 years. Her husband is a cleaner whose income is too small to take care of the family. Leticia uses all her income for feeding and clothing the entire family. Leticia will use the loan to purchase food products in bulk for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Leticia plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase the food products in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Claudia Maricela

texts.es: Claudia Maricela B. S. de 23 años de edad vive en Ahuachapán, junto a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad. Ella posee un comedor, en el cual vende bebidas, golosinas, desayunos y almuerzos y posee mucha experiencia en lo que realiza ya que desde que era una niña trabajo junto a su tía en dicho lugar. Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar más granos básicos, así como también golosinas y bebidas, ella desea ver muy prospero su negocio, ya que como madre soltera debe trabajar muy duro para brindarle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Claudia Maricela B. S. is 23 years old and lives in Ahuachapán with her young three year old daughter. She owns a small restaurant where she sells drinks, candy, breakfasts and lunches and has a lot of experience in what she does because she began working there with her aunt when she was a girl. Claudia is requesting a loan to buy more basic grains along with candy and drinks. She wishes to see her business thriving because as a single mother she must work hard in order to give a better life to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy and drinks

loans.name: Cao Thị

texts.en:
D. Cao Thị (1012060351) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, D. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. D. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, D. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. D. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be her seventh from TYM Fund. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia O. C. reside en el municipio de Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. A sus 36 años María se encuentra casada y madre de tres hijos todos aun menores de edad y estudiando. Edwin el esposo de María trabaja como albañil y aporta a la familia US $50 mensuales, con estos ingresos la familia no lograría salir adelante, es por ello que María monto hace ya diez años su propio negocio el cual le genera ingresos que son de gran ayuda para la familia, el negocio de María es la venta de variedad de zapatos, se encuentra ubicado en el mercado municipal de la  zona, donde hay mucha afluencia de personas lo cual le ayuda a vender más rápido sus zapatos;  el crédito que solicita María es para la compra de nuevos estilos en zapatos que le ayudaran aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Julia O. C. lives in the municipality of Sensuntepeque in the province of Cabañas. María is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children who are still in school. Her husband, Edwin, is a mason. He earns US $50 a month, which was not enough for the family to get ahead. For this reason María opened her own business 10 years ago. The income it generates is very important to her family. She sells different types of shoes at the municipal market. The market is very well attended which allows for quick turnover of her merchandise. María will use the loan to buy new shoe styles, which will help her increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new shoe styles

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: cette femme réside dans le quartier d'agoè logopé, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de pagnes, mèches et produits cosmétiques, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2007 et le fait de façon ambulante. voulant agrandir son commerce pour gagner beaucoup plus d'argent, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes "HI-target", 5 cartons de mèches,4 cartons de perruques et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This is a woman who resides in the Agoè Logopé district. She is married and the mother of four. Her revenue-generating business involves commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth), hair extensions, and cosmetics. She started this business in 2007 and operates door-to-door. Wanting to expand her business to earn more money, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 15 bolts of HI-Target pagnes, 5 boxes of hair extensions, 4 boxes of wigs, and various cosmetics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, hair extensions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Lolita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata S. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république).  
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Fatoumata  a  très vite appris   le commerce,  dès son bas âge,  auprès de sa maman  qui appartient à l’ethnie Sarakolé (une ethnie de commerçant par excellence) au Mali.  Après plusieurs années d’apprentissages, elle opta finalement s’installer dans le domaine de l’alimentaire avec  la  transformation et la vente de l’atiéké  depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle achète de la pâte de manioc qu’elle transforme en atiéké,  en la fumant etc. Cette activité est rentable et lui procure assez de  revenus. 
En vu d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et satisfaire sa clientèle, Madame  Fatoumata S. décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  3 ans. Après 5  prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous  correctement remboursés, elle est à son premier  prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter,  50 sacs de pâte d’atiéké en Côte D’Ivoire et effectuer sa vente au marché Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux  dépenses quotidiennes  de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de pâte manioc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena E. who lives in the village of So. Garilao, Brgy. Guintubhan Isabela Negros Occidental, is 54 years old, and married to Pedro E.. He is 58 years old and helps her in run the business. They are blessed with four children who are 22 to 30 years old. They have already finished their college education, earned their degrees and are gainfully employed. This makes Elena and Pedro happy because in spite of the hardships they went through, having their children become professionals is quite an achievement.

Elena and her husband sell vegetables and spices, moving to each town that is having their market day.  They travel very early in the morning so that they arrive at the location early enough to set up before the customers come to the market. This is not an easy business because a lot of unexpected things could happen, like holdups, accidents, losses due to damage and others. Because of her dream to improve their living and send all children to school, they never minded the difficulties but instead focused on the future. They continued to sustain their business and whatever income they got they used to pay for the education of their children and the family expenses. When they learned that there was an available space for rent at the Isabela Public Market, they grabbed the opportunity to have a permanent place to sell their vegetables, spices and some basic household commodities that are in demand with the locals.

The need for fresh capital to expand her business prodded her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon. In the five years that she has been a member of NWTF-PD, she developed her business and improved the living status of her family. Now she earns PHP 15,000 per month, a big amount that could satisfactorily sustain their needs and prepare for their future when they grow old. For now, she maintains her good credit performance in NWTF-PD because she wants to get bigger loans in the future.

Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 was used as additional working capital for her business. The loan was fully paid without any delay. Now she wants to borrow for her 9th cycle PHP 19,500 for her business. Whatever income there is will be used for the expansion of the business and for their future.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable and spice vending

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sangita T. lives in the village of Dolchoki, which is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region, which makes the lives of the people living there difficult. Almost all people living in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are six members in Sangita's family, including herself. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband and two sons. 
Both Mrs. T. and her husband Mr. Minu Raj T. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. As the region is hilly, they face lots of problem in agricultural farming. Now, Mrs. T. is requesting her first term loan of Rs10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Navidad

texts.es:
El socio NAVIDAD pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos dos varones y tres mujer. 

El socio tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería donde produce todo tipo de mueble (escritorios, camas, sillas, puertas, etc.) a base de madera. El socio hace 20 años que tiene su taller 

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar la producción de fabricación de muebles de madera. El socio quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales de acabado como tiner, laca, cola, clavos, etc.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
NAVIDAD, 56, is a member of the "MINIBANK" communal bank; he is from the city of Cusco. He is married and has five children: two boys and three girls. He has a small carpentry workshop where he produces all kinds of wood furniture (desks, beds, chairs, doors, etc.) He has had his carpentry shop for 20 years. He needs financing to increase wood furniture production. He wants to buy more raw materials (wood) and finishing supplies like thinner, lacquer, adhesive, nails, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy finishing supplies for wood furniture.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Буриев Хуршед проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 21 год. Холост. Хуршед более 3 лет занимается перевозками, т.е. предоставляет услуги маршрутного такси по городу Душанбе. Кредит просит для ремонта своей автомашины, т.к. этот вид услуги является единственным источником дохода. На полученную прибыль хочет сыграть свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Hurshed B. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 21 years old. Unmarried. For over 3 years Hurshed has been in the transportation business, i.e. he provides minibus taxi services in Dushanbe. He is requesting the loan to fix his minibus, as the taxi service is his only source of income. With the profits he makes he wants to have a wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia M. is from the village of Olingan. She is 58 years old. Clemencia is married and has 3 grown-up children. To make a living, Clemencia runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community, and she is also engaged in rice retailing. Clemencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Clemencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Clemencia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business which is the rice retailing. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Clemencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Ma. Vilma A. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 43 years old. Ma. Vilma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Vilma raises and sells pigs. Ma. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP average per month from these activities.

In 2006, Ma. Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan was used to buy construction materials to repair her livestock cages. Ma. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be Ma. Vilma's 8th loan from PMPC and her second Kiva loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the daily needs of her family and her children's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señorita Verónica G. le esta haciendo falta el techo de enfrente de la casa. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y poder construir el techo de concreto ya que es más duradero y seguro.
Verónica G. trabaja en un clínica de el departamento de enfermera, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá su mama quien vive con ella. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la mama de la señorita Verónica ya que se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Srta. Verónica G. is currently missing a roof at the front of the house. She is requesting a loan to purchase the materials needed to build a concrete roof that is the most durable and secure.

Verónica works in the nursing department of a clinic and plans to repay this loan with her salary. Her household expenses are covered by her mother who lives with her.

Verónica’s mother appears in the photograph since she was away at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to install a concrete roof

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen Y. is from the village of Palattao in Naguilian, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Helen is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Helen Y..

Helen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Helen prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase ingredients for the food that she sells. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to buy more ingredients. This will be Helen's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa G. is from the town of Alicia, Isabela. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $113 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rayito de Luz  lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras las cuales se dedican al comercio de ropa. Una de ellas es la señora Mercedes Francisca B. V.. Ella inicio con su negocio de recargas, alquiler de teléfono y venta de ropa por medio de un pequeño  espacio que le brindo su hermano para que comercializara en su pulpería. 

En la actualidad su negocio se ha expandido tiene un local solo para este e invertirá el crédito en mercadería para seguir mejorando cada día.

Su compañera de grupo Karen Patricia M. R. de 21 años empezó a vender ropa desde su adolescencia ya que le ayudaba a su abuela a comercializar este producto. Con el tiempo le agrado trabajar así y empezó a vende ropa interior, pantalones, blusas etc. Mientras Víctor Manuel Aydi O. comercializa pantalones de todo tipo y marca.

Ellos invertirán el préstamo en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería y surtir con nuevos estilos sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Ray of Light group is made up of three hard-working entrepreneurs who work selling clothing. One of them is Mrs. Mercedes Francisca B. V.. She started a business selling cell phone minutes and clothing from a small space in her brother's general store, which he lets her use. Her business has grown and she know has her own store. She will use the loan to invest in merchandise and continue improving her business every day. Fellow group member Karen Patricia M. R. is 21 years old and she began to sell clothing when she was a teenager helping her grandmother with her business. Over the course of the years she grew to like the job and started to sell underwear, pants, shirts, and other clothing. Victor Manuel Aydi O. is the last group member, and he sells all kinds and brands of pants. They will use this laon to purchase more merchandise and stock their businesses with new styles and products.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Melitona

texts.es: LA SRA. MELITONA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA Y PRODUCCION DE ESCOBA DE PAJA QUE SE REALIZA MANUALMENTE, TIENE SU PROPIO DOMICILIO YA QUE DESDE MUY JOVEN A TRABAJADO PARA SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE, ES MADRE SOLTERA YA QUE SE  SEPARADO CON SU ESPOSO, TIENE SOLAMENTE DOS HIJOS A SU CARGO YA QUE LOS DEMAS SON INDEPENDIENTES, Y LE AYUDAN ECONOMICAMENTE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MATERIALES PARA REALIZAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y ASI INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, ES CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, EL CUAL SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER I KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Melitona lives in the town of El Torno. She produces and sells straw brooms that she makes by hand. Melitona has her own home where she has worked since she was a very young woman in order for her family to get ahead. She is a single mother who is separated from her husband. Only two of her children are still under her care while the rest are independent and help her financially.

The proceeds of the loan will be used to purchase materials for making her products and increase her working capital. She is a long-time client of our institution. Melitona is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust by providing her with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making brooms

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rojo está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Sandra del Socorro Jalinas Velázquez desde hace tres años vende cosméticos y ropa. Su sueño es poder llegar a tener un tramo en el mercado oriental por ello luchara arduamente.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Verónica Ninoska Hernández Martínez quien vende cosméticos y zapatos y Eugenia Martínez vende ropa y calzado. Ellas invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercadería para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Rojo ("Red") group consists of three hard-working women. One of the members is Sandra del Socorro Jalinas Velázquez, who for the past three years has sold cosmetics and clothing. Her dream is to be able to have a post at the east market, for which she has worked for arduously. Her fellow members are Verónica Ninoska Hernández Martínez, who sells cosmetics and shoes, and Eugenia Martínez, who sells clothing and footwear. The women plan to use the loan to purchase more merchandise for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita A., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She has been managing her own variety store for several years.

Rosita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrows to buy inventory for her variety store. Her business allows her to earn a profit of PHP 4,300 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying added inventory for her store.

She dreams that her business will earn more so that she can send her children to school until they graduate from college. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying added inventory for her store.

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
Cándida tiene 59 años,  se dedica a la venta de verduras, posee un puesto fijo de venta dentro del mercado municipal de Paraguarí, está casada con Agustín Paredes de 65 años.
Empezó a trabajar a los quince años como vendedora de sus padres, de quién aprendio el arte de las ventas y  después de dos años se independizó y habilitó su propio negocio.
 Además tiene cultivos de tomate y locote en finca heredada de sus padres con la ayuda de su esposo.
Es una señora  muy sacrificada, pues su horario laboral empieza a la 4:30hs.  y termina a las 15:00  hs ya que tiene que viajar siete kilometros.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de verduras en general del mercado de abasto de la cuidad de Asunción  pues tiene mucha demanda por la temporada.
texts.en:
Cándida is 59 years old and sells vegetables from a fixed location in the municipal market in Paraguarí. She is married to 65 year old Agustín. She began working as a salesperson for her parents at age 15, from whom she learned the art of selling. Two years later she became independent and started her own business. She also raises her own tomatoes and peppers, with the help of her husband, on land that she inherited from her parents. She is a woman who makes many sacrifices. She travels seven km daily. Her day begins at 4:30 am and she finishes at 3:00 pm. She needs this loan in order to buy vegetables in the Asunción wholesale market. She has lots of demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale vegetables

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Martha de edad de 40 años, por muchos años se ha dedicado  a su negocio una pequeña pulpería, el cual vende medio tiempo ya que trabaja para los pipitos, con el objetivo de obtener mas dinero para poder cubrir los gastos, ya que su esposo trabaja como conductor con un salario bajo.  Madre de un hijo el cual estudia.

Su casa es de concreto pero a un falta repellar las paredes, el cual hará mas después lo que le urge es poder hacer un sumidero y comprar un inodoro ya que las aguas negras no pasan por el barrio,  para poder lograr una mejor higiene para su familia ya que lo que tiene es una letrina de muchos años de uso. Para esto comprara materiales como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, madera.  Para hacer el local del inodoro, como comprar el inodoro nuevo y poder beneficiarse de esta mejora
texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and has dedicated herself for many years to her business, a small grocery store. She sells part-time since she works for the children, and has the objective of earning more income to cover financial expenses. Her husband works as a driver, but his salary is low. She is the mother of a school-aged child. Her house is made of concrete, but the walls still need to be plastered. She plans to take care of this later, since she has the more urgent need to install a drain and toilet since the sewer line does not pass through her neighborhood. This would provide better hygiene for the family, as they currently have a latrine that has been in use for many years. For this project, she would purchase materials such as: cinderblocks, sand, cement, steel, zinc and lumber. This would allow her to build the location for the toilet, to purchase a new toilet, and to benefit from this home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as: cinderblocks, sand, cement, and steel to build a drain and purchase a toilet for better hygiene.

loans.name: Margaret Nduta

texts.en:
Margaret Nduta is a lady who is married to Joseph Kimani and is the mother of four children aged between 23 to 30 years. Two of her children are casual laborers with some industrial companies while the other two are college students.

Margaret is a farmer and she has been practicing farming for the last twenty years. She specializes in both dairy and vegetable farming and later sells the produce and milk to her neighbors who are her customers and also supplies the same to a farmers’ cooperative society near her. She is able to take home a profit of Kshs 14,000 every month.

Margaret was introduced to KADET by one of its staff who had been conducting a promotional outreach within her area. Margaret then formed a group with her neighbors and she has now applied for a loan of Kshs 50,000 which she will use to extend her cattle shed to accommodate more cattle.

Margaret would like to take all her children abroad for further studies and also own a modest house, drive a good car, and make the best out of life for herself and her family. She describes herself as modest with a lot of ambition.

loans.use: To extend her cattle shed to accomodate more cattle

loans.name: Mujeres De Chinimabe Group

texts.es: Doña Gloria Esperanza M. P., es una señora casada, tiene 1 hijo D. edad D. 1 y 6 meses, ella apoya económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Gloria se dio cuenta que necesitaba surtir mas su negocio, para poder mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas vecinas, desD. hace mas D. 15 años se apoyan entre sí y deciden conformar un grupo, ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea, sabiendo que solo así se pueden vivir en una mejor sociedad.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza M. P. is married and has a one and a half year old son. She contributes to her family’s financial support and strives to prepare a better future for her son. She sells daily use items, a job she’s had for over 10 years. Gloria realized that she needed to improve her stock so that sales would increase thereby producing higher profits. So she got together with a few neighbors and for the last 15 years they have supported each other and formed into a group. She tries to help out not just her family but the other people in her village because she realizes that this is the only way they can live in a better society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es: Miguel Geronimo tiene 43 años. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha dado lo necesario a su familia. Miguel tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Pues siempre está pendiente de los que sus clientes le solicitan y tiene bastantes pedidos el destino del crédito es para la compra de trajes, pantalones faldas y trajes.
texts.en:
Miguel Geronimo is 43 years old. He has been buying and selling clothes for more than 12 years in order to provide for the needs of his family. Miguel has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time, so this is not the first time he has received a loan.

He is always concerned about what is customers are requesting and that he receives enough orders. The loan will be used to buy dresses, trousers, and skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dresses, trousers, and skirts

loans.name: Valasiolagi

texts.en: Valasiolagi B. is 42 and married with two children. She owns a business venture to sell a variety of different products in the local community. Valasiolagi has two years of experience in this business. Valasiolagi needs a loan of 2,500 Somoan talas to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or $208 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2009, Valasiolagi joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Valasiolagi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.es:
La Señora ROSE MARY F. B. es soltera pero vive con el señor FELIX ORELLANA  desde hace 5 años,  tiene 5 hijos de 24,22,20,3 y 7 años. Viven en la zona del Plan 3000 Barrio 15 de Mayo al sudeste  del Plan 3000.
 
Ella se hace cargo de el de tres y siete años, los demas hijos son independientes, la señora trabaja en una empresa de electrificación F y F como persona de limpieza y como bodeguera, además la señora trabaja en su casa tejiendo ropa de verano y ropa de invierno y cuenta con las maquinas para dicha tarea, pero con lo que no cuenta es con el material para poder realizar estos trabajos por que el sueldo que gana es poco y solo le alcanza para poder subsistir en gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios. 

Es por este motivo que ella solicita que se le ayude a poder generar mas ingresos mediante el material que le falta y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida que lleva.
texts.en:
Rose Mary F. B. is single, but she has lived with Felix Orellana for five years. She has five children, ages 24, 22, 20, 3, and 7. They live in the Plan 3000 area in the 15 de Mayo neighborhood, which is southeast of Plan 3000. Her three-year-old and seven-year-old children are the only ones under her care. The rest of the children are independent. She works as a cleaning lady and in the warehouse for the F and F electric company. She also works in her house knitting summer and winter clothes; she has machines for this work. But, what she does not have is the material to be able to do this work. The salary that she earns is small, and it only covers food expenses and utilities. That is the reason she is requesting help to be able to generate more income with the materials that she needs. That way she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is from the village of So. Pob. Plaridel. She is 44 years old, widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. Ruth owns and operates a business selling home products to tourists and local community members. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ruth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela Ramírez S. cuenta con un abarrotes denominado Abarrotes Meche desde hace 8 años, donde ofrece a sus cliente mejor calidad y un bajo precio. Su negocio han ido incrementado sus ventas pero ella no cuenta con capital para surtir su negocio es por eso que pide el apoyo tener mayor variedad en artículos.
texts.en: Estela R. S. has had a grocery store, named Abarrotes Meche, for 8 years where she offers her customers better quality and lower prices. Her business has been increasing its sales, but she doesn’t have the capital to stock her business and so she is asking for a loan to have a better variety of items.

loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Tulipan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tulipán está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Luz Marina Jarquín de 40 años se dedica al comercio de comida desde hace 10 años. Ella invertirá el préstamo en materia prima arroz, frijoles, cebolla, aceite, carne, pollo, tomate…etc. con el fin de mejorar su negocio.

Las otras integrantes son María Salvadora O. Martinez de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora que comercializa gallina en el mercado Oriental, Yamileth del Socorro O. de 33 años tiene una pequeña comideria negocio en el que invertirá y Sandra R. de 41 años comercializa pan, cafe y cafe con leche.
texts.en:
The Tulipán (Tulip) group is made up of four hard working women.  One of them is Luz Marina J., 40, who has sold prepared meals for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy raw materials like: rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, etc. to improve her business.

The other group members are: María Salvadora O. Martínez, 34, a hard working woman who sells chicken in the Oriental Market, Yamileth del Socorro Osorio, 33, who has a small eatery in which she will invest and Sandra

loans.use: For raw materials like: rice, beans, onions, cooking oil, meat, chicken, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 45 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Magdalena alterna sus actividad del hogar con la pequeña negocio, ella tiene en su domicilio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde expende productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y muchas cosas más. 

Magdalena con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar para esta época navideña que se está acercando dulces, galletas, pasteles navideños, panetones, bebidas, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  Magdalena divides her time between her household duties and her small business.  She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil and a lot more besides.

Magdalena will use her loan for 2,500 nuevos soles to increase her business capital.  She also wants to buy candies, cookies, Christmas cakes, panettones and drinks etc. for the approaching Christmas holiday period.

She is thankful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy candies, cookies, Christmas cakes, panettones, drinks, etc. for the approaching Christmas holiday period

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y de sus jóvenes hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa casual y calzado, en diferentes modelos y colores de acuerdo a la temporada. Este negocio le gusta mucho, ya que la convierte en una mujer independiente y durante este tiempo ha logrado captar buena clientela, entre amigos y conocidos que le compran constantemente a crédito, asimismo lleva su mercadería a una mina donde vende muy bien a los trabajadores; su gran carisma y la gran capacidad de persuasión le ha permitido vender y colocar los productos que ofrece, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias económicas. La mercadería que tiene es traída de la ciudad capital, aumentando su precio inicial, de esa manera, por tal razón se siente muy satisfecha, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es continuar en este rubro, y mas adelante instalar un negocio en algún puesto dentro de un centro comercial. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y también en abrir su granja.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her young children.  For 3 years she has been selling casual clothes and footwear in different styles and colors according to the season.  She likes her business a lot since it makes her an independent woman.  Over time, she has managed to attract a good group of customers, friends and acquaintances who buy from her constantly on credit.  She also takes her merchandise to a mine where she sells very well to the workers.  Her great charisma and gift of persuasion have allowed her to sell the products which she offers, making very good financial profits.  The merchandise she has is brought from the capital city, increasing its initial price.  She feels very satisfied since she can help her husband cover their household expenses.  Her greatest wish is to continue in this activity and, further down the line, set up her business on a stall in a shopping center.

This is Juana's second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those people who will fund her loan as it will help her a to make progress in her business.  She will invest the loan in buying more merchandise and also in opening a farm.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to have in stock.  To set up a farm

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 42 años, convive con Delia, de 34 años, producto de su amor nació Ruger, de 11 años. Los tres, en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio el palomar (selva central peruana). Este hombre trabajador menciona que hace poco tiempo decidió invertir en la siembra de más plantas de café. Ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a la agricultura, sus principales productos constan de café, plátano y maíz; los que negocia en el mercado de su ciudad. Pero según menciona, su producción de café saldrá recién a la venta, ya que la planta de café tarda 3 años en crecer y dar fruto, pero como son plantas nuevas darán un excelente grano. La seguridad de Raúl es sorprendente, ahora, desea invertir en la siembra de más café, pues sus planes son de adquirir más terrenos agrícolas para aumentar su producción y obtener más ganancias. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como presidente de su banco comunal, se siente feliz de dirigir y apoyar a sus integrantes donde asegura saldrá adelante. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 700 mamones (plantas de plátanos), así como también, 5 millares de plantas de café para el vivero que hará.
texts.en: Raúl, 42, lives with Delia, 34, and the product of their union, Roger, 11.  The three of them live in their own house, located in the town of Sanchirio del Palomar (in a forested region of central Peru).  This hard-working man says that he recently decided to plant more coffee.  He has operated his farm for 4 years.  He grows coffee, platanos and maize, all of which he sells at the local market.  According to Rodrigo, his coffee crop will soon be ready for sale.  Coffee takes 3 years to grow and bear fruit, but his plants are new and the beans they produce should be excellent.  His confidence is amazing and he now wants to grow more coffee.  He plans to buy more land to increase his production and, in turn, his income.  This is Rodrigo's third MFP loan and, as president of his community bank, he is happy to lead and support its members in their efforts to get ahead.  He will use this loan to buy 700 "mamones" (platano plants) and 5 thousand coffee plans for his next crop.

loans.use: Buy 700 platanos plants and 5 thousand coffee plants.

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es:
Magda es una madre muy dedicada a su familia como a su pequeño negocio de cosméticos. El cual ha venido aumentando su clientela por vender productos buenos y accesibles de precios en donde vende por catálogos.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con liquidación de su trabajo, luego para lograr comprar más productos inicia con un pequeño financiamiento en donde mejora su comercio ya que compra más producto lo que coloca más ventas.

Los financiamientos han venido hacer de gran beneficio para lograr el nivel de ventas e inventarios que ha logrado. Lo que más comprara es perfumes de dama y caballeros que se coloca mas es esta época y que vienen en una variedad de olores como accesibles de precios.
texts.en:
Magda is a mother who is very devoted to her family and to her small cosmetics business where her clientele has been growing because she sells good products at accessible prices; her sales are catalogue based.

She started her business using her severance pay from work.  Then, in order to be able to buy more products she started with a small loan which improved her commerce because buying more products leads to more sales.

The loans have turned into a great benefit to reach the levels of sales and inventory she’s achieved.  What she will buy the most of is perfume for ladies and for gentlemen which sells very well during this season and which are available in a variety of scents and accessible prices.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for both ladies and gentlemen.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es casada, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo de 1 año y 4 meses.
Karina es feriante, vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños que trae de Lima, compra en Gamarra y lo lleva  a la selva de San Francisco donde lo vende le va bien.
Le gusta Finca por los créditos, puede ahorrar y la capacitaciones que recibe de negocio, como hacer trabajar la plata. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería.
El sueño de Karina es poder establecer su negocio en un lugar fijo la selva de San Francisco y poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the community bank Wiñarisun.  She is 24 years old. She is married and has a son who is 16 months old.

Karina is a merchant at fairs. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She buys clothing in the Gamarra district in Lima and takes it to the countryside around San Francisco, where she sells it. This business is going well for her.

She likes Finca because of the loans it provides, because she is able to save, and for the training in business that she receives, such as in making her money work for her. She will invest the loan that she is applying for to stock her merchandise.

Karina's dream is to be able to establish her business in a fixed location in the San Francisco countryside and to build her house.

loans.use: Buy various clothing for resale

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica es una madre de familia de 18 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona conocida a nivel regional por producir principalmente limón y maracuyá. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella cuenta con mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la suele ofrecer en base a pedidos. El negocio le brinda algunos ingresos que utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se esfuerza continuamente por mantener su negocio y buscar nuevos clientes.

Luz desea adquirir más prendas de vestir para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan salir adelante y progresar. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is an 18 year old mother who lives with her husband and young child in one of the villages that make of the farming district of Olmos, an area known at a regional level for producing mainly lemons and passion fruit. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Luz Angélica works by selling clothes to the general public. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and sells them according to orders. This business provides her with some income so that she can help her husband with supporting their family. She strives continually to maintain her business and look for new customers.

Luz wants to acquire more articles of clothing so that she can increase her sales and earn more income to allow her to move forward and make progress. To achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

loans.use: Acquire more clothing to sell

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mrs. Yorn P. is a married woman located in Roluos village in Takeo province where she was born in 1986. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ban Tet, is a construction worker. In the rice field, it is time to grow rice, so she needs some money to plant. Mrs. Yorn P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and plow her rice field. She is the mother of two small children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and plow her rice field

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. They live in a home that she rents where she has access to neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

Rehema has a business of selling sweet potatoes and cassava.  She works seven days out of every week selling her products at the market.  The main business challenges for Rehema include seasonality and defaulters.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid S. is a married man. His wife takes care of the household chores while Majid goes out to run their motorcycle business. They have two children aged four and two years old. Majid and his wife hope to give a good education to their kids until they reach university level. His business is located at the Nyalenda-Kachok area in Kisumu.

Kisumu is the region of Kenya known for the production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the lake basin. 

Majid has been in the transportation business for five years and has two employees. He says that his business is profitable and his major challenge is theft. Thugs pretend to be customers and, on their way to the destination, they rob the person rendering the service. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He plans to use his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy another motorcycle to grow his business. He hopes to buy rickshaws some day. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita V. is from the town of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Jovita is married and has 10 adult children. 

To make a living, Jovita prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chon

texts.en: Chon S., 52, is married and has three children living at home.  She lives in the Kampong Chhnang province.  Since 2000, she has been selling meat and wine from home and is able to make about US$5 in profit each day. Her husband is a construction worker, making typically US$2 per day. Chon S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase wood, cement and other materials to complete the construction of her home.

loans.use: to complete the construction of her home

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Meldred requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.  Meldred has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Meldred would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 60 years old and married.  She has one child who is 34 years old.  Merlyn is a farmer and hog-raiser. She tills her land in Banga, South Cotabato, where she grows corn and rice. Merlyn also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Merlyn needs fertilizer for her farm and feed for the pigs she raies.  She plans to use the requested loan for these necessary business supplies.  Merlyn hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 56-year-old Rosemary (holding the yellow folder) from Masvingo. She is married with four children. She also cares for two dependents. Rosemary runs a retail trading business  where she sells clothing, fruit and vegetables. She does have additional sources of income. Her business has been in operation for 8 years. She says the main challenge she faces is competition. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of $400 to increase her store's stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Rosemary plans to operate from an outlet.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly is 42 years old and married. He is blessed with three children, all of whom are studying. Rolly is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 15 years. Rolly is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds of corn to be planted on his farm. Rolly hopes that this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 40,000 each crop in this field of work. Rolly wants to enlarge his farm to earn a higher income and continue sending his children to school to finish their education.

loans.use: to acquire farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married and blessed with three children. He is a hardworking farmer who has had a dairy for seven years.

Through Faulu Kenya Simon has developed his dairy, resulting in better milk production.

Simon has requested 20,000 KES to buy a dairy cow. He hopes to add more cows to his dairy so as to increase future milk production.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 75 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesora cesante, la socia también se dedica al negocio de manualidades, la socia hace colchas a croché y también teje pantalones para bebes, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana e hilos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "AMAUTA", located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is 75 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with work as a substitute teacher. She also has a craft business. She makes crocheted bedspreads and also knits pants for babies. Through this business she helps her children to get ahead.

She wants to increase her craft business. She asks for a loan to buy materials like yarn and thread. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials like yarn and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a responsible mother of four children. From the time she was young, she learned the honorable work of raising livestock, an activity that was passed down from her parents and that today brings her satisfaction. Thanks to her valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, she has been able to obtain good results from her sales. She has been running her own business for nine years.

Josefina's wish is to invest more capital in young animals. She hopes to continue her dedication to her work, believing that by improving her stock and feed, her livestock will bring better prices. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. This support will permit her to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 48 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16  y 19 años respectivamente. Marco es pensionado de las fuerzas armadas de colombia, donde aprendió la decoración con nudos y la marquetería, con lo que a partir del momento en que finalizó su servicio, se dedicó a la elaboración de cuadros marineros y medallas condecorativas, las cuales, aprovechando el conocimiento tanto del mercado como del personal de la Base Naval, ha ejercido con mucho éxito para complementar los ingresos familiares. Él tiene un negocio que inició una vez salió pensionado y decidió generar ingresos simultaneos aprovechando el conocimiento obtenido  y los contactos con proveedores y clientes para potencializar las ventas y lograr compras de calidad.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará marcos pinturas, para lograr hacer adecuaciones en su local y proyectar una imagen de higiene y calidad en el servicio, con lo cual captar la atención de clientes potenciales y el confort de sus clientes reales. Porque su sueño es fortalecer su microempresa permanentemente mediante su expansión y con ello poder apoyar la profesionalización de sus hijos, potenciando su éxito.
texts.en: Marcos, age 48, lives in the Soledad municipality, 15 minutes from Barranquilla city with his wife and two children, ages 16 and 19.  Marco is a pensioner of the Colombian armed forces, where he learned knot decoration and marquetry. From the moment that he finished his service, he has worked making marine art and commemorative medals. He has had great success supplementing his family's income, thanks to his knowledge of the market and his personal knowledge of the naval base. He has a business which he started when he retired in order to make an income on top of his pension. He took advantage of the knowledge he had obtained and the contacts with suppliers and clients to boost his sales and make quality purchases. This Kiva loan is his first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will purchase frames for paintings and make improvements to his store, in order to project an image of cleanliness and quality in his business. This will capture the attention of potential clients and create more comfort for his real clients. His dream is to strengthen his business permanently through its expansion, and to thus be able to support his children in becoming successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase frames for paintings and to make improvements to his store.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 24 years old and married to Tabitha. They have one child. For the last six years, George has been working in the construction industry in Kinoo, Kangemi Town. He was introduced to KADET by a staff member. George repaid his previous loan well and in good time. 

George is requesting a loan to purchase house construction supplies such as tools, cement, and sand. In the future, he hopes to have a registered construction company which will increase his financial status.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and supplies

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, vende lotería al por mayor, el cual lo reparte a sus clientes desde hace tres años, él vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas, todos los días sale a repartir los billetes de loteria de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para aumentar en sus ganancias y tener clientes y comprar más billetes de lotería por mayor, y con el tiempo trabajar propio.
El sueño de juan es crecer en su negocio mejorar en sus ingresos darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan sells lottery tickets wholesale, which he has distributed to his customers for three years.  He lives with his wife and two daughters.  Every day, Monday through Sunday, he goes out to distribute lottery tickets.

He needs the loan to increase his profits and have customers and buy more lottery tickets wholesale, and in time work for himself.

Juan's dream is to grow in his business, improve his earnings, and give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets wholesale.

loans.name: Somoina

texts.en:
Somoina is 42 years old.  She is married to Milia, who is a farmer, and together they have four children. She is a livestock trader in the busy Kitengela market. She has been in this business for the past two years. She has a monthly income of KES 5,000.

She was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. She is applying for her second loan in KADET. She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use half of the loan amount to purchase livestock and the rest to purchase food for the family. The anticipated profit will help her open a curio shop. Her dream is to own a ranch. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and food for her family.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 37 years-old and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a cook, and mother to their three children. Two have their own family while the youngest is still under her supervision. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Merlita oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of a Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 385 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlita dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business.. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old and married. She has four children and lives in Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Carmen owns a piggery and sells swine to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years and she earns 8,000 PHP per month. 

Carmen requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more swine for her piggery.
 
Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Carmen's future plan is to expand her swine business and to support the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more swine for her piggery.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 9ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 10 anos vende extensão de cabelos e mechas e tem um rendimento de cerca 7.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mechas e estensões de cabelos, para aumentar a sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende investir mais no melhoramento do seu  negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the town of Matola, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children, all of which attend school. She completed 9th grade and didn't continue because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over ten years. She sells hair weaves and extensions and earns an income of about 7.000mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 21.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase hair weaves and extensions so that she can increase the amount of her merchandise.
