Monsieur N. exerce l’activité de pêcheur  depuis 1989 après avoir quitté l’école primaire. C’est une activité qui lui a été recommandé par son père. Avant d’intégrer le secteur de la pêche  il a un peu évolué dans la maçonnerie. Il s’intéresse  beaucoup au développement  de son activité et a son aspect lucratif. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 dans le but d’acquérir un GPS qui est un appareil qui guide et oriente le pêcheur en pleine mer. Son but  est d’augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer la situation de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Alioune N. is a fisherman of 37 years. He lives at Yoff. He is married and father to 2 children of between 4 and 7 years old. Mr N. has been a fisherman since 1989 when he left primary school. It was the line of work that was recommended to him by his father. Before going into fishing, he worked in masonry for a while. He is very interested in the development of his profession and in its profit making aspect .He has been a member of the Yoff fund since March 2010.He requests a loan of 150 000 XOF with the intention of buying a GPS (global positioning system) which is an appliance that guides and orientates the fisherman in the open sea. His aim is to increase his income and improve the living and social conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing materials

loans.name: Ivy Marie

texts.en:
Ivy Marie E. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 26 years old. Ivy Marie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ivy Marie owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Ivy Marie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ivy Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Ivy Marie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ivy Marie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Leandro es el presidente del grupo “Club de la Amistad” los cuales agradecen la confianza por estos últimos seis años y espera que sigan apoyándoles a alcanzar sus metas. Leandro tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y vive en la zona de Horacio Zevallos en Huaycan, tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 24 años y ha trabajado con Edaprospo desde hace 3 años.

Leandro se ha dedicado a comprar, pelar y vender ají desde hace 10 años, además de esto también trabaja eventualmente en construcción y manejando mototaxis. Usará el crédito para comprar ajíes para después secarlos, pelarlos y venderlos por kilo a las personas que venden especerias en los mercados. El está contento por poder ayudar en los estudios de su hijo Harry en su carrera de contabilidad y desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leandro R. is the president of the "Club de la Amistad" (Friendship Club), whose members are grateful for the supprt they've been given throughout the past six years. They hope to continue to receive this support so that they can achieve their goals. Leandro is 52 years old, married, and lives in Horacio Zevallos district, in Huaycan.  He has 2 children aged 20 and 24 and has been working with Edaprospo for 3 years.  

For ten years, Leandro has worked buying, peeling and selling ají peppers. He also occasionally does construction work and drives mototaxis (converted motorbikes with cabins in back for transporting cargo or passengers).  He will use this loan to buy ají peppers, which he will then dry, peel and sell to people who sell spices in local markets. He is happy that he can help support his son Harry's education as he studies for his accountancy degree and he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy aji peppers

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha Granados es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio de abarrotes donde ofrece todo en mercancía como lo es botanas, refrescos, lácteos y mas. Para incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada ella necesita comprar más mercancía.
texts.en: Martha Granados is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She has had a grocery store business for three years, offering all kinds of merchandise such as snacks, soda pop, dairy products, and more. In order to increase her sales in this season she needs to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Esperanza West, Aurora, Isabela. Felipe has been in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during harvest season. In 2010, Felipe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Felipe is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som K. is married to Mr. Chek Nhel; both of them live in Roluos village in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a 1.80-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. She has some problems because it is time to grow her rice, and she needs some money to support her crop. To improve her production, Mrs. Som K. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to plow her field. Through this activity, she supports three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The other is attending local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and plow her field

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila has owned a business selling foodstuffs for 15 years. She is 48 years old, married and has six children aged between 10 and 25. Her husband works as a gardener. Petronila's loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs such as fresh dairy products, cakes, juice, and soda. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to set up a hair salon. Her dream is to see her children complete their further studies.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk, cakes, juices and soda

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Braulio; el tiene 62 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; el socio se dedica a cultivar flores en su casa el tiene todo un huerto de flores el cual les brinda el cuidado respectivo para poder después venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, el vende al por mayor y menor hasta la ciudad de Quillabamba y Puerto Maldonado,el socio a la vez es maestro de obra el trabaja cada vez que le solicitan en las distintas obras que se realicen el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su huerto de flores.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Mr. Braulio is 62 years old and has a common-law wife and six children.  He grows flowers, which he tends too with great care, on land he owns near his home. He sells his flowers wholesale and retail in the cities of Quillabamba and Puerto Maldonado.  

He is also a civil works teacher who helps out when requested to by ongoing construction sites.  He is a very happy person, with a lot of drive to get ahead for his family.

He plans to use the loan to buy seeds for his flower field.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for his flower field

loans.name: La Bendicion De Xetacabaj Group

texts.en:
Doña Santa is 43 years old and married. She has five children, two currently in school. Although Santa never was able to attend school, she has been able to start and run her own retail clothing business. She started the business using her personal savings and the help of her husband, who works as a baker. Santa has had her business for the past 13 years. She is requesting a loan as a part of ¨La Bendicion D. Xetacabaj¨ group to help grow her business and increase sales with new materials. 

Santa is the featured member of ¨La Bendicion D. Xetacabaj¨ women´s group. The business activities of the other members of the group incluD.: typical clothing sales, food sales, and animal raising. These 17 women have organized to apply for this loan and each will use their portion in their respective businesses.

loans.use: Expand typical clothing sales stall

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a member of Msimamo group in Faulu Kenya. For eleven years, he has been selling firewood. He also earns extra income from his rental houses. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access business loans. He used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business so that he can get enough income to educate his children. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more firewood.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Juana  Petronila

texts.es:
Juana es una madre D. familia D. 65 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío Sialupe del distrito D. Chiclayo, que se encuentra a 5 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. animales menores y aves D. corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD. y en el mercado D. Moshoqueque. 

Ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado y adquirir más animales, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juana is 65 years old and the mother of a family. She resides with her family in the Sialupe settlement of Chiclayo district, some 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Juana raises and sells small farm animals and farm birds, such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, behind her house. When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the businesses who visit the zone where she lives, and in the Moshoqueque market.

Juana wants to acquire farm animal feed and, also, more animals, therefore she is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols.

loans.use: TO ACQUIRE LIVESTOCK FEED AND MORE FARM ANIMALS TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Altantsetseg, 20 years old, lives with her husband and son Ariunerdene, 3, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they live in Altantsetseg’s parents’ neighborhood in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Altantsetseg’s husband has been selling animal feed in the Khangai, one of Ulaanbaatar’s outdoor animal markets, since 2009. Altantsetseg used to work with her husband at the market, but she recently graduated a training course as a beautician. She is planning to run a beauty care business and she has done some projections and planning. She found a proper place to rent and she now needs to buy some beauty care equipment from China to open the salon. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy her equipment and to open her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy beauty care equipment and to open her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tynymkan's Group

texts.en:
Tynymkan M. is the leader of this group. She is 65 and, unfortunately, is a widow. She has a son, 40, who is handicapped. Sixteen years ago, Tynymkan started to breed farm animals. At present, she has two cattle and twelve sheep. She has applied for a loan because she wants to improve her living conditions. She wants to purchase plastic windows and install them in her house. In the future, Tynymkan wants to increase the number of livestock and dreams of finding a cure for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase plastic windows.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been in this business for 27 years. Her main products are milk, vegetables, fruits, bananas, and maize which she sells locally. She depends on farming to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

Rose is requesting a loan of 62,400 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the dairy cow, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from the sale of milk will help meet the basic needs of her family.

Her major challenges have been animal diseases, which are very expensive to treat, and the high cost of animal feeds especially during the dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 17 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has been earning a living as a rice farmer in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from trading rice that she buys. 

Gemma is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El joven Javier, tiene 35 años de edad, es moto taxista  trabaja desde el 2009 eligió  este tipo de trabajo por que le parecía  muy  rentable, javier es soltero con el esfuerzo que ha puesto en su vida se compró  su propia moto taxi, vive en casa  de sus  padres, tiene  buenas referencias por parte de sus compañeros de trabajo y de sus vecinos,javier  es una persona muy emprendedora las dificultades que enfrenta diariamente, es la competencia que tiene día a día, enfrenta esta competencia trabajando de lunes a domingo, el dinero del prestamo sera invertido en comprar accesorio para su unidad de transporte,su sueño en el futuro es tener otra moto taxi y formar su su propia familia, javier esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: The young man, Javier, is 35 years old. He has been a motorcycle taxi driver since 2009; he chose this type of work because he thought it was very profitable. Javier is single and with the great efforts that he puts into his life, he bought his own motorcycle taxi. He lives in his parents’ home and has good references by his workmates and neighbors. Javier is a very enterprising person as he faces his daily obstacles like competition by working Monday through Sunday. The money from the loan will be used to buy accessories for his motorcycle taxi. His dreams are to have another motorcycle taxi and to have his own family. Javier is very grateful for the support that is being given to him.

loans.use: buy accessories for his motorcycle taxi like a grill, chains and other items.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and works hard to support her family. For the past nine years she has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Elena has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase parts to repair and maintain her motorcycle.

Elena would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase parts to repair and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd who sells perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products in the town's central marketplace. She has already invested about 30,000 Grivnyas in this business; her profit is 5,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda came from a small town and started her enterprise three years ago. Today, Nadezhda is an independent young lady. She owns a container-store, as her shop is housed in a large metal shipping container often used for transporting cargo. Containers can also be used for storage, and make an ideal shelter from which market vendors can sell merchandise.

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and to increase her working capital. She hopes that increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to continue to sustain her business as well as meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 adult children. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 18 years. Rosenie is able to provide food, clothes and other needs of her family through her income from farming.

Rosenie is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She hopes for her farm to be always productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola, aged 56, is married to Shadrack. They are blessed with seven children. She runs a cereals shop that has been in operation for 31 years and earns a monthly profit of KES 7,000.

This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy rice, lentils, maize and beans for resale.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to buy livestock and hopes to have a piece of land in future.

loans.use: To buy cereals like lentils, rice, beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Asunción se unieron con el propósito D. generar mayores ingresos para sus Familias. D. dicha unión surge el comité denominado Mujeres en Acción, donD. todas ellas trabajan dentro D. un ambiente D. respeto, ayuda mutua y en especial D. responsabilidad. El grupo se halla en el décimo cuarto  ciclo dentro del programa.
La señora Gloria tiene una peluquería, por medio D. este negocio ella obtiene todos los fondos para ayudar a su familia, dándoles a ellos una vida digna y decorosa. Nos comenta que tiene muchas clientas que siempre acuden a su local, ya que Gloria siempre las atienD. con mucha amabilidad y cordialidad. Uno D. sus proyectos es agrandar su local, para que D. esa forma tenga más capacidad y pueda atender a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos para la peluquería, como ser tintes, gel, juego D. tijeras, y otros necesarios para el negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Asunción came together with the idea to create more income for their families and from this gathering came about the communal bank called Mujeres en Acción [Women in Action] where all of them work within an atmosphere of respect, mutual help and especially responsibilities. This group is in the fourteenth cycle within the program.

Glora has a beauty salon and through this business she earns all of the money in order to help her family, giving them an honorable and decent life. She tells us that she has many clients that always come to her shop, and Gloria always serves them with lots of kindness and cordiality. One of her plans is to enlarge the premises in order to have more room and be able to serve more customers.  

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as hair dye, gel, set of scissors, and other necessities for her business. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to purchase hair dye, gel, set of scissors and other necessities for her business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years in City Park market, Nairobi City. She is 47 years old and a single mother with two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of apples, oranges and lemons.

In future Ann hopes to expand her business, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To add to her stock of apples, oranges and lemons for sale.

loans.name: Laura Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Laura Francisca es casada, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó solamente un años de estudios, se dedica a la lavandería de ropa, lleva tres años realizando este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es conserje de una institución.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, ya que espera que tengan un buen futuro, preparándolos a través del estudio.
texts.en:
Laura Francisca is married, is 41 years old, and only went to school for a few years. She washes clothes for a living, and has been doing so for three years. Her husband, who is a caretaker at an institution, helps her.

She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her children’s education, since she hopes that they will have a good future and is preparing them through education.

loans.use: To pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is engaged in the piggery business as her primary source of income. She has been unable to find a better job because she just finished high school and belonged to a poor family, and therefore could not pursue her education.
 
At the age of 61, Dominga still needs to work hard to provide for her family's needs. She dreams of lifting her family from poverty. She also wants to provide the necessities for her pigs and has therefore asked for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy pig feed and vitamins. She hopes this will make the pigs fit and nourished to provide higher sales at disposal time.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 34 years old and married to a lady who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children.

He learned about KADET from marketing done by KADET staff in his "area of abode" (living area). This is his second loan which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies and to buy livestock for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well with enough funding.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Elena is engaged in cooking different viands (dishes) and going around her neighborhood in order to sell them. She has had this business for five years. 

Elena has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more ingredients to use in cooking various dishes, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, spices, and other cooking condiments.

Elena joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to use in cooking viands for sale.

loans.name: Twende S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Twende S.H Group in Western Kenya! Margaret is the facilitator of the Twende S.H group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Margaret was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Margaret will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Twende S.H group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bombé

texts.fr:
Mme Bombé  est une dame qui parait plus jeune que son âge : elle a 71 ans et habite aux environs de la caisse. Elle est  mariée et mère de famille.
Elle exerce le commerce depuis plus de 2 ans avec la vente de fruits : orange, banane, pomme…
Avec les  bénéfices elle  participe à la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
Mrs. Bombé is a 71-year-old lady who looks younger than she is. She is married with children, and she lives near the credit union. 

She has been selling fruit such as oranges, bananas and apples for over two years. She uses her revenue to help with the daily expenditures

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and apples for resale

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas es casado tiene 39 años tiene una hija y un hijo, su hija  ya no depende económicamente es soltera, su hijo menor  está estudiando la educación Secundaria.  El sr. Tomas ve en su hijo  la posibilidad de tenga un mejor futuro y sabe que la única forma de lograrlo es preparándolo para el que termine una carrera universitaria, el tiene todas sus ilusiones puestas en este hijo ya que su hija primogénita estudio únicamente la educación media superior por ver las carencias económicas que había en su hogar y él como padre no quiere ver como su hijo menor trunque su educación al ver que hay necesidad en su hogar, el Sr. Tomas está decidido a trabajar por siempre para que su hijo sea termine una carrera, su hijo necesita una computadora para hacer sus trabajos que le encargan en la escuela ya que en los últimos meses ha estado pagando en renta de computadoras e impresiones y en ocasiones no ha llevado tareas por falta de dinero para la renta de un equipo de computo. Tomas solicita el apoyo para poder adquirir esta computadora y facilitarle la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomas is 39 years old and married.  He has a son and a daughter, but her daughter no longer depends on them financially.  Their young son attends high school.  He sees in his son the potential for a better future and he knows that the only way to achieve this is to prepare him for university.  He has all his dreams riding on his son, because his daughter only studied to junior high school because of the household financial difficulties.  As a father, he doesn’t want his son to miss out on his education because of other needs within the household.

Tomas is always working, so that his son will be able to establish himself in a career.  His son needs a computer to be able to do his homework.  He’s been renting a computer and printer for the past few months and there have been times when he has not been able to complete his homework due to lack of money to pay for computer rentals.  Tomas is asking for support to be able to acquire this computer and facilitate his children’s educations.

loans.use: to buy a computer for homework.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is 27 years old. She has three children to raise with her husband who works in one of the governmental entities in Jordan as an engineer.

Living in Al Balqaa where there are a lot of fruit farms has given her the opportunity to work collecting this fruit such as oranges, apples, olives, etc. for the owners, based on the seasons. But because there are sometimes low seasons, Ibtisam also faces decreases in their income, too, so she started a small business at home selling home products such as cups, glasses, and so on besides working in the farms. 

It has been two years since she started, and now she is applying for a loan to add more home products to what she is selling.

loans.use: to add more home products to what she is selling.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 34 years old. She is married with 7 children between the ages of 5 and 17. She owns a restaurant that she has been running for 12 years. With the loans, she will buy more foodstuffs to use in the restaurant. She hopes to use the profits from the restaurant to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Valeria Tatiana

texts.es:
Valeria Tatiana tiene 24 años es casada vive con el esposo y con los  hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre Tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 2 mese de edad.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Valeria Tatiana se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 2 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta estar con la familia.
texts.en:
Valeria Tatiana is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in the canton of Ventanas. She has three children who are ages 10, 8, and 2 months.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre, which is near the parish of Guare in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Valeria Tatiana is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for two years. She learned this trade from her parents. Her purchases are made at the Jiménez Commericial Center in the city of Ventanas and she sells her products in the same city. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts for taking care of her crops. This will also help increase her family’s income. Her dream is to have a house and a plot of land.

Valeria Tatiana enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts.

loans.name: Rasoa

texts.en: Rasoa is 34 years old, single and the mother of a 14-year-old daughter. She is a very social person and has for the last five years earned a living operating a stall where she sells food. Her business is located in a busy residential area, and her main challenge is a shortage of money to invest in her business. She is applying for a loan for Kes 20,000 to buy cooking oil, flour and charcoal. Her goal for the future is to move her stall into a building and turn it into a restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between 6 and 19 years old who live at home and attend school. For the past eight years, Comfort has been selling cosmetics. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 31 year old married woman from Al Khaledieh, Al Mafraq, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to do home improvements. She would like to build an extra floor to her home. She always is striving to improve her socio-economic conditions for her family.

 * Hanan prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her mother.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Luna Radiante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUNA RADIANTE” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Evelin es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos, confección de prendas de vestir, venta de lencería, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de productos YABAL, venta de cosméticos, venta de empanadas, confección de prendas de militares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Evelin es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su suegra que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió con un pequeño capital, el que posteriormente amplio y en la actualidad por las fiestas de fin de año desea ampliar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

loans.use: Compra de lencería

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married with three children.  She received schooling through the end of junior high school.  

Currently, Ekua runs a drugstore in Domenase near Elmina.  She has been involved in this industry for about four years now.  Her husband is a taxi driver. Ekua’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Ekua will use the loan to increase her drugstore’s inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Ekua plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her drugstore’s inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: I am a 32-year-old mother of 3.  I take care of 3 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for the 3 in secondary school. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $2 a day

loans.use: I will use the loan to buy more high quality clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a restaurant inside the market. He began his business with the help of his wife, who encouraged him to buy a location in the market. In the beginning, they only sold breakfasts. Now they offer both breakfasts and lunches. He will use the loan to buy industrial-style kitchen equipment and to make improvements to the restaurant. David has faith that his business will grow with the improved service and comfort he will be able to give to his customers. David is 46 years old and married, with four children who are all studying. Life hasn’t been easy for David, working together with his wife to provide food, education, and clothing for his family. David hopes that this loan will help him save up to build his house and to educate to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene un restaurante dentro del mercado. El empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa quien la motivo para comprara un modulo en el mercado. Al principio solo vendían desayunos. Ahora continúan ofreciendo este producto junto con almuerzos. El usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una cocina industrial y adecuaciones del local. David tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con el mejor servicio y comodidad que dará a sus clientes. David tiene 46 años casado, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. Para David la vida no ha sido fácil teniendo que trabajar junto con su esposa para dar alimentación, estudios y vestimenta. El depende totalmente de su negocio para salir adelante con su familia. David tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darle educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy new kitchen equipment

loans.name: Hoe Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Hoe Thi T., 43 years old, and her husband Uyen Van Nguyen are owners of a store front that husk rice. They currently live in Hung Yen province which is in the northern region of Vietnam. With three school-aged children, they are the primary labor workers in the family. Along with their family savings, they plan to use the loan amount of USD$1200 to purchase more rice to husk, thereby increasing their productivity and potential earnings.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phung Pham, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Hòe, 43 tuổi và anh Nguyễn Văn Uyên là chủ nhân của của một cửa hàng xay xát gạo. Họ đang sống tại Hưng Yên, một tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam. Với 3 con còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học, hai anh chị là lao động chính trong gia đình. Đây là một công việc rất vất vả khi với một khối lượng gạo rất lớn chỉ có hai người lao động. Do trên địa phương cũng có một số cửa hàng làm dịch vụ này nên anh chị cũng cần có một số vốn tương đối để tăng tính hiệu quả khi thu mua thóc gạo. Cộng với số vốn sẵn có của gia đình, anh chị muốn vay 1200 USD từ Quỹ Tình thương để dùng cho công việc kinh doanh tăng thu nhập.

loans.use: buy rice to husk and sell it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motor bike to use as a taxi

loans.name: Saul Hipolito

texts.es:
Saúl has a small tailor shop set up at home which is located downtown Danli. He has been a tailor for many years and this activity has allowed him to support his family. This business is doing very well; Saúl has picked up ongoing orders to make pants to be sold in San Isidro market (Tegucigalpa). He makes dozens of pairs of pants to supply these orders, so he needs to have enough fabric in stock. Now that the Christmas season is coming, the orders have grown and clothes will sell well. Saúl’s expectation is to get a sewing machine with the profits of the incoming season. He believes that taking care of the family is the most important thing.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Saul, cuento con una pequeña sastreria en mi casa de habitacion, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente me va muy bien con mi negocio ya que hice unos contratos permanentes para la elaboracion de pantalones de tela los cuales son vendidos en el mercado San Isidro en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, fabrico los pantalones por docena, en estos momentos necesito tener mucho inventario de telas ya que tengo un pedido muy grande por motivo que vienen las fiestas navideñas y la ropa se vende muy bien, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme una maquina de costurar y alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante.

loans.use: To buy suiting fabric, zippers, reels of thread, buttons, and hangers.

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
At Yamoransa station near cape coast is a well known chop bar operator Madam Grace Cramson. She is a chop bar operator and has a lots of customers. Her customers are drivers, passengers who use the Accra – Cape Coast highway and people in and around yamoransa area. She is married and has three children aged 22, 12 and 7 years. Her husband is a driver and he has his own vehicle. Madam Cramson is a hardworking woman. She has a drinking spot too. To help the finances of her family, she also sells all kinds of assorted drinks eg. Minerals, some locally made drinks such as kasapreko, oprim quansah, schnapps etc.
One challenge that Madam Cramson faces is that she always runs out of drinks because she have to make an advance payment before she receives supply from her suppliers such as coca cola company of Ghana and the Ghana Breweries.
She is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,000 dollars to enable her buy more crates of minerals (malta Guinness, coca cola, fanta, sprite etc) to fill her drinking spot attached to her chop bar.

loans.use: To buy more crates of minerals (malta Guinness, coca cola, fanta, sprite etc) to fill her drinking spot attached to her chop bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more fruits to make juice and buy a juicer

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
Matilde G. is a hardworking lady who, from a very young age, has dedicated herself to the sale of all types of seafood. More specifically, she carries out her business in the market of the city of León. She began selling these types of products because, as a single mother supporting four children, she did not have a stable source of income.

With the experience she gained over time, her business grew stronger. Currently, she is located in the market -- a busy site visited by many people looking to make purchases.

Matilde has worked with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels very satisfied with the loans she has been granted for the purchase of her seafood. Her immediate need is to purchase more such product to offer for sale. She has a record of 12 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde G. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de mariscos de todo tipo vendidos en la ciudad de Leon específicamente en el mercado la terminal. Inicia con la venta de estos productos debido a que no percibía ingresos estables ya que es madre soltera y con la necesidad de mantener a sus 4 pequeños. Por esta razón es que comercializa estos productos.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, actualmente el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado la Terminal donde es muy visitado por muchas personas que llegan a realizar sus compras a este local.

Matilde trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados para la compra de sus mariscos. Su necesidad actual es la compra de los productos para su respectiva venta. Ella tiene un record de 12 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with four children, ages three, ten, fifteen, and twenty. She owns a small poultry store, which she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.

In the past, Maria has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She would now like a loan to buy more poultry for the store and to open new business.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to sell and open a new business

loans.name: Block B Abuja 2040-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is 34-year-old Charity K., married to a peasant and they have a 11 year old child. She is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to construct a hotel. Each week, Charity makes approximately 70 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy cattle,construct houses for rent and pay the school fees for her child.

Charity is joined in her small group by Catherine T., Esterina E., Charity B., and Joice P.. Catherine T. has a business in selling charcoal and wants to increase her inventory of charcoal.

Esterina E. is currently operating a business in selling charcoal and wants a loan to open up a shop.

Charity B. operates a business of selling beer and wants to expand her business.

Joice P. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: Construct  hotel, buy charcoal for sale, expand business to buy livestock.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta K. is 35 years old. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a welder and has a small workshop.

Fanta sells palm oil and diesel fuel wholesale and she would like to expand her business to earn more income. Four of Fanta’s children are in school and both parents need to work hard to earn enough to meet their educational expenses. Therefore, Fanta is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 ($1200 USD).

Fanta wants to increase the amount of palm oil and diesel fuel that she purchases at one time, so that she can sell more on a consistent basis without running out. She needs a loan from Kiva for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and diesel fuel in bulk to resell

loans.name: Comité Esperanza Y Fe Group

texts.es:
This committee from the neighborhood San Pedro Curupayty arose from contact with another group formed in the same neighborhood. They have had meetings required for the formation of the group and the committee is currently composed of 15 women workers.

The activities of these women are as follows: grocery stores, seamstresses, hairdressers, selling clothes, cosmetics sales, selling various goods, selling groceries, selling fish, selling underwear, sale of silver jewelry and others.

Each member receives on average 800,000 Gs (approximately US $200). The goal of these loans is to expand their business with the purchase of goods and supplies such as: fabrics, yarn, buttons, elastic, zippers, flours, plan, canned goods, beverages, clothing, articles for hair products, cosmetics, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C.Smith , Kiva volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio San Pedro Curupayty ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en el mismo barrio. Se han realizado las reuniones requeridas para la conformación y actualmente el comité esta integrado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costureras, peluquería, venta de ropas, venta de cosméticos, venta de mercaderías varias, venta de comestibles, venta de pescados, venta de ropa interior, venta de joyas de plata y otros.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 800.000 Gs. El destino de estos créditos son para ampliar sus negocios con la compra de más mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, artículos para el cabello, productos cosméticos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, hair products, raw materials for preparing meals, meals, canned goods, rice, noodles and drinks in general, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, lace, cosmetics, jewelry, seeds, purchase of seeds to grow, and others items

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. runs a grocery store in the Chanika area of Dar Es Salaam. She has been self-employed for the past six years, and learned her business and entrepreneural skills from an organization known as the Youth Self-Employment Foundation. She has applied for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 31 years old, married and has two children ages 12 and 5. In 2001, she went into business selling juice and biscuits. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25.

Fatma has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chris

texts.en: Chris O. is 42 years old, and he is married with 4 children. He lives in Uromi Town, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in the ice cream and drink selling business for the past 9 years. He also sews clothes and renders laundry services. He is a LAPO client. He needs the loan of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar A. is 33 years old and is married with one son. Bakhtiyar is a cattleman. He has been raising cattle for about 9 years. He works hard. His son is getting older and their needs are growing. He dreams of being able to provide his son and future children with everything they need. 

His business is quite stable and generates the main income for the family, but does not generate enough to expand the current business. He requests $1200 USD to purchase one cow and two calves. This is Bakhtiyar's first loan. He thanks all who support him for their trust, and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida has been selling juice and water in Zanzibar for three years. She begins work at 7 a.m. every morning and earns approximately $45 in profit each month. She intends to use her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more juice and water so that she can increase sales and profit at her shop.

Hamida is married and has five children, ages 18, 16, 11 and 3 years old and one infant of 2 months.

loans.use: To buy more juice and water to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Mrs. Sarum K. is a villager in Ream Ankdeouk Village in Kampong Chnang Province; she is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She is a fruit seller in the local market, but as a widow it is difficult to make ends meet in her household. To improve her situation, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Riel with a plan to use the loan to purchase a wider variety of fruit to resell and thus expand her customer base.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to resell

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es: La señora Maria Hernández tiene la edad de 56años,  habita en el sector de la Francia numero uno  ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo Y  hijas, su esposo  de la señora trabaja como transportista y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa al igual que sus hijas trabajan y aporta para los gastos del hogar, esta señora es comerciante y a la vez se dedica a la agricultura  desde hace treinta años la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es falta de financiamiento por lo cual no a sacado una producción muy buena por falta de insumos , los sueños de doña Maria es llegar a expandir sus cultivos para ayudarles a sus hijas y  brindarle un mejor  futuro .con esta solicitud va a comprar abonos y venenos para sus cultivo y lograr a si una buena producción, Por lo cual ella solicita la mano amiga de afodenic para obtener ferlitizantes necesarios a sus para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Hernández is 56 years old and lives in Ticuantepe along with her husband and daughters. Her husband works as a driver and helps her with household expenses, and her daughter also work and help with the bills. Maria is a merchant and at the same time has been making a living as a farmer for the past 30 years. The biggest problem she has is a lack funding, which doesn't allow her to get a good yield from her crops because she can't afford enough planting supplies. Maria's dream is to be able to expand her crops so she can better help her children and provide them with a better future. With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops and hopefully achieve a better yield. For this, she turns to Kiva partner AFODENIC so she can get the necessary fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 32 years old, married with 4 children of whom one is in school. This hardworking lady sells motor spare parts in Iganga town. She earns an average of Ush 500,000 profits per month, from which she pays Ush 100,000 monthly rent. The loan proceeds are helping Sarah purchase yana tyres, and some brake pads.

Based on her 5 years' experience in the business, Sarah now dreams of opening up a number of spare parts outlets around the country hoping the income from the business will enable her to build a modern residence for her family.

loans.use: To purchase yana tyres and some brake pads.

loans.name: Som Ol

texts.en: Mr. Som Ol M. is a villager in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a rice miller who is a rice middleman. His wife, Mrs. Heim Neang, owns a small grocery store and also breeds pigs. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Som Ol M. is requesting a loan to buy 12 more piglets and pig feed for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is 46 years old and the father of three children who attend the local school. His wife is shown in the photo to his left.

loans.use: To expand a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. is thirty-five years old. She is a married woman with four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is in senior high school, one is in junior high and the rest are in primary school. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

Paulina lives with her family in a house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Paulina trades in fresh yams to help support her husband financially. She says she also fries some for sale. She procures the fresh yams from Techiman, where the price is quite economical, then sells the yams on a table top in front of her house. She has been in business for ten years. Paulina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure tubers of yams in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yams

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua D. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is learning a trade while the rest are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a farmer and commercial driver.

Akua is into palm oil production. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She says she also harvests some of the palm from her husband’s farm. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Akua wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in business for 15 years and is hoping to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her palm oil business

loans.name: Fiataua

texts.en: Fiataua S., 70, is married with 11 children. She has two years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 425 Tala.  SPBD loans are Fiataua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase spades, wheelbarrow, fertilizer, and chemicals

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед и его жена живут в поселке городского типа Шуроб. Доход жителей данного поселка раньше был за счет угольной шахты расположенной неподалеку, так как все там работали. Сейчас шахта не работает и жители перебиваются различными видами заработков. Чамшед посоветовавшись с родителями решил открыть небольшой магазинчик и стал там торговать с женой. За товаром ездит Чамшед, а жена ему помогает в магазинчике. Чамшеду 24 года, имеет 2 детей. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает уже 1,5 года и сейчас собирается получить новый займ для расширения своего маленького бизнеса.
texts.en:
Chamshed and his wife live in a town-like village called Shurob. The income of the residents of this village previously came from a coal mine located nearby as everyone worked there. Now the mine does not work and the residents get by via different methods of earning money. Chamshed after discussing it with his parents decided to open a small store and started selling there with his wife. He travels to purchase products and his wife helps him at the store. Chamshed is 24 years old and has 2 children. He has worked with MicroInvest for 1.5 years now and now plans to take out a new loan to grow his small business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Paraíso” están representados por la señora Melby y conformados por 12 miembros dedicados en su mayoría al comercio D. diferentes productos como cosméticos, comida, zapatos, ropa y abarrotes algunos D. los miembros se dedican a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, al servicio D. peluquería y al transporte público pero todos ellos cuentan con una fuente D. ingresos. Dentro del mercado existe mucha competencia en la cual los socios deben competir por ganar clientes y poder generar un ingreso diario para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la mejora D. sus herramientas D. trabajo, compra D. insumos y materiales para poder prestar un servicio D. mayor calidad y un producto más competitivo para el mercado. En lo que respecta a la experiencia una mayoría D. los socios ya trabajo con grupos solidarios en nuestra institución por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y cuentan con la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Paraíso" are represented by Señora Melby, and are composed of 12 members who for the most part work in the sale of different products such as cosmetics, shoes, clothing, food, and other groceries. Other members work in the manufacture of wooden furniture, haircutting, and in public transportation, but all of them currently rely upon a steady source of income. Within the market there is much competition in which the members must compete in order to gain customers and generate a daily income to sustain their families. This loan is designated to be put toward the improvement of the members' tools of work, and toward the purchase of goods and materials for their businesses, so that they will be able to offer higher quality services and more competitive products in the market. With respect to their experience, the majority of the members have already worked with affiliated communal banking groups, and have proven themselves to know the morality of work, and the responsibility they must exert to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. is fifty-three years old, married, and has four children: three sons and a daughter. Some are in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. John’s wife is a trader.

John deals in hardware – paints, glue, locks, carpentry tools, etc. which he sells in a shop by the roadside. John buys his wares from big shops in nearby towns such as Kumasi. He has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in large quantity. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy hardware in large quantity

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa K. est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Lomé. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Kossiwa désire avec ce crédit acheter des sacs de maïs, mils, haricots et riz pour la revente. Elle opère dans ce secteur depuis 6 ans.
texts.en:
Kossiwa K. is a retailer of grains at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. She would like to use this loan to buy sacks of corn, millet, beans, and rice to sell. She has been operating in this field for six years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, millet, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana vende mercadería como ser carteras, bolsas, chamarras de cuero.
Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería ( Chamarras, carteras bolsas, de cuero).
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y la quinta vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juliana sells merchandise like leather wallets, leather bags, and leather jackets. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz in a rented house. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (leather jackets, leather wallets, and leather bags). This is the sixth time she has requested a loan from Impro, and the fifth time that she has requested the support of Kiva. Her history qualifies her as a good client in terms of making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Moses Wainaina

texts.en:
Moses K. is 24-years old and married with one child. He lives and carries out his business in the Githurai 45 neighborhood of Nairobi.

Moses shines shoes and sells secondhand clothes.  His clients are middle-class income earners in the urban setting. Before taking loans from KADET, Moses never borrowed from any MFI. He was introduced to KADET by a friend.

This will be his first loan and he is requesting it to set up a proper shop for shoe shining and selling secondhand clothes.  One day, he hopes to own a fleet of public transport vehicles.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To set up a shop for shoe shining and selling second hand clothes

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 24 años, es un joven padre de familia que vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, a quien ama mucho. Por el momento habitan en la casa de sus padres. Asimismo, ellos le facilitan sus chacras para que pueda realizar sus propias siembras, ya que aun no posee terrenos propios, adicionalmente también trabaja en los cultivos de papa de sus padres, quienes le pagan por su trabajo. Cuando su esposa le propuso sembrar arvejas, David aceptó muy contento tal propuesta, ya que ha visto que varios vecinos, gracias a este cultivo se han levantado rápidamente y él también espera tener buenas cosechas. Con las ganancias que vayan obteniendo desean construir su propia casa, en aras de evitar algún problema futuro por vivir todos juntos. Por lo demás, está muy contento con sus cultivos de arvejas y más aún porque no tiene que realizar mucha inversión en fertilizantes, puesto que usa las tierras que sus padres abonaron para la papa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado pagó puntualmente sus cuotas y también asistió a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy bien en compañía de sus demás compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de dos bolsas de arvejas y fungicidas para evitar las plagas.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and a young father. He lives with his common law partner and the mother of his son, whom he loves very much. At the moment, they live in his parents’ house. They also allow David to use their fields so that he can grow his own crops, since he does not yet have his own land. He also cultivates his parents’ potato crops, and is compensated for this work.

David’s wife suggested that he begin planting peas. He happily accepted her advice because he has several neighbors who are potential customers. Thanks to his wife’s suggestion, this crop is growing rapidly and he also hopes to have a good harvest. With the profits he will earn, he plans to build his own house to avoid problems that exist with his current living situation. He is very happy with his crop of peas because it doesn't require much fertilizer and it occupies the same land used for growing potatoes.

This is David’s second loan with MFP. During the last cycle, he made all of his payments and attended every one of his communal bank meetings, which was appreciated by the other members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase two bags of peas (seedlings) and fungicides to prevent infestation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase peas (seedlings) & fungicides

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is 38 years old and she is a 'sari-sari' store owner. Aside from that, she is also a rice farmer and pig-raiser in Trento Agusan Del Sur. She has two children and the 19-year-old is her eldest. Her husband is a farmer and both of them work hard on their farm and barn to have an abundant harvest and healthy pigs.

The reason why she wanted to apply for a loan from CEVI is to buy additional merchandise, rice seeds, and piglets. She also wishs to buy pig feed in case she is granted a CEVI/KIVA loan.

She likes CEVI so much because aside from loans, they are offering education for all their clients.

loans.use: additional merchandise, rice seed, and piglets

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda  es  una persona colaboradora y dinámica, tiene 66 años de edad, tiene seis hijos  mayores de edad y profesionales. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, tiene un pequeño negocio frente a su casa, ella es muy conocida por ser una persona atenta . Integra el Banco Comunal “ Las Águilas”  desde hace cinco años y siempre ha sido una socia puntual. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio actual. 
Con este crédito de S/. 1000 soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, debido a que planifica aperturar una tienda de abarrotes con algunos productos básicos aptos para el consumo humano (arroz, azúcar, fideos, ,etc.). La meta de Florinda es tener una tienda bien surtida de productos y también tener una negocio de lubricentro, en esto va a trabajar con una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Florinda is dynamic and helpful. She is 66, mother of 6 who are all adults and professionals. She works selling soft drinks and has a small business in front of her house. She is known as a courteous person. Part of the communal bank “Las Aguilas” for the past 5 years, her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to open her current business. With this loan of 1000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries, since she plans to open a grocery store with some basic products for human consumption (rice, sugar, noodles, etc). Florinda’s goal is to have a well-stocked store and also to have an oil change shop where one of her daughters will work.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a supply of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: El Milagro 2 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the group coordinator for Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) El Milagro (The Miracle).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and also more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients.  Juana lives in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic.  Her house has unreliable access to running water and electricity.  She lives in her mother's house with her three-year-old son. 

Juana has successfully completed three loans with Esperanza and this is her fourth.  She sells accessories and clothes from her home to others in her community.  She would like to continue to expand her business by finding new clients and selling more products. She wants to spend time looking for clients who are reliable and will pay her what they owe her for her products. 

Juana's dream is to someday have enough money to have her own house.  Right now she and her son live with her mother, but she hopes to make enough money with her business to be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To buy accessories and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is a breadwinner for the family of five. This is his second loan from the microfinance institution. His first loan was $2,500 for his mini-market. With that loan he was able to increase his income and make regular and timely loan repayments. This loan is to purchase a vertical refrigerator and inventory for his store.

loans.use: To buy a vertical refrigerator and inventory for his store

loans.name: Nelda Ebil

texts.es: Doña Nelda Ebil es soltera, tiene 2 niños,  una pequeña productora que está solicitando su 1er credito  para invertirlo en compra de ternero desarrollo y aumentar su inventario ganadero, se dedica a la actividad ganadera y agricola desde muy joven obteniendo ingresos económicos que le permiten el sosten familiar.  Nilda Ebil  posee su finca en una comarca de Nueva Guinea la cual presenta buenas condiciones técnicas para el desarrollo del hato gandero, también realiza todas las actividades de sanidad animal y nutricional brindandoles manejo fitosanitario para su inventario ganadero, sus hijos le ayudan al trabajo del campo, ella es una mujer emprendedora que lucha dia a dia con su pequeños niños para salir adelante, espera ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva, su mayor sueño es tener buen inventario ganadero, para ayudarle al núcleo familiar y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nelda Ebil is single, and she has two children. She is a small producer who is asking for her first loan. She will buy a calf to raise and increase her cattle inventory. She has worked with cattle and in farming since she was very young. She was able to get income that allowed her to support her family. Nelda Ebil has a farm in the Nueva Guinea region. It has good conditions for raising herds of cattle. She also works in the area of animal health and nutrition. She manages the health for her inventory of cattle. Her children help her with the field work. She is a hard-working woman who fights day to day to get her small children ahead. She hopes to receive a loan from Kiva. Her biggest dream is to have a good inventory of cattle. This will help her family have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four calves

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: P. has been married for years and is blessed with two kids. P. is a garment factory worker who gets a salary of $7 each month. Her husband, Khun Samphors, 38 years old, drives a motorbike taxi. Recently, P.’s husband hasn't been able to earn as much income as before, because his taxi is too old and not attractive to the customer. Because of that, P. is requesting a loan of $1000 for her husband to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. Julieta T., 44 years of age, is widow and is a resident of Bintana, Tangub City. She is blessed with 8 children. One of her children is married and three are still minors. To support her family, she buys and sells bananas in her area. Her neighbors provide her banana supply. She started this buy and sell business 6 years ago. She now earns an average net income of PHP 2500.00 a month. She is also supported by her children who work for different employers. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just a year ago because she was interested in our products and services and because we are one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and won an award for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. As member of the PDP-LP Program, because of her outstanding credit record, she was able to borrow multiple loans. 

For her fourth loan, Julieta is privileged to to borrow PHP 14,000 to add her capital to her banana business. She will use the additional income that she earns from her investment for her family's basic needs and as savings for her children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her banana business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam B. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Meriam owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Meriam joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Meriam is now requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Concepcion is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a business of buying and selling of a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Concepcion is just starting this business.

In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pamela Sandra

texts.es:
La Srta. PAMELA, es una cliente que ingreso a la institucion el 2008, es una cliente que trabaja exclusivamente con la Institucion, de ahí que se lo toma en cuenta para que ingrese al programa Kiva, para cubrir sus nesecidades de estudios, ella se encuentra estudiando y trabajando a la ves es una persona responsable y trabajadora, tambien ayudar con la manutención de sus hermanos menores ya que ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, de su familia es la unica que trabaja, ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar.

El destino del credito sera para la compra de material escolar que le  ayudara para el crecimiento de su actividad, y fortalecimiento en su capital de trabajo.

La Srta. Pamela esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Pamela is a client who joined the institution in 2008 and works exclusively with us. She joined the Kiva program to cover her necessities for her studies. Currently, she is studying and working at the same time. She is a responsible and hardworking person who also helps support her younger brothers, who are of school age. In her family, she is the only one who works and takes care of all of the domestic expenses.. This credit will be used for the purchase of school materials, which will help her grow and strengthen her working capital. Pamela is very appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to her through the grant of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school materials

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Ourng R. is a villager who lives with other family members in Kampong Chhnang province. She cultivates a rice crop to make a living. She is a widow blessed with four children. Two are married, and the others are single. A daughter works as a dealer in a casino club. Ourng R. is taking out her loan to buy housing materials that she will use to construct a new house.

loans.use: To buy housing materials.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhon K. is 43 years old and he is a villager who lives in Srae Vong village in TaK. province. He is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field where he cultivates rice. His wife is a grocery seller and also a pig breeder, from which she can earn a small income to support her family.

Mr. Sokhon K. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy piglets, pig food, and the rest of the loan he will use to purchase supplies to support his farming activities. This couple has five children, one of whom is seamstress in the garment factory, another one is a laborer in Malaysia, while the other three are students in the local school and also help their parents' businesses. His wife is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig food, and farming supplies.

loans.name: Josephine
